After we had made the food we had great conversation with the BC family and they all made us feel very welcomed. Keep up the good work BC!

Great experience. The wonderful, friendly staff at BC Family tour made the day fun, informative and most of all delicious. We came out feeling like master chefs with a better understanding of Vietnamese culture in general too, Thank you for one of the highlights of our trip.

Awesome experience with BC Family! . My experience with BC was great!! Shortly after meeting the staff at their office, I was invited to a birthday dinner for one of the ladies at the office! They really treated me like a great friend right away, and the service I booked went smoothly. I would recommend them!

The Best Food Tour!. I thoroughly enjoyed my tour with BC Family. Everything was well thought of and the people were lovely. The tour guides were very knowledgeable and even helped us by teaching us some vietnamese words and recommending foods to eat! Would definitely recommend this to anyone!
Second trip to Hanoi. There is so much too see and do while walking through the old Quarter, visiting all the lovely sites and engaging with the bargaining locals,

Friendly tour guide plus great food!. I stayed with BC and booked a city tour with them. The tour included museum visits and food tour. Did I mention it was a motorbike tour? It was so much fun seeing Hanoi on a bike! My friendly tour guide, Linh, took me to some of the best places to eat in the city. I wish there was more time because I truly enjoyed a lot.

Hanoi Oi Saveloy. We stayed with BC and also booked our transportation with them. During our stay they were super friendly and always offered us to grab lunch with them or offered to share their snacks. They know Hanoi inside and out and really showed us some of the best places to eat and drink in the city (and certainly the best morning pho in vietnam). When I go back to Vietnam I will definitely be in touch with BC family.

Friendly staff, great services - will be back again. That was the first time I've been to Hanoi and felt in love with BC Family. I regretted that I can only stay for almost 2 days but guess what I will definitely come back again.

Friendly and helpful. I'm really glad I decided to stay at BC Family Homestay. Everyone there has been really friendly, and always been able to provide useful advice. The homestay is small and cosy, and is located centrally in old Hanoi, right where all the action is. Everyday the BC familymembers go out to eat breakfast, lunch and dinner and you have the opportunity to tag along for some really nice company and to take advantage of their knowledge of the local food scene. I'd like to thank Denis, Sam, Daisy and Luxia for be being so nice to be around and making my stay in Hanoi such a great experience!

Wonderful Help. I needed a hotel at the last minute in Hanoi, and I am very lucky that I found BC Family! They were not only able to get me a room almost immediately at a partner hotel (which was a very nice place), but they were more than helpful in offering advice and helping me arrange transportation around Hanoi. Unfortunately, I never had the time to participate in their group activities (which range from tours to having dinner with locals and travelers, alike), but I could see that the other travelers going through BC Family were having a wonderful time. Next time I am in Hanoi I will certainly be getting in contact with BC Family.

A unique experience!!. BC Family organized for me an amazing and complete two days tour to Sapa!! During the tour I met funny travelers and I had a beautiful experience enjoying the life of the ethnic minorities living the small villages around sapa! Speechless! :) The tour was exactly how I read on the book guide! Our travel guide was a nice and polite guy from Vietnam speaking a good english!! We had dinner at the home stay with the tribe family and enjoy what they call the 'happy water'!! Try it to find out what is it!!Thanks again for everything!! Angelo

Staying and doing a tour. BC Family was a great place and bunch of people for a solo traveller to visit. Sam suggested a great tour and was very helpful with suggestions about where to eat (I eat vegan if possible). I needed to run some errands, and they took me on their scooters to get them done. Plus they are doing work helpful for society. I'd like to participate more in that, if possible

They helped with everything. From the beginning BC Family have been helpful and accommodating. Me and my friends weren't sure about what tours we wanted to do so I was constantly emailing them back and forth to get descriptions and prices of the tours. They were quick on their response and always friendly and helpful.We ended up doing the tour around Hanoi on bicycles for the first day and our guide, Jack, a University student was knowledgeable and fun.They then organised a tour for us to Ha Long Bay which was beautiful with so much yummy food.Before we flew out we wanted to do a tour to the snake village. BC Family let us leave all our bags at their offices so we wouldn't have to carry them around.The Snake village was definitely an experience that we are glad we did.All 50 of the emails that was exchanged back and forth was definitely worth it. We had a great time and I would recommend them to anyone.

Perfect for a family vacation. My family had BC Family organize an unforgettable tour to Sapa, Vietnam. We did not stay in a luxurious hotel, but rather enjoy a homestay experience. The host were very helpful and considerate, we really felt like their family members. Sapa was romantic with colorful costumes, flowers and old architecture. Taking a herbal bath is a must, I felt like I was 5 years younger after taking one. I also highly recommend that you try some dishes during the night market, you would regret if you miss them!

Taking a food tour is a must for Hanoi travelers. I was staying in BC Family Hotel and often visited their office for a chitchat. Luckily, they offered me a food tour at night, starting at 5pm. We rode our motorbike up to Long Bien bridge and tried some grilled sweet potatoes and corn. They sure tasted nice in a cold winter night. I was really impressed with the view from the bridge, life around the river was so different from that of the city. The food I liked best was rice crust, served with a special kind of shrimp sauce. I have never tasted something even the slightest similar to that, truly unforgettable.

BC Family, Thank you!. We had 4 days Hanoi tour. This is short but enough to enjoy the beauty of Hanoi, Vietnam. We stayed at BC Family tour home stay and hotel. The staff are friendly and accommodating from picking-up us from airport to hotel on late hours, arranging our tours and bringing us safely back home.I really enjoyed most the food tour and cruise. We roam around city lights back riding motorcycles with BC Family funky and friendly staffs. We took pictures while riding and hopping onto food stalls and restaurants. I loved the egg coffee being a coffee addict and the spring rolls really.The cruise is just perfect. Not crowded, warm guests, classy rooms, friendly staffs and delicious food. We visited cave, swam, some does rowing and we were also taught how to make spring rolls too. I really appreciate the hospitality and professionalism of BC Family. I am also thankful for making our short vacation to a very memorable one. We will treasure the friendship you have shown us. BC Family is not just a service provider but really a Family.

All the best of Vietnam in 8 days with BC Family Tour. Eight days is not a long enough time to enjoy all the tourism areas of Vietnam, so I had to focus on just Hanoi and Da Nang. However, everything I experienced was of the best. I cannot forget the cold atmosphere and bright sunlight in the early winter of Hanoi, the misty mystical Sword Lake, and the hubbub at the Old Quarter. Da Nang was even more amazing with blue beaches, white sand, green mountains, sacred holy temple and breathtaking view from the cable car. BC really provided an excellent service, because whenever something unexpected happened, we called them and received an almost immediate support. At the Old Quarter, I was accompanied by a volunteer of BC who showed around! Hanoi was the most impressive to me.

Hey guys...have a read.... Hi there, my name's Dennis I come from italy and I went staying in BC Family for more then 10 days in the middle of December 2014.I was traveling South-east Asia as a solo traveler for exactly three months. I saw lots of places and I went in many different kind of accommodation where I met lovely people most of the time. I'm a quite good backpacker since long time agò...so I just loved it !But...this is the good and exclusive BC FAMILY's point...cuz it makes the difference !Bc Family it's not a hostel, not a hotel nothing of that, nothing which reminds you a typical even if good accommodation...Bc it's a world, it's a Big Family...it's something new which is growing fast on the right way...Bc is the best place I've been staying so far...It's run from young Vietnamese guys who are super friendly, so nice, helpful and...just the best !!!If you wanna get an unforgettable experience in Hanoi...that's the place !!! You can join them for breakfast, lunch, dinner...go for a drink with some of them...they always invite you, they look after you during your stay and even they famous Sapa and Halong Bay tours are stunning !!!This is a new trend of living and traveling if you wanna feel closer to the Country you are visiting !!! Have a good one in Bc...you'll see !!! Cheers ! Denis

BC Tour team is very professional. During our stay in Hanoi we were assisted by this team of dynamic, travel professionals: They promptly arranged a flight for a friend that needed to get home to attend to a personal matter. In addition they arranged good hotels for us during our stay.They took us around Hanoi and exposed us to various delicious Vietnamese dishes and beverages. For example, Bun Bo Nam Bo (a delicious rice noodle dish with beef, fresh herbs and other delicious ingredients) and egg coffee. Egg coffee is way more delicious than it initially sounds, it's a speciality that can only be found in Hanoi. All coffee lovers should definitely try this. In closing, the team made our stay in Hanoi very special and memorable.

Way to go BC Foundation. To make money is easy, but to share it with the underprivileged is not easy at all. It is good to know that you spend a proportion of your profits on philanthropic projects, you have both the required ability of a tour operator and the responsibility of a citizen. I hope your business would cherish so more disadvantaged people could benefit!

Not just food, it is the experience that matters. Asian cuisines are my favorite and BC Family Food tour did a great job to help me understand Vietnamese dishes better! Many thanks to friends at BC Family Tour for the once-in-a-life-time food experience! Grilled ducks, “pho”, fried rice with chicken and so many others that I cannot recall. Good food, great friends! Many thanks to you BCers!

Worth your limited travel time!. There is nothing better than going out at night with friendly Vietnamese friends at BC Family and enjoying the luscious dishes during a noisy night of Hanoi. The food, the atmosphere, the stories of BCers are really unique and memorable! What a precious experience I had with them!

Hanoi, delicious food everywhere!. Every nook and cranny in the Old Quarter seems to hold a food mystery. Some dishes are a bit odd to taste, but astonishing to taste! If you are also a food lover, I will recommend you Food Tour with BC Family. I was really amazed with “pho”, it is mouthwatering and scrumptious! The experience was once in a lifetime, worth a try!

My kids loved it. My family’s two day trip to Ha Long was beyond expectation! The view was incredibly wonderful. My kids really loved the diversity of the shape of the rocky small islands. Each time they happened to see a bird flying out of a rock or a fish splashing, they yelled in happiness! The weather during the trip was nice, seafood was good, especially the shrimps! Thank you BC Family Tour for the exciting trip, my kids really loved the experience!

Come and taste!. Yummy, a night out on Food tour with BCers was unforgettable! I was really impressed with the office staff who knows a lot about Old Quarter street food! Some Asian food sounds strange, but they taste really nice. Com, a special autumn food made from unripe rice fruit and wrapped in lotus leaves, is exquisitely sweetish, never had I tasted something like that before! Maybe next time I would like to see how it is made! A free night walk with BCers and enjoying good food, nothing better!

One of the best cruise trip ever. expect nothing less from a Ha Long Bay Cruise! Everything from the jade green water, the clear blue sky, the rocky mountain of various shapes, the yummy seafood all lived up to their reputation of a natural wonder! The Cruise was clean and well-equipped! I wish I had booked the 2 day and one night instead of the day trip! Next time I am coming there again with my parents! Great job BC Family!

Exciting day tour!. Hanoi in my eyes has become more beautiful and sacred after a day travelling with those young enthusiastic free guides of BC. What strikes me most is the yin yang philosophy of Vietnamese culture, which seems to present in all aspects of life, from culinary, architecture to health care. The guides also shared with me their life, study and future outlook, they truly loved exchanging experience!

Hanoi. I had a great time with one of the tour guides from this group. It was a very personalized trip. He was very accepting of my interests and didn't try to push any agenda onto me. I had an excellent time in Hanoi and was abled to see everything from everyday life to historical landmarks. There was no communication barrier between us and I would recommend this group to anyone interested in visiting Hanoi. Thanks Again!

It's amazing tour. It was an absolutely amazing tour in which I was provided with a fascinating insight into daily life of people living in Sapa and Halong. At the beginning, I had not thought this tour could be that awesome due to a short period of time. After returning home, I knew I need to think again. During the tour, our group had many chances to taste local specialties with BC Family tour. They are very friendly and helpful. I was so in love with them. One thing I liked the most was that after the tour, I could make friends with many member in BC Family tour. They accompanied me for a drink or to eat local food. Generally, I feel very pleased with the organization of this tour.

Egg coffee, why not?. During the night, the Old Quarter was very uproarious with motorbikes and foreign tourists going back and forth. I was taken on a Food Tour by staves of BC Family Tour. Firstly we stopped at the Xoi Yen restaurant, the dish was amazingly delicious with the blending flavor of sticky rice, grilled green bean, chicken and mushroom! After that, I was once again taken aback by the strange taste of the so-called egg coffee. I still remember its taste now but no word can describe it! Most memorable food tour ever!

Great trip to Tam Coc. I had BC Family Tour arrange my tour to Tam Coc. It was really a place of heavenly beauty with fantastic view of the mountains, valley, river, caves and pagoda. I felt so closed to nature being surrounded by wind, water and the green of trees. Interestingly, 15% of profit from BC Family Tour would be spent on philanthropic projects! Then if you want to enjoy the landscape and help others, go with BC Family!

1 week visit in Hanoi. I came to Vietnam not knowing anything much about Vietnam. Neither do I know where to go, what to do in Vietnam. To me this my first solo trip and I was thinking of being spontaneous and do whatever that I find that is fun and meaningful when I just randomly walk around Vietnam. When I first arrived in Hanoi at BC it was near to 12am and Sam the CEO of BC HOMESTAY waited for me till I come. He was very polite and kind. The next day I did not know what to do and so I asked Sam, and he brought me to have breakfast at a local place, the breakfast(pho ga) we ate is really delicious. And all the staffs there are really friendly, the first time I met them I immediately become friend with them and they bring me to a lot places and we talk about a lot of things and had fun. They will also help you arrange your tour in Vietnam if you tell them what you plan to do in vietnam. Really friendly and warm place to be in.A traveller from singapore,Nat

A more amazing group of young people you will not find!. My family of 5 (including 3 children) had the pleasure of being looked after by the BC Family for our entire stay in Hanoi. They booked our accommodation, organised a fantastic bus tour to Hua Lu and Tam Coc, helped me organise a 50th birthday to remember, took us along to volunteer at a hospital and spent an entire day showing us around the beautiful city of Hanoi!We feel very privilege to have spent time with these young Vietnamese people and we now call them friends! If you want to understand the local culture and make some friends the BC family is the only way to go. We had such an amazing time with them that we will definitely be returning to Hanoi and we've invited them to visit us should they make ti to Australia some day!Thank you BC Family - you've made Hanoi our favourite city of our tour :)From the Up Sticks and Go family!

The best tour company. We had four weeks of travel in Vietnam which was completely organised through BC Family Tour.We started the tour in Hanoi and finished in Ho Chi Minh City visiting many places and attractions along the way (including Ha Giang, Yen Minh, Dong Van, Meo Vac, Bao Lac, Cao Bang, Ban Gioc Waterfall, Ba Be Lake/National Park, Tuyen Quang, Hoa Lu, Tam Coc, Sapa, Villages within the Sapa Valley, Ha Long Bay, Hue, Hoian, Nha Trang, Cai Be Floating Market, Vinh Long, Can Tho, Cu Chi Tunnels and Cao Dai Temple). The major highlights from the trip were Ban Gioc Waterfall, the cooking class in Hoian and the couple of days of walking in Sapa.We would definitely choose BC Family Tour again and recommend this company to others looking to visit Vietnam and other parts of South East Asia

1 week in Vietnam with BC Family Tour. My family had a perfect holiday in Vietnam thanks to the companionship of BC Family Tour. The staffs were very friendly and they did help us a lot with our special requirement. In one week in VN, we went to Ha Long Bay, Sapa, Mai Chau and Tam Coc - Bich Dong. Our tour guide, accommodation and meals were all perfect. It was really a wonderful holiday. Thank you BC Family Tour!

Great boat holiday. I had a trip to Halong Bay last week and I booked this tour through BC Family Tour. It was the second time I stayed overnight on a boat. It was really interesting. The scenery in Halong Bay is absolutely amazing. Generally, my boat trip was wonderful; I enjoyed caves visit, kayaking and fishing also. I really want to go back to Halong Bay again and thank BC for organizing my trip so well.

Most meaning tour ever. I was quite interested in volunteer opportunities as I wanted something different from relaxing tours. Therefore, I booked a tour which could satisfy my intention. Bo De Pagoda tour organized by BC was completely wonderful. Now I still remembered the moment I played with children there, observed their daily life and thought about my life. It was the most unique experience I’ve ever had. About the place, nothing to say but “great”, it was just like my second home.
Good bus service. the staff picked us up from our place by a mini van then transfer to the large one, the bus was confort and saff were nice also. would recomend this to every one.

A good way to save a night's accommodation. I booked the whole cabin (4 berths) and, when I boarded I was glad I did. Double decker bunks with just enough room to change your mind. The bunks were reasonable comfortable and with an 8PM departure and a 5AM arrival in Hanoi, you can offset the cost of the train by night travel, however you won't see anything. I was told that if you have spare berths (even thought you have paid for them) the staff may try to "insert" a passenger

Safe and comfortable bus. We booked the bus from Hanoi to Sapa online before our arrival in Hanoi.The price was USD 17 per person one way. For return ticket, the price is 10% cheaper. Since we stayed in Old Quarter, the price included picking us up from our hotel at 6.30am with a minibus which went round to pick up other passengers before boarding the bigger bus.The bus was supposed to leave Hanoi Old Quarter at 7.00am but it was not punctual and finally started the journey at about 7.30am. The seats were big, could be reclined and comfortable. The driving was safe and there was no unhappy incident. The passengers were mainly locals with some Europeans. It stopped twice on the way for toilets use and for food and drinks. It finally reached Sapa at 12.40 pm and stopped opposite U Sapa Hotel near the City square or the Stone Catholic church. From here, most of the city hotels are reachable by walking.The whole journey was very relaxing. We highly recommend it.

Overnight train to Sapa. If you want to visit the rice fields and mountains of Sapa, most people take the overnight trains. There is a highway where the drive would take 5-6 hours, but it is apparently not safe driving. If you book a compartment, I highly recommend only putting two people in each. We had a four person compartment and our children were right under a loud and very cold air conditioning unit which we could not turn off.

Quick and comfortable. Quick way to go from Hanoi to Sapa, taking about 5 hours. The company picks you up from your hotel with a small van, then transfers you to the larger bus for the trip. The main bus has comfortable reclinable seats and plenty of leg room. They provided some bottled water and snacks, and stopped twice along the way for short rests. The bus has WiFi although it was patchy. In Sapa they drop you off in the town centre and offer help to locate your hotel or get a taxi. Same in Hanoi, they drop off near their office and help if you need to get a taxi.

Best way how to get from Hanoi to Sapa. The trip with Sapa Express takes approx 5 hours with two stops. Big air conditioned coaches with wide comfortable and adjustable seats and enough space (only three seats in one row, in total 28 seats). Provided water and small refreshments. English speaking staff. A van collects passengers in the morning from hotels in the centre of Hanoi - make sure you are ready in time, they do not wait. The only downside was that WiFi worked only at the beginning, then it completely disappeared.

comfortable ride but.... I took Sapa Express from Hanoi to Sapa via their limousine bus. They came and picked me up from hotel early in the morning to their bus station for free of charge which was great. The bus ride was comfortable and I would think it would beat the overnight train as well. Chairs were reclining seats and spacious and we were also given snacks and water and had two rest stops break during the 6 hours ride. The only mishap for me was, when heading back to Hanoi from Sapa, they changed my ride with another company and I have no idea what was happening. Instead of the bus, they put me in the front seat of a van with others. I wouldn't have had a problem but the front seats weren't that comfortable and wasn't reclining seats. Since it was a 6 hour trip, it was hard to endure for the body. I'm thinking they ran out of seats with their bus but they should at least have the courtesy to explain the situation instead of just asking me to jump into another unknown van in the last minute. Guess I was just the unlucky one that day. Overall, their service was great though.

Cheaper and quicker than train. After looking into an overnight train and being astounded at the cost and hearing you don't sleep well I booked the Sapa Express bus. So glad we did. For $20 USD one way it was super comfy with large seats and plenty of leg room and were in Sapa by 1pm. We met some people at our hotel the next morning who had come by train and hadn't slept. The trip back leaves from the centre of Sapa at 4pm and you are in Hanoi by 9pm. Two toilet stops and they give you water and snacks.

Definitely a Good Choice. We weren't sure what to expect when taking a bus labeled 'limo' on a 5.5 hour ride to Sapa, but the seats were very comfortable, and they have blankets and neck pillows in case you want to take a nap. The bus stops about every 90 minutes for a bathroom/snack break. They do provide a bottle of water and a couple of prepackaged snacks for during your ride as well. The driver was definitely driving safely, and we did not feel uncomfortable at any time with the speed or style of driving. Also, access to Wifi while on the bus is a definite plus as well!

Very comfy and fast way to Sapa. Booked return trip leaving Hanoi early morning. Bus had plenty of leg space (I'm 1.90m) and was very clean. Pickup is from your hotel if you book online. Overall good experience.

Good, comfortable ride to Sapa. Had a 5 hour bus ride to Sapa - there are two stops along the way and the driver was safe, prompt and drove quickly to Sapa when he could. It was a tad expensive but I think the bus is one of the better ones available to Sapa so it's still worth it to me!

Good way to get to Sapa. It took 5 hours both ways which was preferable than the train. The driver was cautious both ways and didn't appear to speed. WiFi and comfortable seats allowed the time to go by quickly.
Best way to travel. We booked the bus from Sapa to Hanoi. So comfortable, easy, airconditioned. Take food with you as the stops are generally quick and you can only buy snack foods.

Easy way to get to Sapa. Wasn't keen on the overnight train to Sapa, then heard about the bus....Great big seats that recline right back, with plenty of leg room. Better than a plane.Very early start for the 5 hour journey to Sapa, but they provide a bottle of water and breakfast. The return journey which leaves at 5pm, a bottle of water and a snack are provided.There are 2 stops along the way with plenty of time for something to eat, and a visit to the Happy Room.Along with the driver there is also an 'assistant' that makes sure you know which seat you're in (allocated seats), and will sort out taxis for you if you need.The road is mostly freeway, until you get about an hour from Sapa, then it becomes quite windy (think Great Ocean Road, but uphill). Can be a bit scary - but all of Vietnam roads are really. The drivers do seem to take risks that we wouldn't normally even think of doing, but again - that's Vietnam. I wasn't concerned for my safety or anything like that.If i ever go back to Sapa i would do it again.Apparently there will be a new main road to Sapa built in the next couple of years which will make it a lot easier....

Very comfortable 5 hour trip. The bus is super comfortable and has 2 bathroom and food stops each way. The seats recline and bottled water and a snack are provided. The driver on the way there was a little hairy around the twist mountain climb into Sapa, passing on corners and crossing the double yellow line repeatedly but this seems to be the standard....in saying that, our return driver took the mountain road very cautiously which was a great relief!

Comfortable travel to Sapa. Having heard of people's dislike of the overnight train to Sapa, in the months before departing for Vietnam I began to investigate other affordable means of travel there. Despite my travel agent being concerned about this mode of travel, due to heavy traffic and steep, narrow, winding roads I read other people's reports on Trip Advisor and felt comfortable booking with this bus company.(Roads have been improved in recent years and only the last section of the trip was windy). I am happy to say my research was pleasantly rewarded as we found this bus very comfortable and the 5 hour bus trip allowed us to enjoy the changing countryside. The bus itself was quite luxurious, equipped with reclining seats and free wifi. We were also issued with bottles of water and a snack pack. We stopped at two service centres along the way for short breaks (be prepared to have toilet paper handy as sometimes they run out). I would certainly recommend this bus service as an economical and comfortable means of getting to and from Sapa.

Pretty Good - for a Bus!. Having taken an "overnight train" in Vietnam previously, I knew I would rather not do it again.The Sapa Express was pretty good for a bus! Reasonably comfortable and much faster than the train.Warning: Be prepared for many locals trying to sell hand-made (or not) items greeting you in Sapa - ganging the exit of the bus. They will be persistent and will not take "no" as an answer. Somewhat tainted the Sapa experience for me. This happens while Trekking as well, but not a severely.

Economical daytime travel. I hate bus travel in General hut this experience changed my opinion of this mode of transport. Our hotel 'the essence palace' booked this return trip to Sa pa. It was an inexpensive return fare of $17us each way. We packed one suitcase for the 3 of us. The early start had us at the terminal for breakfast. The bus had large reclining seats..great aircon. ..purple curtains and was clean and spacious. It was ideal for our 9yr old grandson who could see out the window and access WiFi for his iPad. The trip took about 5 1/2hrs with 2 well timed stops. Once you get out of Hanoi past the airport you roll along a new well maintained toll freeway. .this was smooth traveling...the last 30kms up into Sa pa is slow as the road is steep and very narrow. There were slips everywhere which we managed to pass without incident.A word of WARNING when you are getting off the bus a Sa pa the hill people are very pushy while hawking their goods. I found some of these women rude with one of them telling me to go back to Hanoi. .

Perfect service, just like you wanted it to be. We have chosen to go to Sapa by bus, so that we could enjoy a bit the countryside and rest a bit. We thought we would have a simple bus trip but we got more, the staff was very friendly, there was a guide wo provided us useful information about the trip. Even the stop was in a space which was not to sell you something, but just a nice space to get some drinks, or grab some food. Although you haid to pay to get to the restrooms, these were fresh and clean. Overall we enjoyed the trip very good, and we recommend Sapa Express as the bus company to go to Sapa and/or back.

Exactly what we needed . We decided to take the bus to Sapa instead of the train because it was cheaper, faster, and we could enjoy the views. We booked this at the last minute, the night before we left and after the office had closed. I called to confirm our reservation and the man was very friendly and helpful and told us how to ensure we got on the bus the next day. It was great. They picked us up from our hotel in time, provided snacks and water, and got us going on a super nice bus with WiFi and air conditioning. The guide was great. Gave us info but didn't talk a ton, maybe only 15 minutes. This was a great experience. Highly recommended to get from Hanoi to Sapa.

A great way to go to Sapa. We paid 16 usd/person/way for our tickets with Sapa Express.We had a great trip to and from Sapa with this bus company. Pick-up from hotel on time with guide service. The bus itself was a "limousine" bus with very comfy reclining seats. Driving was very smooth and professional and the guide service was excellent. You are served a bottle of water and snacks for the trip and they are very punctual regarding departure and arrival times. On the return trip from Sapa there was a little confusion about our booking, but they solved this quickly as well. While there are alternative bus companies to Sapa that will save you a few bucks I would still recommend to go by Sapa Express any day.

Comfy & a great alternative to get to Sapa. Seats are comfy. Guide is helpful & friendly. Driver drives extremely careful. Beware of the winding road up the mountain though, take vomiting med if needed.

Excellent Bus Service. Great Bus service. Very clean, numerous stops, good air-conditioning plenty of room to put back seats and sleep and given snacks. Trip took 5 hours compared to 11 on the train. Collect you from your hotel and drop you in the centre of Sa Pa. Would recommend if going to Sa Pa.

Worthy money to travel. I and my wife went to sapa 2 days ago. After my trip in sapa by express bus I have commented as follows : 1. The buses are clean and comfortable seat, can adjust the seat becomes a comfortable bed . 2. Bus guide is very friendly and helpful . 3. The driver drove very well. say we're really happy with their service.

Comfy seats but that's all. We caught this bus to Sapa from Hanoi and back. Both times the drivers and guide were more interested in the rest stops than looking after their customers. Both drivers took lots of risks on the road and both so called bus guides were lazy and did the bare minimum. It's cheap and quicker than the train, but that's about all. The wifi is pathetic. First bus didn't have pillows and blankets but it's not that cold in any case. Try to seat near the front.The seats were wide and comfortable. That is the only positive thing we could say. If it weren't for our hotel making the booking and checking on the day of departure, we would have struggled.

So comfortable. We took the Sapa Express instead of the train, because we heard it would be more relaxed, and it was. We were with 5 persons and had a private transfer. The car was luxury and the seats very comfortable.

The Only Way to Sapa. I heard too many horror stories about the overnight so wasn't risking that. Anyway by taking the Sapa Express you get all the coach comforts, arrive in only 5 1/2 hours, also view the stunning scenery along the way and is only US$35 round trip. If you take the train you only get to Lao Cai and then have transfers and an hour on a bus anyway. It's a no-brainer - bus it. And when going to Sapa stay at the U Sapa Hotel in the heart of the town. Very good hotel, cheap, great staff and only fifty metres from the coach terminus.
gdeng gdeng. we travelled by night train, good service with clean sheets, some drinks and cookies. a bit too noisy to sleep well.
This is good bus to travel to Sapa. I am a tour operator in Hanoi and I am happy with their service. I often book bus tickets for my clients for tours to Sapa
good option to travel to sapa. quiet fast in vietnam's standards but too many stops and too long stops, could be faster to get to Sapa. Very comfortable sits and air condition. leaves on time

Excellent service. We decided to take the bus rather then the train and it was a excellent trip. Departs Hanoi around 07:30 and arrives in Sapa around noon. A comfortable trip and I recommend it over the train. Makes 1 stop for lunch and a bit later a bathroom stop.

Great way to travel from Hanoi to Sapa. We booked the Sapa Express on line from Australia. The receipt and ticket were issued promptly. The bus came to pick us up at the allocated time. I did however ring to confirm that all was in order. From a small bus you switch to the Sapa express. It's spacious, seats recline and have seat belts. There is complimentary water, and packet snacks. We arrived in Sapa around 1pm. Two stops on the way. Toilets available at both stops. You need to pay for toilet and collect toilet tissue on the way in. There are various food options to purchase at both stops. We found the service comfortable and efficient. Would definitely recommend it.

Sapa tour. The very beautiful and picturesque place on the north of Vietnam.If yuo have enouph time you should spend there 2 or 3 days to feel all the beauty of this mountainious place, to breath fresh air and to "touch" clouds :)

A very comfortable journey. We thoroughly enjoyed our journey to Sapa in the air-conditioned comfort of the Sapa Express coach. The seats are spacious with plenty of legroom & storage space for luggage. We were also given bottles of water & snacks to keep us hydrated before the first comfort break. The coach stops twice during the 4 hour journey & there are good toilet facilities & a wide range of snacks available at both halts. The scenery for much of the journey is unexceptional but becomes truly spectacular when the coach leaves the main highway for the long climb up to the bustling hill town of Sapa.The conductor asked us about our final destination &, on being advised that we were heading to a small village outside of the town, he rang ahead for a taxi & told us how much we should expect to pay. We very much appreciated this fine service.We talked to other people who had taken the train to Sapa & were trying to change their tickets to the coach for the return journey. We would therefore recommend the Sapa Express at the better option.

train ride to SAPA. The so called SAPA express is a misnomer. It takes about 7 to 8 hours to get to SAPA and not comfortable unless one can sleep with the chugging of the train. The irony of it all is that we booked an entire bunk which sleeps 4 exclusively for my wife and me so we did not have to share it with anyone else. But the train attendants got wise to it and came knocking at our doors to remove 2 mattresses for their own use after we had set off and then woke us up one hour before arrival to return the mattresses and dump the extra pillows and blankets on our bunks. What cheek! The service is just deplorable.Never again. Maybe if you 4 people sharing will avoid all the inconvenience.

Better option than overnight train . This bus drops you in Sapa village whereas the overnight train stops in Lao cai where you still need to catch a bus for three 1hr journey to Sapa. The bus leaves hanoi at 7am and had 2 stops along the way. One for 25mins breakfast stop and the second 15mins.Bus has seats like in business class plane. Also had free wifi. They also gave a bottle of water and snacks for the ride.Arrived in Sapa village at about 12.30pm.Nice scenery on the way. Arrived fresh as compared to arriving on train and if you didn't have a good sleep you would feel tired for the days start.Depart Sapa at 4pm arriving hanoi at 9.30pm. So this gives you an extra day in sapa.

Basic but comfortable.. The train from Hanoi to SAPA is made up of individual carriages, with each carriage being advertised as a 'train' by itself - which is a tad weird. Don't expect 1st class and be prepared to accept 4th class (yes it does exist on this train). Read the conditions of travel carefully before booking because most of the 'sleepers' are in shared compartments and you could be lumbered alongside beer drinking or chain smoking locals who don't realise they are in a sleeper carriage. It is well worth the extra Dong to travel in a twin cabin. Be wary of bottles of wine given to you by the guard as part of your fare? The guard will return at some point for payment at an exaggerated price. If you open the bottle, you pay. If you want a drink take it with you. The small food carts in the station prior to departure are safe to buy from, contrary to the warnings issued by the guards (they want to sell to you!).

Good option for getting to SaPa. Following a bit of background reading on TA and elsewhere we figured that the express bus was the best way to get to and from SaPa. Weren't disappointed either - the pick up from our hotel in the old quarter was right on time.The express bus itself was comfortable although I wouldn't recommend the back row of seats which were slight less so. The trip was fairly uneventful - on the way we had a couple of stops at service areas which had food and toilet facilities. Water was provided on the bus. Arrival in SaPa was on schedule - the drop off point near the end of Fansipan is a bit cramped but, if you need one, only a short walk from the taxi stand just up the hill. Return trip went similarly smoothly - couple of stops on the way and dropped us off outside the offices in Hanoi slightly ahead of schedule. No problem getting a taxi on the street to take us back to our hotel. Overall we were very happy with the service and would use again.

Comfortable Journey . Hanoi to Sapa on the Sapa Express, coaches are very clean and very comfortable as they are padded leather reclining seats and are one and a half times larger then your average seat. Free water and snacks are provided along with WIFI, blankets and neck pillows.I would strongly recommend using for your journey to Sapa!!
No complaints. All the reviews were right a must if going to sapa.we stopped for thirty minutes.sit back and enjoy the views.

Worst customer service I experienced in Asia.. This bus was comfortable but unfortunately the staff were incredibly rude to my girlfriend and I. We booked our ticket via their booking office in Sapa, when we turned up for our bus we presented our tickets and asked a Sapa Express employee which bus and seat number we had been allocated (as everyone else getting the bus did). Several times we were told to wait and when I asked if they could give us more information the staff members shouted as us, ignored us and one of the staff members even put his hand to my face. After a lot of frustration we were finally allocated seats on the bus but the staff members on board continued to treat us rudely and didn't offer us services they offered to other guests (such as helping to book taxis).For this reason I would not reccomend this company to anyone. It is by far the worst customer service I have experienced in Vietnam and during my time in Asia. If you are going to book with this company I strongly advise you to ask to check your seat number and bus at time of booking (although I can't say if they will be able to provide this).
Fantastic bus. Got the bus from Sapa back to Hanoi. Very comfortable and clean. The seats recline far back so it's perfect to catch some sleep on the long journey.

Good bus service - in our view better option than overnight train. The buses we travelled in both to and from Sapa were modern, clean and comfortable. They also ran right on time. At around 5 hours driving time I would recommend the bus as being quicker and cheaper than the train – and with the advantage of arriving in and leaving from the centre of Sapa town.In Hanoi people were picked up and brought to the depot by minivan or for the more intrepid on the back of scooters. Names were checked off, we were advised of our allocated seat and off we went. En route from Hanoi to Sapa we had two stops – the first for 25 minutes and the next for about 15. Sapa to Hanoi we only had one 15 minute comfort stop. I would reiterate previous reviewers who recommend taking a packed meal (in both cases our hotel provided us with a nice sandwich) – on board you'll be given a bottle of water and some snacky things but nothing substantial.The on board wifi is a bit of a myth – so slow as to be useless. But that's the only slight downside. We can highly recommend Sapa Express.

Unsafe bus driver. I took the Sapa Express from Sapa to Hanoi on May 2nd with three family members. Very comfortable modern bus with good wifi. Unfortunately, the bus driver was a maniac. I have spent a total of 7 weeks travelling in Vietnam over the past four years on a variety of vehicles (buses, vans, cars, trains, boats) and have never felt unsafe until this bus ride. We had witnessed a bus roll off the road and down a hillside on the previous day while trekking so it is obviously not always safe. The road from Sapa to Lao Cai is newer but it is a winding mountain road. The driver sped excessively, tailgated, honked, passed unsafely, and generally intimidated anyone and anything in his way including other large tour buses. During our rest/food stop outside Hanoi, which we were told would be 20 minutes, another family came up to us and commented on how unsafe they were feeling with this driver. The 20 minute break turned into a 45 minute break while the driver chatted at a table with a woman he obviously knew. Maybe he felt he could take a longer break having made the trip in what must have been record time. We actually wondered why we were taking a break at all, as we were so ahead of schedule due to constantly remaining well over the speed limit. We would have preferred to have just kept driving and arrive in Hanoi an hour earlier, having survived the careening bus ride anyway, and had more time for a decent meal in town instead of at a highway truck stop. I complained in writing to our travel agent but have yet to receive a reply. Very unsafe driver.

Sa pa overnight train experience. The train was very clean and comfortable.Toilet left a bit to be desired.We two ladies late 60's were in a 4 berth cabin and top bunks very difficult to reach.Lucky enough to get very accommadating young people to awap with us.Double rooms are available at higher cost.

Good comfy bus. We took Sapa express from hanoi to sapa and back again....the bus was lovely and comfortable, clean and air conditioned. We had 2 stops one a bit longer if you wanted to buy food plus use rest rooms. We were given a bottle of water and two snacks. It has wi fi but not successful...it is VERY slow. It took 5.5 hours...we preferred this to many more hours on a train...we would recommend it
Great bus. We took this express bus from Spa back to Hanoi. Loved it. Seats are so comfortable and it makes two stops for food and bathroom breaks.

Only for real train lovers. The Victoria Sapa-- Cadillac of trains -- runs overnite from Hanoi to Lao Cai, about an hour drive from Sapa. It's noisy, the beds are short for anyone taller than 5 fi 3 inches. Take the Victoria Sapa's five hour luxury bus insisted. It's very comfortable and the roads are good.

Good bus service. We took the trip to Sapa and everything went smoothly. We got picked up at the hotel. You get selected seats, snacks and water. The bus driver made sure everyone is in the right seat. We got dropped off in front of our hotel. Definitely recommended.

Overnight train to Sapa and trekking throught the villages. Trekking in Sapa was a challenge but fun and filled with wonderful views. Sapa is not to be missed when visiting Vietnam. Our Wide Eyed Tours guide, May was excellent and informative.

Better option that the train. After taking the overnight train from Hanoi to Sapa, my wife and I decided we would throw away our return ticket and take the bus instead. it turned out to be a good choice - quicker and half the price. The bus left Sapa pretty much on time at 4 p.m, and we had seats 1 and 2 right behind the driver for a good view of proceedings. The seats were large, very comfortable and reclined far back enough to have a reasonable nap (somewhat like a premium economy seat on an airliner). Water was distributed as was a "light snack" (coconut-coated peanuts anyone?) which was promptly discarded. The drive itself was very comfortable, with the obligatory Vietnam highway hair-rasising moments e.g. passing on blind corners and facing motorcyclists barrelling at us on the wrong side of the road. We arrived in Hanoi Old Town right on schedule at 10 p.m. and agreed it was a much nicer way to travel than the train. The only grip we have is that there are very limited food options at the two stops along the way. The first stop is no more than a huge, barn-like building with a basic store selling dodgy local goods but no fresh food. The second stop did have some fresh food offerings but the bakery/café that looked most promising turned out to be a disappointment - I went to order two bahn mi off the menu and was met with a blank stare by the cashier who gestured at the menu while shaking her head and repeating "Nothing, nothing...". The only other option was a noodle shop selling such delicacies as "steamed cow" - we gave it a miss and went hungry. If you do take the bus, take your own packed meal! You'd think with the tour buses full of Westerners that go by every day, these rest stops would be a bit more entrepreneurial and open a food stall that actually caters to the passengers.

Best bus ride to Sapa. Love the huge business-class-size seats, free water and snacks. However, the WiFi didn't work all the time, and when it worked, it was very slow. Nevertheless, it was still a comfortable 5-hour ride to Sapa, with 2 stops along the way, one for 25 minutes for a meal, and one for 10 minutes for a toilet break.
5 hours to sapa in a relaxing chair. start 7.00 13.00 in Sapa, and back from 15.30-21.00. On arrival and before departure plenty of time for a long walkA relaxing trip, faster than the train.
Good view. It was a good experience to explore yourself. However, the route is quite tough. It is suit to who loves adventure.

A very pleasant journey Hanoi-Sapa. It's the Wandering Yank here. Mrs. Yank and I took this bus yesterday, and everything was excellent!We were picked up at our hotel about 645 am in a smaller bus and taken to the main pickup point. The seating 2-1 across and there's plenty of legroom. The seats recline of course, and there are leg rests that can be raised. The most important thing about the bus, the seat comfort, was superb.We stopped at 2 restaurants/rest areas on the way, so rest stops were more than adequate. The driver was calm and unhurried, and since there's not much traffic on this highway, it was a very relaxing experience (no horn-honking, a relief after Hanoi).Travel hint - at the first rest stop, go to the back of the grocery section and see the bottles of local spirits. There are 2 very interesting brands - one has geckos in it, and the other has cobras and black scorpions in it. Worth a photo!2 thumbs up!

To Sapa by luxury coach. Travelled from Hanoi to Sapa by coach - how comfortable was this journey! More room than most airlines, seats that recline and a couple of stops on the way. A great way to access the Northern highlands area

So comfortable!!. This would have to be the most comfortable coach trip we have ever taken. A couple of stops en route, water and a snack offered and coach left and arrived on time. Pickup transfer from our hotel in old quarter was on time. We would highly recommend this mode of transport over and above rail after getting feedback from other travellers who had experience with rail.

Amazing. Went to Sapa by overnight train (never again).Train ride terrible ,bed hard ,got woken up to very loud vietnamise music (hard on the ears ).But Sapa ahhh what a beautiful place ,although the area was filled with fod for the better part of the day ,it lufted about 3 and what a sight .Met some wonderful little local ladies who gave us an unforgetable experience in their culture ,gained more knowlege from them in an hr than fron 3 with a guide .Will definitely be going back but by day train thus time

Best way to travel. Going from Hanoi to Lao Cai we took a train but neither of passangers could get much sleep though an Oriental train was clean and comfortable. Latter one man we met gave an expression that it was like trying to sleep in a washing mashine :) From SaPa to Hanoi we took this express bus. It was really comfy (and I can compere with the bus Hanoi-Halong Bay after which I couldnt feel my back though the trip was shorter than Sapa-Hanoi). And if you have some reading material the trip will end in a moment :) They had a wifi also, but it did not work properly so its kind of a minus but wifi in Vietnam is poor anyways. So express bus goes faster than train, is more comfy, therefore i'd recommend this kind of transport.

Comfortable and easy. Travelled to and from sapa by sapa express. The trip there was great. The guide was friendly and helpful. Bus is comfortable and wifi and snacks are a bonus. Made 2 stops and took about 5.5 hours. Trip back was comfortable but the guide was extremely rude. We only made one stop and he was very rude when addressing people. We were also told we would be dropped back at our hotel and were instead dropped in the middle of hanoi at 9pm. Overall good experiences but just be prepared

Chinese fire drill. We went up to Sapa by buss and back was one problem after another with many phone calls in the middle. I think we ended up paying for a second trip back to Hanoi. No toilet on the bus on the way back. Next time it's the train for me.It is very sad that Sapa is growing by leaps and bounds. Lots of huge news hotels are being built. This was out second time to sapa.

Cheap, comfortable, quick, and safe. We just arrived in Sapa and took the express bus. We had read a lot of people advising against the bus due to safety concerns, but our experience could not have been safer. The bus left Hanoi at 7am and stopped twice before arriving in Sapa at 1pm. The stops have a small convenience store, a hot food store, and western toilets. The bus was clean and the reclining chairs were really comfortable. The driver drove at safe speeds and only overtook where safe. The other staff member on the journey spoke English and provided a small snack and water. It was both raining and very foggy during our trip (i.e. not ideal driving conditions), but we felt safe the whole time. Therefore, I am unsure why people would bother to ride the train because of safety concerns. The traffic on the freeway is sparse and although it is a windy road for the last 30km, you would still need to take a bus for this part of the journey even if you opt to take the train.

Cheap and fast. We took the bus to Sapa and the train back to Hanoi and we liked the bus more. It was cheaper, faster and more comfortable. Light snacks and water were provided, not to mention the free wifi available on the bus.

Bus ride back from Sa Pa. We went up to Sa Pa by train and Car , however we went back to Ha Noi by bus, much more comfortable than the train, big seats lots of leg room, free wifi and water we stopped at two places for restroom and food. The only problem was that they dropped us off somewhere in Ha Noi no idea where we were, however we quickly got a taxi to our hotel.

comfortable ride to Sapa. Left Hanoi on March 11, 2016 and returned on March 14. We were picked up at our hotel in the Old Quarter at the agreed time. Bus was clean and very comfortable with great leg room. 2 stops going to Sapa and one stop coming back to Hanoi. Excellent service with free wifi, snacks, water and English speaking guide.

A quick and affordable way to get to Sapa.. I took the Sapa Express bus from Hanoi to Sapa and back. It was pretty quick at about 4-5 hours and the drivers and tour guides were all very nice. The bus was pretty comfortable, although wifi is a bit spotty (didn't really bother me, but it's worth mentioning). We stopped at a couple of places for food and bathroom breaks and the bus gives you a little snack and water on the trip. The only thing--if you're at all nervous about heights and winding, steep roads, you might want to rent a seat on a smaller bus or get a private car. The roads to Sapa are very steep and winding and this is a huge tour bus, so it's mildly unnerving.

Probably the best option to go to Sapa. Better than train. Luxury and brand new bus. Plenty of space for legs. I would say that Sapa Express Bus is better than train. Beware that besides good transportation conditions that driver use Vietnam style on road and could be scary sometimes. 1 day in Sapa could be enough to explore famous terraces.

The ride. The booking was hassle free and they replied all my queries promptly. The pickup from hotel was on the dot and so is the departure time. Bus ride was comfy as the chairs can be declined for a better sleeping position. Do not request for front seat unless you like a thrilling ride. Our bus driver is a damn good driver, only he can overtake others and no others can overtake him. Phew!!!! We arrived safely. Do note that they don't drop you off at the place they had picked you.

Thank you for excellent service. I used the bus to go to Sapa. A very comfortable seat. Free wifi. A very light Breakfast provided. overall was an amazing journey with Sapa Express. i will not hesitate to use their service again.

Go Sapa Go. A visit to Sapa is not to be missed. The town is in the far north, and only accessible by bus or train. The Spa Express bus takes about 5 hoursw, and leaves early morning. Theyu pick you up at your hotel and transport you to the central station. The bus makes a few stops on the way for convenienve and food, and is very pleasant. We took the bus to Sapa and the overnight train back to Hanoi. This saves you 2 train rides which I highly recommend. Make sure you book the express bus or your trip will be longer and less comfortable.

Getting to Sapa. Ok so we had a couple of small issues at first. We booked a transit /mini van as it wasn't much more expensive but got swapped to a bus with a typical type excuse about it being repaired. That being said we were refunded the difference and with hindsight believe it is the better option, bus was very comfortable with plenty of leg room ( 6ft 4 ). If I was to travel again I'd use the bus first choice. They also promised us the front seats then gave them to another couple when we could see on the list they were assigned to us. A little annoying but first world problem issue really and we got over it easily and really enjoyed the service. Definitely recommend this company and service.

Trip not to forget. We rode the Sapa Express return journey booked, what a trip, never to be forgotten, bumpy, rattler & stopped frequently on route. We had a lot of laughs about the trip!!! Sapa is a wonderful place very pretty & a lot to see, people very pleasant & helpful, very good restaurants & plenty to choose from. Great holiday!!!
quick and comfortable. Such an easy way to travel to Sapa via the new motorwayI highly recommend it.Large comfortable seats with full wifi access

Very comfortable. Great way to travel between Hanoi and Sapa. Very comfortable seats, big windows and on-time travel. Sapa-Hanoi in 5h45. Paid 18USD/Person.Better then luxury 9-seater buses, because more comfortable ride and bigger windows to enjoy the view!

Good Bus Service with WiFi!. I and my wife made a photography trip to Sapa via train and when coming back we utilized the Sapa Express Bus Service. The bus was very comfortable and the ride was smooth. Each row had only three seats (two on one side and one on the other side). Each seat was reclining type and felt as if we were sitting on a sofa chair. Wifi was available intermittantly due to the hilly terrain. We enjoyed the comfortable ride!

The way to travel to Sapa. We booked a three day trip to sapa via our hotel which included transport on the sapa express. Having been on the national express a few times in the UK I was not looking forward to the 5hr trip but it was far quicker than the overnight train and a fraction of the price. Having arrived I can honestly say that it is the only way to travel from Hanoi to sapa. Don't waste your time or money on the night train. You get a fully reclineable armchair for the trip which flies by with 2 short stops to stretch your legs. At 6"3 I was amazed at the room and comfort of this bus. I think it runs once a day each way. 07:00 ish from Hanoi and 16:00 ish back from sapa

Hanoi-Sapa-Hanoi via Sapa Express. I decided to use Sapa Express instead of train because the duration and timing. 7am Sapa Express leave from Hanoi to Sapa, duration about 5.5 hours, est arrival is 1pm which is good for check into the hotel.4pm Sapa Express leave from Sapa to Hanoi, duration about 5.5 hours, est arrival in Hanoi about 9:30pm. 2 stop over for toilet break and quick bites. Driver are experience but some part of the road are narrower so heart can skip a little.

Fantastically comfie. New buses, clean and with reclining seats. Never been more comfortable on a bus. Direct to Sapa, to, unlike the train that on,y takes you to Lau Cai. The express bus is worth every penny

Quick and comfortable, best driver in Vietnam 2 weeks. We got Sapa Express as part of our "2 Day Minority Trek" package found directly with Sapa Panorama Hotel, cheaper than agencies & hotels offer: 200 bucks for 2 pax with great view room! The bus was great: quick, very good driver between the motos, large seat and enough leg space, announced stop on the way, good English speaking steward. They have good roads, but slowly due of motos and old trucks, even the 200km speedway have 80km/h limit! But not for their bus ;)

Return bus trip to SaPa. I booked this trip three months ago through the internet. During this time Mr Long kept me updated by email until the day before the trip. The hotel pick up was on time and we were very pleased with the bus and the professionalism of the staff. Excellent service, highly recommended!

Great safe trip. This is luxury bus travel. Reclining seats (if you want), large and lots of leg room. Bus was a bit late leaving (not their fault as they were waiting for a school group to arrive). Young drivers assistant was very helpful with telling us just before the stops how long etc. and checking if we had everything we needed.Neck pillows, blankets, water and snacks are provided free of charge. It is a really great way to travel to Sapa.

sapa express fail. be careful if you use the "pickup hotel service" , they completely forgot to pick me up. I even called before the bus departure and they said they had some delays. called again later just to hear that the bus already left and they forgot me. i was offered a refund but i still lost a paid day hotel reservation at sapa which they don't care about.
Very nice ride!. Nices buses (with seat belts) for beautiful journey to Sapa. Good calculated stops.Highly recommended and Sapa is magnificent!

Smooth and efficient. We booked a bus ride from Hanoi to Sapa via our hanoi hotel.The representative came to pick us up from the hotel at appointed time.The bus was comfortable and clean. There was a English speaking guide who explained the journey timing, the 2 scheduled stops etc.We were provided with bottled water, a bun and some snacks each.Very smooth and efficient ride into Sapa.Total time from 7am leaving hotel to arrival at Sapa -1pm or so.

Best bus in South East Asia. This was our first experience on a bus in South East Asia and we wish we could speak so highly of all of our trips. We enjoyed comfortable seats, a sane and safe driver, snacks and free wifi. The bathroom breaks were needed and timely and we would travel on Sapa Express again. The bus drops off in the heart of Sapa in walking distance of most accommodations.

Nice bus with good staff. Sapa is a place you must not miss. Sapa Express is the premium bus which can take you there. The guys are nice and helpful. Seats are wide and spacious. They give you free water and snacks on the bus too.

Express bus. Booked this on line and delt with a Mr DU. In the Hanoi office he gave great sevice and answered all E- mails promptly and please to deal with. The bus ride to Sapa was great we are two couples in our 70s and found the bus the ideal way to travel with plenty of leg room and seats that recline.BUT the return trip was very different, one of our party develop a stomach upset and could not travel on a bus with no toilet. We approach the Sapa office of Sapa Express and found the lady running this office very rude did not what to talk to us and try to ignore my wife.all we tried to do was change our tickets for another day the bus we traveled on was not full so we thought they would try and fit us on another bus for the convenience of everyone including bus driver and guide.this lady just laughter and carried on talking to the bus guide.After insisting and refusing to leave we finally got our exchange seats and had a good trip back to HanoiIf not for this lady we would have marked it excellent

Sapa is wonderful but don't expect too muh sleep on the King Express!. Sapa is not to be missed but the King Express is a very old train that rattles non stop throughout the night (much more than a 'snow train' to the Alps!) You get there early but TIRED...
Better alternative than taking overnight train. 6 hours to reach Sapa from Hanoi. Reached Sapa around 1pm and left Sapa for Hanoi at 4pm. So you fully utilise your time. Two stops for comfort break.
Archaic but authentic. Not the most comfortable ride and a little noise if you are a light sleeper. It was clean and manageable.

Great ride. We decided to take the Sapa Express to Sapa and were glad we did so after speaking to some other travellers who took the train. It appears that it is the much quicker and more comfortable option.We were picked up from our hotel in the old quarter with no fuss in a smaller van and then met with the proper bus afterwards. These seats are very comfortable, probably the most comfortable bus ride I've ever been on (and I've done a fair bit of bus travelling). Huge seats with lots of space. We were given some water and snacks on the way to Sapa and stopped twice, once for breakfast and again for a toilet stop near Lao Cai. Took about 6 hours all up to get to Sapa.I had read some reviews and forum posts about the drive vs train being a bit risky safety wise, but maybe this is referring to before the new highway was put in as the drive was great and we felt very safe the whole time. The driver we had on the trip back to Hanoi was a little less cautious and faster than the driver on the way into Sapa, but still was totally fine.One thing to be ready for on arrival at Sapa is the many Hmong women who approach you as soon as you step out of the bus (they hang around the bus stop so I think this will happen whoever you go with) and try and get you to come to their village or buy something. We found being polite and firmly saying no was the best way to handle this, unless of course you want these.The person running the bus came and asked us all where we were all staying to try and help us get to our accommodation when we arrived however with all the confusion on arrival we ended up just figuring it out ourselves. The trip home is pretty straight forward. No snacks but did get given a water and we stopped once in Lao Cai to pick up some passengers that had booked from there and another time for a toilet stop/food. Bit more basic facilities here but enough and the one stop made the trip back a little quicker (closer to 5 and a half hours). The drop of point in Hanoi is in the old town, no hotel drop offs, but wasn't that hard to find a taxi, or we could have walked if we hadn't brought all our luggage with us. Overall I think this is a very easy and safe way to get to Sapa and if we were to return, would definitely go for this option again.

Comfortable ride. Wide, reclining seats with plenty of leg room. Water and snacks provided.On our way there we were picked up from our hotel and the staff on the bus checked with each passenger to make sure he or she had a contact person on arrival and offered to get taxis for those who needed one.On the way back there was no drop-off at our hotel as promised, but I am not sure whether it is the fault of the bus operator or our tour operator.Overall a comfortable option for a long ride.

Not as the Travel Agent said. They said it is the newest bus and very comfortable bus comes with the guide speaks a little English. Just like get on and get off, drop off at the midway, therefore no need to have a Guide like this, by this way we lose our money extra for snap service. Nothing special for bus, like every tourist bus we've been through the south to the north of Vietnam. A little both water was set on bus. The fact is, all the bus stop in sapa town and very easy to findout the same like this, but only 15usd no more while we paid 22usd for the Express and high quality.

Fast and safe option for travelling to Sapa. The reviews on Trip Advisor saying this bus is a great option are absolutely true. The bus was:- on time - with pick up option from Hanoi Old Quarter hotel and no unscheduled stops (note, there is a Lao Cai stop on the way back to Hanoi if there are passengers booked from there)- safe-feeling - seat belts, careful driver (especially by Vietnamese standards), new road means it is Express Way all the way to Lao Cai where train passengers have to get off and transfer to a bus to Sapa anyway- fast - got there in 5 1/2 hours including two toilet and food/drink stops- extremely comfortable - wide, reclining seats, footrests, pillows, blankets, bottled water & snacks provided, individual air-conditioning and lighting control- decorated beautifully (think magic carpet ride with coloured lights!)- staffed by a funny, English speaking guide who individually checked with all passengers to ensure they knew their way to their accommodation or otherwise arranged taxis, maps and whatever was needed for them (he also did some singing, whistling and general laughter and chatting with the driver...)- used by locals/expats from Sapa who also assisted people also with transport options and other local knowledge.All in all, we were very happy with this transport - thank you.

Excellent way to Sapa. They picked us up from the hotel, the journey was just over 5 hours. A bottle of water and snacks was provided in the beginning of the journey and there were sufficient stops for food and toilet breaks. Staff were extremely helpful and prompt with my email queries. On the return trip they picked us up from Lao Cai as we stayed in Bac Ha the night before which saved us going back to Sapa. I don't know why you would chose any other way of getting to Sapa.

The only way to go to Sapa. Forget the train. This is by far the best way to get from Hanoi to Sapa. Cheaper, faster, more comfortable, and at more reasonable times of day. AND, it goes directly to Sapa, not Lao Cai. We were seduced by the glamour and romance of the train and it wasn't worth it. Take the bus!! And this bus, Sapa Express, was great. They even pick you up at your hotel!

Great option for Hanoi to Sapa. I booked our return tickets for Hanoi to Sapa directly with Sapa Express via email from the UK. They were quick to respond and the charge was payable online via world pay. It's only $17 per person each way. This is much cheaper than a decent train carriage and it takes less time. If you take the train it is overnight (8 hours or so) plus another 2.5 to 3.5 hour drive to Sapa. The coach now takes 5.5 to 6 hours including 2 stops enroute (toilet and snack breaks) which total 30 minutes between them. The coach has large reclining seats and wifi (slow but enough to check email etc) the crew speak good English and we're helpful.

Comfortable ride from Sapa to Hanoi. After taking the overnight train to get up to Sapa, we decided to try something different on the way back. After a little research it was a no brainier- 5 hours on a bus and sleeping in a comfortable bed once we got to Hanoi rather than another uncomfortable 8 hour journey on the train. It was a great decision! The bus left Sapa around 4-4:30pm and we were in Hanoi by 10pm. There were two well spaced stops, the first being a 10 minute toilet break (brand new gas station, super clean with Western toilets) and the second a 30 minute dinner break (kind of a weird truck stop, but had vendor food, pho, snacks, etc. **If you go all the way to the left, there is an area with Western toilets, cost is $2000 dong, but way better than the alternative squat toilets with no stall doors on the other end of the place**). The bus itself was really comfortable with reclining seats and leg support. We were offered water, candy, pillows and blankets and the bus also had free wifi (super slow, but what do you expect on a bus in the middle of nowhere?!). The new highway from Lo Cai to Hanoi made the ride enjoyable, smooth, and fast. Would definitely do that again over the train!

Good Service. The bus was on time, we came to Sapa from Hanoi in 5 1/2 hours. The seats were very big and could recline all the way. We got a bottle of water and snacks. Also they had blankets and those neck pillows. The driver was really good and didnt drive maniac fast as other drivers do. I definitely recommend this bus to Sapa.

Most comfortable coach. We took this bus to Sapa from Hanoi and back and it is so spacious. The seats are singles on right side and doubles on left. The seats are wide, will recline and have leg and foot support, just like those on business class airplane seats. They also provide pillows as well as bottled water and sweets and snack. The journey took around 5 hours but includes a(well spaced) 30 min and a 10 min break where you can use toilets and buy food etc. It leaves Hanoi around 7am and arrive Sapa around 1pm. It leaves Sapa about 4pm and arrives Hanoi about 10pm. Aircon was great, not too hot nor too cold. I wasn't very well during this trip and so having a comfortable bus was amazing, I managed to sleep well. There is also a bonus wifi on board. It will take you directly to the centre of Sapa and Hanoi. I booked this as a package inc Sapa hotel from our Hanoi hotel so I cannot comment on cost.

Very good . The best way to get from Hanoi to Sapa, and back. At Hanoi those guys came to pick us up from our hotel. They are very organized and have wifi on the bus. The seats were very comfortable and spacey.
Highly recommended.

2 days Sapa stay with trekking. Amazing couple of days, travelling in luxury bus with free wifi. The Go Asia team had the best tour Guide, Ha, a young working mother, who had great english and loved her job. Great walk both days,

Clean and safe. Great bus ride to Sapa! Bus was very comfortable, with pillows and blankets (in case you want to go back to sleep after the early departure). The guide was super friendly. Water and snacks were provided, and there was wifi on board. Driver seemed safe (conservative when passing slower vehicles in front of us). Would take again, as the night train was not very comfortable!
Don't take the train go with Sapa express . We took Sapa express both ways and it was perfect. It's like flying business class. And the price is very fair.

Best way to travel Sapa. The Sapa Express office was just across the road from our hotel in Hanoi Old Quarter, so very easy for us to get to the bus. Lots of space with comfortable reclining seats. Very friendly staff who hand out water and snacks. Blankets and neck pillows are also provided. Good air conditioning, free wifi and a few toilet stops along the way. Good roads and beautiful scenery make the 5 hour travelling time pass quickly. Prepare yourself for the steep twisty road up to Sapa with some interesting driving skills from everyone on the road!

Forget about the train, take Sapa Express!. The Sapa Express would take you on the newly built Hanoi-Sapa highway, which would bring you all the way to Sapa (train stops at Lao Cai). The highway is flat for the entire 5 hours trip to Lao Cai, with only an hour of mountainous road from Lao Cai to Sapa, so no worries about the safety. Also, their buses are rather new as well, with wifi on board!Would highly recommend!

Best way to Sapa. Sapa Express is the fastest most affordable and comfortable way to get to Sapa. The drivers and guides are professional and friendly. They provide snacks and drinks and even wifi! Highly recommend taking Sapa Express if you are going to Sapa.

Beautiful sapa. Sapa was beautiful and the trek was well worth it. The guide was excellent and very accommodating. The food was meager and when we asked for more they got excited and didn't give us more.

Best way to get to Sapa from Hanoi. One of the best bus transport we had taken around this region. Clean interior and really spacious seats. Free wifi, snacks, blankets and pillows. Felt safe throughout the trip.

Arrived Safely and On Time. Our family of three used the Sapa Express to and from Sapa in June 2015. After reading other reviews I was a little dubious about the trip, but I we all enjoyed the experience. The bus left Hanoi promptly at 7.00am and arrived at 1.00pm. We were given breakfast on board of cake, nuts & water. We had 2 stops along the way to purchase food and use the toilets (very clean). On the return trip we left right on time at 4.00pm and arrived in Hanoi at 9.30pm. We have undertaken many road trips throughout Asia and some have been very hairy, but the driver of the Sapa Express on both trips drove very cautiously. At no time was I worried about our safety. We paid US$102.00 return for 3 adults on the Sapa Express, which I think is good value.
Super experience.. A very fint bustrip from Hanoi to Sa Pa, a vary good hotel and super trekking with an informativ and enthusiastic lokal guide named Pho

No complaints with this one. Forget the train that arrives and leaves Sapa at inconvenient times. Try this bus service. We left Sapa at 3pm and were in our hotel at 8.30. Everything was booked by our hotel and a one way journey was about $US17, a bargain again compared to the train. The bus was comfortable with reclining seats, the views spectacular and it even had wifi. It stopped a couple of times for comfort breaks and was really good value.If you take a trip to Sapa (and you should) forget the train and add value and comfort to your memories.
