We Booked Our 10 Day Trip to Vietnam through Luxury Travel in Hanoi. We recently returned from a 10 day trip to Vietnam arranged by Luxury Travel. We have travelled throughout Asia over the last few years. We are happy we visited, but it wasn't the trip we expected.Pluses:1. Excellent and timely communication through Ms. Hien Pham in the Luxury Travel office. She was good to work with.2. We had a private tour. Each guide and driver were waiting for us at the airport as soon as we arrived at (at Hanoi, Hue and HCMC). No hassles and very convenient.3. Hotels were good to excellent. However, do your own research and guide Luxury Travel to the type of hotel you want to stay in.Minuses:1. For us, the success of the trip is based on the guides. We had a total of 3 tour guides...one in Hanoi....one in Hue/ Hoian...one in Ho Chi Minh City. The last guide (Tran) was excellent. Her English was excellent, she actively spoke to us, she knew history. However, the other 2 guides were not as good or forthcoming with history. Perhaps we were expecting something more (like the quality of a National Geographic or Smithsonian tour), and we were disappointed in the lack of depth. This was the biggest negative about the trip. 2. Many meals were included in the price. The lunches were at touristy restaurants and were not adventurous. We looked around and these restaurants all had Westerners (not locals) eating. We didn't get the food experience we read about. Again, this could be fine for many travelers, but it wasn't what we hoped for. 3. The government can randomly close buildings. That happened in Hanoi and we didn't walk around the Ho Chi Minh Complex. WIsh the guide could have worked around the problem and found out in advance when the Complex would have been open in our 2 days there. 4. We had a one night cruise on Halong Bay. The cruise lasted 20 hours and it was 4 hours each way to drive to and from the dock. In a 10 day trip we weren't convinced it was a good use of limited time. I'll take the blame on not being focused on the distance to Halong Bay from Hanoi.For most travelers, Luxury Travel would be a safe and good choice. If you are looking for an easy trip with everything arranged in advance, I highly recommend them. If you are a more adventurous traveler hoping for a more intense experience....don't know if they are the right group to use.

Outstanding 15 day family tour of Vietnam with Luxury Travel Vietnam. In planning our trip, I found the Trip Advisor reviews extremely useful, especially in selecting a travel company. Ms Hien Pham from the Hanoi office was our coordinator and she really went out of her way to ensure a fantastic holiday. Over several weeks of planning, we added and subtracted visits, and shifted dates until we eventually settled on an ideal travel package. None of this was a problem for Hien Pham. She usually turned around an itinerary change overnight and was always friendly to deal with.As a company, Luxury Travel was friendly, efficient and totally reliable. They organised all of our internal flights, transport, accommodation, tours, and most meals. Every time we arrived at an airport, the Luxury Travel guide was there to meet us. And the helped us through check-in for onwards flights. The vehicles were always big, comfortable Ford Transit vans and there was always cold water and cold wipes available. We had several guides during our travels. Mr Trang in HCMC was very knowledgable on the history of te area as he had grown up through the war period, so was absolutely fascinating and engaging.Mr Thuy in Hanoi was almost more like a friend than a guide. He took us through Hanoi and flew with us to Dien Bien Phu, sharing his knowledge throughout. He also walked the ground with me as we explored the French strongpoints in Dien Bien PhuWe had Mr Phuong in Hue and Hoi An and he showed us all over the areas where he had grown up, including many 'off the beaten track' highlights.For our last few days in HCMC we had Mr Minh who was able to give a new understanding of the importance of the Mekong Delta area to Vietnam's economy nd to their culture.All of the guides and all of the drivers were outstanding.Accommodation was always located near to the local attractions and I have done separate reviews of each hotel, so just a summary here. Liberty Central in HCMC is right in the heart of the historical and market area, so planty to see. They also have best fitness centre out of all the hotels we stayed at. Four stars.Chalcedony in Hanoi is right opposite the Luxury Travel office, and again is right in the heart of Hanoi's attractions. 4 stars.Him Lam Resort in Dien Bien Phu is a huge accommodation/conference centre with cabin style accommodation. Needs some maintenance work but is in a good location for exploring the area. 3 stars.Imperial Hotel in Hue is outstanding. Rooms are fantastic, restaurant is top notch, and make sure you have a cocktail on the top deck- fantastic views. 5 stars.Likewise the Hoi An Beach Resort - fantastic rooms, great service, 50 metres to the beach.Also, we found Vietnam Airlines to be very efficient with a very modern fleet of Aibus and Boeing aircraft, including the latest 787 and 777 models, and great airport facilities. We had factored in some fat into the itinerary just in case flights were unreliable, delayed etc, but this was never the case. I am very impressed with Vietnam Airlines.Overall, I highly recommend Luxury Travel Vietnam to anyone who wants to organise their own itinerary rather than follow a standard group tour.

An inspired choice - Thanks Luxury Travel and Ms Hien Pham. Why pay more for a private tour when there are many good packaged tours available? This was the question a friend asked me before we left on our holiday in Vietnam arranged by Luxury Travel Co. Well there is not much difference between the price we paid and the group tours offered by so many touring companies.Also you know that you will be met at the airport even if Air Vietnam arrives almost 5 hours late as it was with our flight from Hanoi to Hue. Also, you are transported by air conditioned cars that take you as close to the destination as possible – a terrific advantage when it is hot, hot, hot and humidity is in the 90% range. And most importantly, your tour can be modified, in real time, to suit you, the traveller. An example of this was at the Angkor Watt temple. My wife who is quite agile but sports two new knees, is naturally cautious when accessing uneven surfaces. It was not uncommon for us to enter through doors marked exit because our tour guide thought that it was a flatter, more even surface.In another instance we were told that a visit to a sight, although on the itinerary, would be visited the following morning. We would leave a half hour earlier. We were ready to go at the appointed time and did not have to wait for the stragglers as so often happens with big groups.How can you get ‘up close and personal’ with a tour guide when there are twenty or more of you? How can you talk about their experience and their thoughts and aspirations rather than the formal veneer. And when I travel, I like to meet ‘the people’ and not only look at the sights – that you can do with videos.Our tour with Luxury travel had all of this and much, much more. Our tour guides all spoke with a reasonable level of English. Yes, one did have to concentrate because some of the pronunciation was sometimes tinged with French or Vietnamese, as would be expected. Only our guide in Phnom Penh had English to a conversational level but then she was a university literature graduate. A fabulous young lady. I hope that the guides were as happy with their clients as we were with them.All of our hotels were luxury. The itinerary was well chosen, although we did opt to have a few days at leisure – one each in Hanoi and HCMC.Food – generally good throughout, however when meals were provided they were usually a set menu. I personally would have preferred to be able to have an a-la-carte option and would have been willing to pay the difference. We did have to pay for drinks.Arranging the tour was simple. Every question was promptly handled by return email. Easier that if they were in the shopping centre just up the road. A big Thank you to Ms Hien Pham.Would I use Luxury Travel again? Well, regrettably, I don’t think that I will be going back there in the near future, but I have already recommended them to a few friends so that means “Yes.” Yes I would use them again and yes, I would like to go back.

Vietnam is EXTRA special with Luxury Travel. My experiences traveling with Luxury Travel were OUTSTANDING!After working in Vietnam for seven months as volunteer teachers in HCMC and making short trips to DatLat, CuChi, Tay Ninh and My Tho with Vietnamese friends from Ton Duc Thang University, we were eager to explore more of Vietnam before returning to USA. As retired Americans with a limited budget as well as the need to pace ourselves physically, we were impressed with Luxury Travel's planning skills and each individual tour guide's and driver's abilities to offer us daily alternatives during each itinerary. We planned three different tours with the assistance of Luxury Travel with a total of approximately 20 "days-on-the-road" tailored to our budget, time and interests. Luxury Travel enthusiastically responded to ALL of our requests, revisions and concerns during tours planning and then on a daily basis. We wanted to see typical tourist sites such as Hue, HaLong Bay, Hanoi and Sapa. Each guide and driver was exceptional in knowledge about history, culture, geography while also sharing personal stories and insights. Our "off-the-wall" questions were always answered -- even if a little "overnight" research was needed. Each guide's personality and sense of humor were a real addition to the fun of the tours. We also wanted to visit and learn more about the American War, Ho Chi Minh, General Giap and other political topics. We were interested in the economy, government and people's organizations of Vietnam. Luxury Tours worked with us to develop tours to Con Dao, Tuyen Quang Province, Nghe An Province and Hanoi which more than encompassed our interests. Again, each guide and driver was very attentive to our interests, questions and traveling goals. We often requested daily changes -- and were always gladly supported by the guides and drivers -- whether the change was an unplanned stop, trying new foods, taking specific photos, questions about local history or economy, discussing politics, sharing family stories, finding special types of souvenirs or taking time for rest and naps. The LONG hikes to ethnic group villages near Sapa were balanced with the relaxation of cruising HaLong Bay. All accommodations (hotels, restaurants, cars, HaLong boat) were comfortable -- often beautiful -- and perfect fits for our budget. We were VERY happy travelers!The knowledge, range of contacts, skills, talents and personalities of the Luxury Travel staff (Ms. Thao was the "executive" contact for us) make them the perfect partners for traveling in Vietnam. We hope to get to better know the incredibly friendly, warm, inspiring and interesting people of Vietnam with future visits. Meantime we greatly appreciate the Vietnam adventures we experienced with the help of Luxury Travel.I encourage any and all travelers to utilize the talents, skills and experience of Luxury Travel!Leanna Noble

Highly recommended. My boyfriend and I booked with Luxury travel as part of a 3 month trip. Part of our stop included Vietnam Hanoi and Ho Chi mihn city. We booked with them as the price was good and it showed us everywhere we wanted to see. It was such a good trip from start to finish. We were very well looked after, guides were great. Their knowledge, friendliness and willingness to help you. Also food was very good, taken to some very good restaurants. I would very much recommend this company. We had a great time.

A perfect vacation in Vietnam and Angkor Wat. We do our own travel planning. Wanted to go the Vietnam and Angkor Wat but not sure how. Went online and found Luxury Travel and met Ms. Hien. Yes we felt like we met our new agent. She and Luxury put together a two week experience that was close to perfect. Great guides in Hanoi, Hue and Ho Chi Minh city. Wonderful mix of seeing the countryside, Halong Bay, the cities, the people, local markets, beaches in Hoi An, museums and even a day of golf at Kings Island. Angkor Wat was quite splendid as well. Quite a joy, thanks Ms. Hien and Luxury.

One day tour. We decided to arrange a day trip to a orphanage and after a few hiccups do to Tet holidays all turned out exceptional ,our tour guide Quan went the extra mile for us ,the lunch was superb the tours were fun and informal Ps don't buy from the first place you go into as prices vary from shop to shop at Ba Trang Pss was a pity we could not go to the orphanage due to holidays

Wonderful organisation. After 5 years of procrastination we finally decided to take a vacation trip to Vietnam, and on the advice of a friend we contacted Luxury Travel directly to organise a programme for us.From the initial email to the final departure from HCMC airport the trip went like a dream. We agreed with Mrs Quynh the outline of the 16 days, a trip which involved 5 star hotels individual travel arrangements and business class flights internally, and she then kept us up to date with the suggestions for accommodation, travel and the various excursions as she was booking them.We were met by their representative at the airport on arrival, and the trip went without a hitch, from Ho Chi Minh City, to Hanoi, Halong Bay, Hue, Hoi An, Danang, Dalat and back to Saigon, including three internal flights, several long car rides, and 6 different hotels. All the guides and reps were highly competent, transport worked perfectly and the hotels excellent. All this and having to cope with the Tet (Vietnamese New Year) preparations and celebrations which was going on all around us.In summary, we can completely endorse Luxury Travel, and would trust them to organise any Vietnamese Programme in the future.

Excellent vacation!. Luxury Travel arranged our Vietnam vacation in conjunction with our local travel agent in Vermont.The trip was amazing and the attention from luxury travel and our guide, Cuong Nguyen to every single detail, was outstanding.We highly recommend contacting this company for any questions or future visits to Vietnam.

Our visit to Vietnam. For our 2013 holiday the company provided a very good service with attention to detail that was impressive. We spent 10 nights at the An Lam beach resort and two nights in Saigon which included a city tour and a private boat for a sail in the Mekong delta. The private, tailored service that was provided meant that we felt privileged and secure. Our company contact Ms Duong went out of her way to ensure that our travel arrangements were everything that we could have wished for. She was very effective and efficient.Our tour in Saigon, which was very well organised, included the main sights of the city and the main market (which we appreciated less) and an extraordinary trip to the Mekong delta which included a private sail on the Princess boat. Our stay at the An Lam resort was so enjoyable that we are going back this year, again organised with the help of Ms. Duong.

A trip to Vietnam - in Luxury!. With Luxury Travel Vietnam, it really is travelling in luxury so if that's what you are after then I can't recommend them enough! They really look after you and your whole trip; your accommodation, tour guides and itinerary. Their staff are very friendly and the itinerary for Vietnam is amazing! Definitely a must see place. I would go back any day!

Luxury Travel was great!. We are a family of four and spent a couple of weeks in December (2013) and early January in Vietnam and Cambodia. Ms Doan Hong Linh did a fantastic job organizing the trip. Most of our guides were fabulous especially "KK" in Hanoi, Mr. Hoang in Hue and Hoian and wonderful Nak in Siem Reap.We didn't have to worry about accommodations, and we saw incredible sights. Especially enjoying for the family was the one night cruise at Halong Bay.

Amazing experience!. From the first contact through email, our experience with Luxury Travel Co. was impeccable. My husband and i traveled for a week, visiting vietnam north to South. All our guides were fantastic and very knowledgable, specially An in Hoi An!they chose the best hotels and restaurants for us and adapted to all of our needs.I truly recommend this agency!

Unforgettable experience!! Food delicious & healthy!!. We did the 2 night cruise and every minute onboard was worth it! We were very lucky as the weather was awesome, sunny and bright, and not extremely hot! First day is packed with activities (visit a cave, snorkel, sunset party, dinner) so don´t have time to really relax. Second day we transferred to a smaller boat and cruised all day, did some snorkel, bbq on the beach, relaxing on the boat...it was great! And the scenery absolutely wonderful! Harry (the manager) and the rest of the staff made us feel at home. Food is very good, delicious, fresh and good quality. Will recommend it to everyone that wants to have a typical vietnamese experience.

Great cruise, great service. We experienced 2 nights with a great team on the Paloma Cruise. The cruise bed room and amenities has been just renovated and upgraded. All looked very new and I can not complaint anything. Food was good. We loved a cooking demonstration with chef guidance. Staffs were very friendly and they were willing to help when we were in need. Highly recommended.

Fantastic time in a stunning place!. Had a great time on our one night stay on board.. the views are stunning from the decks and also from the rooms! The staff are super helpful, Mr bean was very friendly and informative, Tai and Jimmy were also very helpful and interesting. The rooms are lovely and air conditioned. Food is tasty and lots of it. We visited a cave, a fishing villlage and a pearl farm. They pack a lot in (which is optional). You will not want to leave!

Wonderful experience. I am traveling with my husband on a 3 month trip and we'd been doing mostly budget things but decided to spend a little more to do 2 nights on Halong Bay with Paloma. It was such a wonderful experience and well worth the money! At first I was worried we'd be kind of over planned with group activities but that didn't end up being the case at all. The views are beautiful and just being on the boat you are immediately relaxed. Every single staff member was kind and eager to help and we enjoyed learning some stories from each of them. You can tell they take a lot of pride in their work and truly enjoy what they do! We were really happy to have chosen the 2 night option as the 1 night guests didn't get as much time to just relax and enjoy. The food on the boat was fantastic. I am a picky eater and don't like seafood which I was worried about, but I just let them know and they fixed delicious non-seafood alternatives for every single course of every single meal. I was so impressed! My husband did say however that it was some of the best seafood he had in Vietnam so I was probably missing out! Sleeping on the boat was great...two of the best nights sleep we've had on this whole trip. If I go back to Halong Bay I would happily do this cruise again and again!

The best of the best. We did the 1 night, 2 day cruise and It was amazing!!! Every single bit of it.The staff were funny, kind, creative and lovely. The food was spectacular and the activities were on point. Anyone can do them too as the guides are very helpful.Highly recommend this cruise.

Not to be missed. We researched many cruises and we were not disappointed with the paloma. We were picked up from our hotel in a very comfortable amd modern mini bus, that also offered free WiFi, and nice cold air conditioning. The staff on the paloma were very friendly, especially our cruise manager Mr bean, and our bar tender Mr. Gin!. The food was amazing and plentiful. The room was also comfortable and clean. We enjoyed all the activities and the scenery was spectacular. Definitely not to be missed

Cruising Halong Bay. We were picked up in the old quarter of Hanoi in a comfortable mini bus.The highway is quite a rough road but we stopped 1/2 way for coffee.We were made very welcome by our tour leader,& our room was very comfortable on the boat..The food was exceptional & there is a roof top bar for drinks & to enjoy the view of Halong Bay.We went kyaking which was a lot of fun.This is a great boat with very hospitable staff.Great memories .

Grear cruise. Paloma picked us up in Hanoi and we took a 4 hour trip to Halong City. Harry greeted us and we took a small boat to the Paloma vessel. We opted for the 1 night cruise. Harry was a great guide and the boat was clean and comfortable. Halong Bay itself is breathtaking. We didn't encounter a huge number of other boats and we fitted in a swim, kayak and a trip to the floating village. The food was plentiful and the staff were very attentive. The only criticism was the quite loud air con during the night. If they were to upgrade the units (they're welcome relief) the cabins would be great.

Halong Bay.. We booked this cruise at the last minute so got a good price. After reading good reviews decided to book it. When I sent off the deposit online I got an email back saying if I send another 30% deposit they would drop the price another $60US so no problems there. We also go a free upgrade as well. Maybe because we walked to their office instead of hanging around for staff to come to us to pay. Not sure. This is a professional company from start to finish. Staff were friendly, all did their jobs well. Started with lunch, wow so much food. After lunch taken to a cave, then back to the boat for kayaking. That was so much fun particularly because my friend and I weren't very good at it particularly me as I have never done it. Here were we kayaking about 3kms into a cave. It is a must do. So many laughs. After this was swimming and relaxing. Dinner was even more impressive than lunch. Again heaps of food. Drinks were a bit expensive but compared to home still cheaper. I am so glad we chose this cruise after the hotel tried to sell us a different one at over $100 US each more expensive. That is a lot of beer and drinks money. This cruise I highly recommend.

Beautiful cruise . My boyfriend and I really enjoyed our cruise of Halong Bay with Paloma. All the staff were very friendly and accommodating. Harry was a great host and was always keeping the mood light. The food on the cruise was delicious and there was a lot of it. I highly recommend doing a cruise of Halong Bay, the views are postcard perfect. Although we had a problem with a leak in our room due to a storm the night we took the cruise, I would choose Paloma again for their great service.

Really impressed . My husband and I spent one night on Paloma with some of our friends. We desperately wanted to visit Ha Long bay and had been told that this was the best way to do it. When we informed our hotel we were doing the trip with Paloma who told us that they were one of the best providers of this excursion - we were not disappointed. The staff on board were absolutely phenomenal, especially Harry who made absolutely every effort to ensure that our time on board was enjoyable. He even gave us our own demonstration at the pearl farm as it was too busy for the four of us to join in with the rest of the group. The food was also brilliant, very varied and plenty of it, sometimes it was difficult to finish. In addition, the activities were perfect. Kayaking around the mountains was one of my highlights along with Thai chi on the boat deck in the morning whilst sailing through the bay. The cabins were clean and had everything you could possibly need for a place to rest your head. They were small, but I don't know what you would expect for a cabin on a boat. Paloma only has 22 cabins on board meaning that the staff take their time to get to know you and can really focus on making your trip with them special. I would certainly recommend Paloma if you're considering taking a trip to Ha Long bay. Thank you Harry and your team for making it so perfect.

Wonderful cruise. Halong Bay it self is already beautiful. Even better with a professional organized cruiser. Even if they have to handle mass of tourists we felt treated as a special guest. We have had booked the family suite with balcony for the 2 day trip.

Highlight of our Vietnam trip. Myself and my partner were on board for one night and had a great time! The scenery is breathtaking which is a given but the crew are very friendly, fun and make the trip what it is! They are very hard working making sure the trip is once I a life time experience. The kayaking, swimming, cave exploring and visiting the fishing village were very good. The food was amazing and catered for our needs (vegetarian) extremely well while addressing us by our names which was going the extra mile in customer service in my opinion. We met similar outgoing people on board and had a few drinks and a little dance on the deck at night which I won't forget in a hurry! All in all it's brilliant!

Great experience.. lovely cruise... Had a very good experience starting from the pick from our hotel to the drop back after the cruise. Comfortable drive to halong bay in the air conditioned mini van with WiFi connectivity through out the drive. Small comfortable cruise with a very friendly and hospitable staff. The manager Mr. Bean really took good care of us. The family Suite that we were allotted was cute and comfortable with a private terrace which was great. Food was good and as our daughter wanted to have only fish and veggies, they even arranged that. Would take the cruise again when in Halong Bay next time.

Luxurious night spent on Ha Long Bay with Paloma Cruises. My boyfriend and I booked a one night 2 day package with Paloma Cruises on Ha Long Bay months ago and finally experienced it a couple of days ago. Ha Long Bay is incredibly beautiful and peaceful - you feel like you're on the edge of the world once you're out in the bay.With Paloma Cruises we could fully enjoy the beauty and serenity of the bay thanks to their five star service, comfortable cabins, and smooth itinerary.I loved how you could do however much or little you felt like when it came to activities. For example we didn't feel like kayaking and therefore opted for cocktails on the deck and a quick dip later on. The staff also made a good effort to get people to mingle by putting on a "Sunset Party" with happy hour and complimentary snacks up on the top deck. Not only was the sunset phenomenal, but the drinks we strong and the music was on point for getting people socializing. I would highly recommend paying more for a seamless experience like this. The people on our boat definitely seemed happier than a lot of other groups we saw coming and going between their boats and the sites we saw!Oh and also a shout-out to our cruise manager/guide Hoang - or Harry in English - who kept the atmosphere light and full of laughs with his own special brand of humor. Enjoy the Paloma!

A neat way to tour the bay. Nice cozy cruise. Very responsive and accommodating staff! I was really impressed with the cruise ride itself. A very smooth ride without many bumps. It's important that you sign up for the cruise with the right mindset though, this type of cruise should not be compared to the Caribbean cruises! All in all a fun way to see nature up close!

Brilliant. This was a magical experience, and I would recommend Paloma to anyone looking for a fantastic cruise option in Halong Bay.My mother and I selected a mid-range cruise and went on a 2 day/1 night cruise, which included visiting some less touristy parts of Halong Bay, visiting a cave, a pearl village and some swimming or kayaking for those who were interested.Right from the start, we could see this was a really well organised company. The transfers from Hanoi worked brilliantly. On arrival in Halong City, we were taken to an office to wait (free drinks and WIFI). Then organised efficiently onto a tender to travel out to the boat. We were impressed by the high safety standards and that we were all told to wear life jackets at all times on the tender.The boat was lovely: very clean and all the food we were served was delicious. Our cabin was also spotless.We very much enjoyed the excursions to the cave and the village. I went swimming in the bay, which was a great experience.What really made this special though were the staff. Mr Bean is an excellent guide with brilliant English. Justin was an excellent instructor at squid fishing. What I want to say here though is that without exception, all the staff were fantastic. They were professional at all times and very polite and helpful. I am sorry I do not have all their names, and I also know that there are many staff members working hard who the passengers do not see. But if anyone from Paloma management reads this, I would like to say that I hope they value the staff, because they were fantastic.For us, Paloma was definitely the right choice.

Did not meet expectations. One night on Paloma cruise with 2 cabins. The activities were very basic and boring, Thai Chi teacher was ill and canoeing was pointless, nowhere to go. Diving from the boat was actually most fun. If you like a tight and arranged schedule, this is the right place. But it is not very relaxing amd pretty boring.

Unforgettable cruise experience in Halong bay. For 3 days and 2 nights we decided to sail on a cruise through Halong bay. The trip was really worth the money. Comfortable spaces and cabin. Delicious food, all well cooked and served. It was a great choice for our honeymoon, and they also treated us with surprises we truly appreciate.
Halong what a magic!. Everything was perfect: the view, the food and the crew! Amazing sightseeings and activicty and Henry the crew manager is really great!!!

Excellent cruise, one of the better Halong Bay companies. Enjoyed our two night/ three day cruise. Would recommmend all to do this. The 1 nighter is not worth your money as it is a very short visit. As a 2-night visitor you get to enjoy Halong Bay to the fullest, including a lunch on the beach, swimming, kayaking, and just takig it easy and enjoy the view. We had a great day with the others that stayed for two nights (we were a group of 12).Due to a typhoon our trip was cut short by a few hours but this was no worries as we were glad to be safely into port again. The compensation we got from Paloma was also very generous for something that was out of their control. Would recommend going with Paloma.

Very good time in the cruise. Every member of my family had a good time and was satisfied with the good service. Especially the steps were very kind.The facilities of the cruise were a little bit old but it doesn't matter. Every meal was very good. The room with balcony was fantastic, so I recommend to stay in this room.

Fantastic way to explore Halong Bay. We were a group of 9 people and booked this cruise last minute. So glad we did as it was wonderful. We went on the two night/3 day cruise and everything was very well organised. The bedrooms were small but comfortable with ensuite shower and good views over the water. All meal is were included and of good quality. We visited a cave on the first afternoon and loved being on the Sun deck before dinner. The views of Halong Bay are truly memorable. Mr Bean was a fantastic entertaining host. On the second day we were transferred to a smaller boat and went kayaking - the highlight going through a cave into a 'lost world'. Boys enjoyed jumping and swimming off the boat. Thanks to Mr Justin who was also a fabulous host. On the last day we got up early to visit a fishing village, and taken on an hour bamboo boat ride around it. All good fun. On returning to the main boat we checked out and had a fun cookery lesson on spring rolls before going back to port. The return mini bus journey to Hanoi was included as part of the price.One disconcerting episode on the boat was on the first night at about 3am when I happened to look out the window and saw another boat drifting towards us. I called the manager who called the captain and they were able to wake the other crew to move their boat. Apparently we were not in danger but it was scary to see a boat so close ( it even bumped us twice), particularly at that time in the morning! It was dealt with quickly and efficiently though and hasn't put me off. I would go again tomorrow if I could!

Dream wedding on Paloma. We spent our wedding on Paloma 3 days-2 nights cruise in July 2016. Sent emails with Ms. Huyen during 18 month-period and everything was arranged as agreed, even something extra. Little and big surprises were amazing! On board Mr. Bean and Harry were the most professional and helpful staff we've met.This was our second time on Paloma, therefore: Highly recommended! Thank you for making our lifelong dream come true!

unforgetteable bay wonderful place. There are lots of Cruises on Halong bay and we were happy that we chose Paloma. It was very nice junk, clean room, service was very good. We did enjoyed it very much. Will come back another time.

Wonderful cruise and awesome crew (Mr Bean was Great!). My husband and I decided to spend a part of our honeymoon on this cruise which we will never forget. The crew were very friendly and the service was great. Our guide Mr Bean surprised us at dinner with flowers, cake and a love song to celebrate our honeymoon which was very sweet. He is a great guide and very passionate about what he does. We highly recommend this cruise and look forward to coming back in the future.

Good experience but could have some improvements. Overall we really enjoyed the cruise, the landscape was stunning and the boat and people on board including the staff were lovely. A few things to note, the 2 days and 1 night is actually about: 24 hours in total. The kayaking lasted about 10 minutes. The fishing from the back of the boat was funny because after 10 minutes we were told it isn't actually squid season! The staff on board are lovely but I get the impression that a lot of it is centred around getting a good review on trip advisor rather than actually providing a top class service. Expense wise, be careful not to rack up a 1.5 million bar tab like we did, one annoyance here is that we were offered coffee after lunch and were charged for it, really should have been free!Having said that, the rooms were great, the food was amazing and the way the trip runs is pretty smooth.Anyway to summarise, I would highly recommend Paloma cruise to everyone and thank them for a good 24 hours!

Leisurely cruise. My group of four went on the 2D1N cruise of Halong Bay, and we had a great time. The cruise captain, Harry, was a great host, and unleashed several good jokes. The rest of the crew were approachable and provided impeccable service during our stay. They even woke up at 2am to try and help us tune into the Euro 2016 game even though we were out at sea. A very dedicated team! The tour itinerary was relaxed and enjoyable.

Very good service. Mr Bean & Mr hoang is the best crew. Husband and myself had a great & relaxing time at the Paloma cruise Halong bay.Staff were extremely friendly.Kudos to our tour guide,Mr Bean for always entertaining us + he has good knowlegde about Halong bay history.Thanks to Mr Hoang and his crew members for a great service.I will definitly come back to this cruise

Couldn't fault this cruise!. We did the 2 day 1 night cruise with our 10 year old daughter and we actually couldn't fault it! We were nervous about doing the cruise, especially as we were taking our daughter and we had read many bad reviews about different cruises through Halong Bay. But this cruise was absolutely fantastic. The food was excellent, they serve many different varieties of dishes. We had the family room which is up the front of the boat and we had our own balcony. The service was 5 star, the English was very good! We enjoyed the whole atmosphere and the activities we did! Would recommend this cruise for families!

3 Days 2 Night was relaxing experience!Highly recommended.. Pickup Van was clean and spacious,wifi was working for most part of the trip.Amazing team who took great care of us and Harry and Bean were quite helpful.Vegetarian food was made on request for us as my hubby is a vegan.They serve fresh and delicious food.It was like a 2 day feast.They even gifted us a cake for our wedding anniversary.Team Paloma made the cruise highlight of our vietnam trip.Take one day trip,if you are energetic and in a hurry to cover more places as day 2 in 3D2N is almost same as day 1.(3D2N is more for a relaxed lazy day)Since the owner replies to review,i would like to know about the health of one staff,who got a cut on foot by shells on 24th june.Has he recovered and healed?Thanks Team Paloma for your making our stay wonderful.

Amazing experience . 1 night Cruise with the fella. Fantastic time from the minute we got picked up. Comfy beds and ice cold air-conditioning. The staff are incredible always smiling, making young children giggle and will go the extra mile to make you feel welcome. Best food so far in Vietnam and plenty of it. Big thumbs up 2 Mr Bean and the crew.

Great experience. We had great experience with Paloma. Mr bean the cruise manager is very friendly & humorous. One of my luggage has gone missing, and he was taking great effort to find it. Kayaking & sampan ride to floating village were the most memorable activities. Cave is too small. Food is good, but not great. We stayed at Family room with front balcony which was awesome & made the trip more enjoyable. However, the shower is weak but still ok. Shuttle van is comfortable.

Amazing exprience. Amazing experience wrapped by an idyllic landscape and very recommendable cruise.The staff was very polite, attentive and funny,Food is quite good and the activities complete two non-stop days, no time for boring.Rooms are comfortable and has all the services required.Negative points:Drinks are not included in the services and some drinks are very expensive. Some dishes cannot be ordered twice.Very good cruise and totally recommendable.

2 days 1 night.....hmmmmm more like 1 day 1 night but don't let that put you off!. My hotel offered this cruise at a very high price plus a single supplement making it incredibly expensive. I contacted the company directly by whatsapp and they were much more accommodating.The cruise was run professionally and I enjoyed it but there are a few things you need to beat in mind and I suspect this is applicable to all 2 day 1 night cruises.....When you take in travelling time two and from Halong Bay you are really just spending 24 hours on the boat. I suspect a 3 day cruise is more value for money.Due to the tight timings you are on a tight timetable so kayaking takes place at a specific time, swimming takes place at a specific time etc.The level of English spoken by the crew was good and Harry and Bing were great!The food is great but in your last day you have breakfast at 7.45 and lunch (brunch) at 11. I didn't love the way the meals were crammed in.You visit a pearl farm and fishing village which you sail to on sampans but because our Sampan was the last to leave we missed most of he explanation of how cultured pearls are produced. They should really wait for the whole group to be together.I had a slight issue in that I was undercharged for the cruise so had to go to the office to pay the correct amount. I had no issue with this but I therefore incurred 3 sets if bank charges with no apology which was a little frustrating but not a total disaster.This cruise was good and I would recommend it but with a caveat that a 3 day trip might be better.

cruise through a natural wonder. From the moment you step on board, the crew cannot do enough to make the cruise a highlight of your stay in Vietnam. From the delicious food to the room/cabin facilities, you are going to love it. The bay is a nature wonderland. We experienced the floating fishing village/pearl-farming and the huge caves.Our cruise was an overnight trip.

See and Enjoy Halong Bay!. My wife and I took the 2-night cruise. On the first night there were about 30 people on board. The second night only had about 16 passengers. I recommend the 2 night cruise because of all the activities you miss otherwise. There is plenty of time for leisure and fun activity (kayaking, swimming, exploring caves, fishing, etc.).The van ride from Hanoi to the port is about 4 hrs. Long trip but the van has good Wi-Fi which helps to make the time go by quickly. Acceptable room accommodations on board, GREAT food, organized activities, great sightseeing and plenty of humidity in June. Rooms are air conditioned which makes sleeping comfortable. Our English speaking guide, Mr. Bean, was excellent!

Awesome cruise with great caring crew. It was our first time to Halong Bay and we were glad that we chose Paloma cruises to bring us around. Not only was the tour itinerary fun and relaxed, at a good pace, the crew was really a very caring and fun one. My husband and I will like to specially commend Mr Bean, assistant cruise manager, for his excellent service and kindness. He was genuine and very friendly, making us feel very welcomed like friends with the many stories he shared. There was a little boy in our cruise who was crying in pain from a jellyfish sting during the swim, and Mr Bean went out of his way to do magic tricks for him just to cheer him up. It was a very kind thing for him to do and we are truly moved by such a caring nice crew :) Everyone was so friendly and accommodating and it was a very comfortable stay for us with good food and fun time! Thank you Paloma Cruises :)
Excellent hospitality. Very friendly crew,very hospitable.being vegetarians they catered to our needs so well.sight seeing was good too. Overall excellent traveling with Paloma.
Halong Magic. We all had a fabulous time on this cruise definitely recommend everything was perfect even the weather

Good level of services in an extraordinary natural location. Minibus transfer perfectly organized as well the embarkment on Paloma Junk. Right dimension, not too big but enough. Nice and quite clean rooms, considering that is a wooden ship, perfect service and great level of food. Better 2 days/3night package to not run too much and enjoy relax on second day.

Mr. Bean Steals the Show. The Paloma cruise is a delightful time in the beautiful Ha Long bay composed of almost 2,000 islands. An eventful itinerary including kayaking, cave exploring, and swimming is interspersed with delicious many course meals. We chose the two night option and would highly recommend it to get the most out of the cruise.The highlight of the cruise though is the delightful staff, the star of which is Mr. Bean. Whether he is guiding you by kayak through caves, jumping off the roof with you into the water, or showing you his amazing card magic abilities, Mr. Bean does everything with an uplifting smile on his face. He went above and beyond to make us feel like family.Overall, if the weather is permitting and you have the time, the Paloma cruise is a must for its beautiful views, good food, and friendly staff.

Very relaxing and enjoyable stay! . Me and my boyfriend stayed here for 2 nights and the whole experience was wonderful. The staff were very friendly, in particular Justin and Mr Bean were very good to us and continued to make sure we were happy! The tour is brilliant and the caves and kayaking is a lot of fun. The food was very tasty too and they serve 7 mini courses which was a nice variety and very filling! Its great for friends/families/couples/solo travellers so I would highly recommend this tour to anyone! I will be returning in the future!

Great staff, beautiful views, okay food. Had a great time with Paloma Cruises (our guide Mr. Bean, was very attentive and knowledgeable). We were fortunate to have a wonderful group of couples with us on our 2D/1N tour. The ride from Hanoi is long (which isn't Paloma Cruises fault, just a warning), and the food was plentiful but a little bland. The rooms were a little small as well. Otherwise, a VERY pleasant trip!

Paloma Cruise. The staff at Paloma were excellent, they were caring of the individuals needs, funny and very friendly. I found it great that they took the time to remember your name. I would recommend Paloma Cruise to anyone. I'm sure I'll return to see more of the wonderful sites of Ha Long Bay.

Brilliant way to see Ha long . Great trip. Got to experience numerous different aspects of the bay. The food was amazing - we never stopped eating! Mr Bean, our guide was fabulous and led a great tour. I would highly recommend.

Fun trip with kids. The drive to the bay is long. Too long for a day trip. My boys are 12/10/8. We have 2 rooms with the family suite which has its own private balcony. Like what another reviewer said, one cannot compare this cruise to an American or European cruise standard. But that said, the rooms are comfortable and clean, though my shower door dislodged from the hinge. There were sufficient activities to keep everyone entertained with some downtime. My kids loved the sea kayaking and cave visit. We were on the 1N/2D which we felt was plenty. The bay was beautiful and quiet. We were fortunate that our cruise was assigned a quieter route to Bai Tu Long bay. Once we left the port of embarkment, it got quiet and less boats were around us. I only saw 1 or 2 other boats for most of the trip.

Small Vacation in Paloma. We are really happy with our decision to spent money on Paloma cruise.Its one of the best and memorable time for me & my family.i loved everything.All the staffs were just amazing especially Mr Bean.He was cute little man with very good English and sweet smile.we really found him responsible and helpful person.Halong bay is beautiful and with these people ot will become more and more beautiful.

Great 2D 1N Trip!. My friend and I went for the 2D 1N cruise and it was a great experience. The boat was not too big, not too small and the room quite comfortable, though we wished there was a kettle and tea/coffee provided in the rooms. The food was delicious, and we loved the activities planned, especially kayaking amongst the limestone cliffs and visiting a floating fishing village. Because Paloma Cruises takes you to Bai Tu Long Bay, which is part of Halong bay but not the overcrowded area where most cruises dock at, it was fairly secluded and quiet. The staff were also great, especially Mr Bean! Thank you Paloma Cruises for a great experience.

Excellent service but bad luck with other attendants. Would really like to do this again, food was great and service amazing, however we had really bad luck having a group of almost 30 frat kids taking over the entire boat and being extremely rude, stealing bottles from the bar and trying to put drinks on other guests rooms. I understand this is nothing the crew can prevent, but it was just a shame for everyone else.

Excellent staff and food. We chose the three day two night cruise and im so glad we did. We had perfect weather and could not havebasked for better staff. I was 28 weeks pregnant at the time and the staff were so caring and mind to me. The food was exeptional and there was so much to cboose from. Highly reccomend.

Excellent, 2 day 1 night cruise. We were booked on Paloma for 2 day 1 night as part of our Vietnam tour via our tour organizer in Hanoi Thankfully we had a private car for both legs of the journey as the drive is approximately 4 hours The boat was exceptionally clean, the food was abundant and of really good quality, our Deluxe cabins were comftable and spacious and totally adequate for a over night stay All of the crew friendly and helpful especially Harry & Mr Bean The activities were not strenuous, well organized and in our eyes just perfect.While the Bay itself is slightly busier than we expected, all in all a wonderful experienceHilary B

Sublime cruise around Bai Tu Long Bay. Ha Long and Bai Tu Long bays are beyond beautiful, and this cruise did the UNESCO World Heritage Site justice, taking us to sites that, while firmly on the tourist trail, were far from crowded. It helped that the ship was only a quarter full, but life on board was really pleasant. The food was great, the cabins clean and comfortable, the view of the limestone islands constantly surprising. The service is good, though the attentiveness of the guides and crew can get repetitive (the need to constantly entertain wore thin, and I would happily have been left alone). The opportunity to kayak to a cove hidden within one of the islands, straight out of The Land That Time Forgot, was worth the price alone.

Uncrowded Bai Tu Long Bay with Paloma. I travelled with my husband and 10 year old daughter. We booked the family suite which had a beautiful private balcony with three sunbeds. The spacious balcony faced the very front of the boat and gave us an excellent view. We had a lot of fun on our own private deck. The boat is in fairly good condition for a 10 year old boat though we did see some signs of aging in the woodwork in the bathroom. The food was excellent and plentiful. The crew are very friendly and accommodating, especially Mr. Bean who took good care of us. Activities were well planned, though a little rushed. The boat docked at a very scenic area in Bai Tu Long Bay and we kayaked from the boat. Swimming was also done off the boat. My young daughter really enjoyed both these activities. The cave visit was very average. However, the visit to the floating fishing village was a highlight. We got into little boats rowed by locals who also kindly lent us some conical Vietnamese hats which gave good protection from the fierce sunlight and made for great photo shoots. The scenery around this floating village was absolutely stunning. I believe the sunlight brings out the beauty of the bay and summer is a good time to visit. The route that Paloma took was not crowded, in fact we only came across an occasional boat or two and we did not see unsightly rubbishy in the sea. Choose Paloma for a special and memorable experience.

Excellent cruise on Halong Bay. Choose Paloma cruises for an overnight trip to Halong Bay, based on a friends recommendation, and they didnt disappoint.The boat was a good size, not too big or small, almost a full contingent of passengers but it never felt crowded.Staff were very friendly and helpful. Nothing was too much trouble.Food servings were great, they produced some wonderful stuff from the small kitchen at the back if the boat.Cabins were small but had everything needed, size did not matter as only there to sleep in.The cruise itself was great, not too hurried with a variety of activities. One night was a nice pace.People say Halong Bay is overcrowded with tourist boats but did not find that to be true. Would recommend this cruise company to experience Halong Bay.

Amazing experience with Paloma. Booked a 2d1n package with Paloma.Our room is beautiful and comfy. The sundeck is cosy for us to hang out at in the morning and after sunsent. Mr Bean and his crew is always full of smiles on board, there was never a dull moment with them. Service crew's English is decent. Food tastes incredible. I had a gastric attack on board (old illness), the crew kindly gave me some meds to ease it off. During dinner time when I didn't have much appetite for the food items, they made me extra scramble eggs upon request.In short, highly recommended if you're looking for a good value-for-money cruise in Ha Long Bay. Tips: Try booking using the whatsapp no. given on their website. The director will personally tend to your queries and maybe even give you a discount when you book directly through him. ;)

Excellent cruise. I would definitely recommend this cruise to everyone. The whole staff is so friendly and funny. All the food was AMAZING! Ha Long Bay is so beautiful and you get to see a lot. Pictures do not even do it justice. I wish we would have done the 2 night instead of the 1 night. If you have the time I would highly recommend 2 nights. Couldn't say enough positive things about the cruise!

Excellent experience! Highly recommended. Went for the 2d1n package with my lovely, beautiful, smart and funny gf and thoroughly enjoyed ourselves! Mr bean and crew were extremely friendly and nice, food tasted healthy yet delicious, room was neat and comfortably. Overall good value for the price we paid too (discount given when we booked via whatsapp). Highly recommended!

Wonderful experience on Halong Bay. I've always wanted to try a cruise and was finally able to do it in Vietnam. We found Paloma online; it had good reviews so we booked an overnight cruise with them. It was a wonderful experience! We have no complaints. Everything from the pickup from Hanoi, the activities during the cruise and return ride to Hanoi went smoothly. The food was excellent! Our guide Harry (I forgot his Vietnamese name) was very engaging and pleasant. We had such a good experience that we decided to book Paloma's motorbike tour back in Hanoi.

Highly recommended cruise to see Ha Long Bay/ Bai Tu Long Bay!!. My gf and I took an amazing 2 night cruise with Paloma and it was easily one of the highlights of our Vietnam trip! I will preface the rest of this review by saying that you cannot compare this cruise to American or European cruises. This is a different experience. Keep an open mind and you will have a great experience. If you have the time and money do the 2 night tour. Our friends did the 1 night tour and it was very short. You really need that extra day to relax and enjoy the bay. Also definitely go swimming on that first day! That was probably the better of the two beaches if you do the 2 night cruise. One last thing, for the love of god bring sunblock!!! The sun is brutal and it is very hard to find anywhere in Vietnam let alone on a boat!! SERVICE: Hotel pickup and dropoff from Hanoi was excellent. We shuttled in an uncrowded minibus with good working AC. There is one rest stop on the way but its a total tourist trap. Use the restrooms, by a drink and be on your way. The service on this boat was very good. The crew was very helpful and met all our needs. Mr. Bean even let us borrow some sunblock when we couldn't find any of our own. Its easy to see the crew works very hard to accommodate all passengers, especially Mr. Bean and Justin. The crew only get 4 days off a month. The rest of the time they are working on the cruise to make sure you are enjoying yourself. ACCOMMODATIONS: Our room as well as our friends room was clean, with fresh linens, and ice cold AC. Bathrooms had all the basic amenities and all plumbing worked as it should. The dining area is enclosed and has AC as well as fans which you don't really appreciate this until you see some of the other boats in the area. There is also a bar and a number of 4 seater tables. You are encouraged to talk with and engage the other passengers. We met some very fun and interesting people on this trip! The upper deck lounge was beautiful to watch the sun set in the evenings. Plenty of seating and a bar with decent selection to order drinks from.FOOD: The food overall was good. The breakfast buffet was excellent with a combination of western and Vietnamese cuisine. All other meals were Vietnamese with plenty of portions! Nothing particularly stood out, but the steaming prawn dish was kinda cool to see.ITINERARY: On the 1st day activities were somewhat enjoyable. The cave was a bit mediocre, but the beach was really nice to get away from the heat and humidity. I kind of wish we had more time there though. Dinner and relaxing in the evening was probably the highlight that day. On the 2nd day we were transferred to a smaller boat to take a day trip to another part of the bay. This day consisted of kayaking, swimming, exploring a cave, and relaxing on the boat with beer and cocktails. Once the boat anchored, we jumped in some kayaks to an isolated beach for swimming and lunch. Unfortunately there was quite a bit of trash in the water near the beach and the sun was pretty oppressive so once coming ashore everyone just hung out under whatever minimal shade there was. This was the low point of the trip since we were expecting a clean white sandy beach with clear water. We ended up kayaking back to the boat for lunch fortunately as it would have been too hot on the beach. After moving to another location, we took the kayaks out again and docked at a fairly impressive cave. We explored the cave while Justin acted as our tour guide. Upon returning to the boat, we were allowed to jump in to the water for a swim. This was both enjoyable and nerve-racking as we had noticed jelly fish throughout the day around our kayaks. But I didn't fly halfway across the world to just sit on a boat. We scanned the waters and determined there were no jelly fish around the boat so we jumped in. After cooling off with a swim in the bay and a few more beers we headed back to the main boat for our last dinner and some more relaxation. On the 3rd day, we visited the floating fishing village and pearl farm. It was pretty cool to see that people actually lived in these little floating huts. The pearl farm was somewhat interesting as well. VALUE: This cruise was by far our biggest expense for our 2 week Vietnam trip. However I think this is the only way to really appreciate and take in Ha Long Bay's beauty. Well worth the money in my opinion!

Great Service - Highly Recommended. The staff at Paloma were very attentive and friendly. The food was excellent and I looked forward to every meal. Well organised activities and very comfortable cabins on this cruise. I would recommend Paloma to anyone planning to visit Halong Bay. The price is well worth the quality of the service and thoroughly enjoyed my time.

11 of us on fantastic Paloma cruise. Had a fantastic trip with Paloma cruise as part of our study tour of Vietnam. Special thanks to Mr Bean Harry and Justin who worked so hard and made the trip really memorable. We all had such a fantastic time kayaking, squid fishing sunset drinks on the top deck a memorable trip... Thanks Palma cruise...
Mrs Arlene Peters. Very good accommodation, food excellent, staff very polite and helpful. Always something to do in the day and evenings, best to spend a few days on the boat and enjoy everything

Excellent cruise!. Had a wonderful experience on Paloma Cruise with my group of friends (spent two nights on the cruise). The food was great and the crew was incredibly kind, constantly trying to make sure we were having a great experience (special thank you to Mr. Bean).

2 night cruise not recommended. We enjoyed many aspects of the Paloma cruise--very good food that was extremely plentiful, charming wooden boat and cozy cabin, and wonderfully friendly crew. However, we ended up being rather unhappy with the 2n/3D cruise. For the second day we were transferred to a small boat for the day while the large boat returned to port to pick up more people. On the small boat we were urged to stay on the top deck where there was not enough shade and it was sweltering hot--close to 37 degrees. The staff stayed on the lower deck and had fans blowing, but there was no air conditioning (or at least it was not turned on). We came back from the long day exhausted and dehydrated. Then on the final day we were asked to clear out of our cabins by 9:30AM, but ended up sitting in the dining room until the boat docked at 12:30 so that the crew could clean the cabins for the next group of customers. Paloma cruise company seems to be trying to squeeze in as many customers as possible, but they do so at the expense of their current customers. Why not have separate 2 day vs 3 day tours, and allow everyone to stay comfortably on the big boat?Also be aware that drinks are not included in the cost of the tour, and there is no water available to drink except for bottled water that you purchase. I do want to say that we truly appreciated the warmth and professionalism of Harry and Mr. Bean, who do a marvelous job and are clearly not responsible for the issues I raised above.

Absolutely Amazing . My group's experience on the Paloma was worthy of five stars without a doubt. The crew was extremely helpful and kind, and constantly made sure that every guest was comfortable and satisfied. The activities planned each day allowed us to make the most of our time in Halong Bay and to explore it to the fullest (we opted for the 2 night package and I strongly recommend it). Lastly, every meal was delicious and filling. I would also like to make a special shout out to Mr. Bean, the assistant cruise manager, who is one of the most amazing people we have ever met. He went out of his way to make our trip as fun and worthwhile as possible, and I cannot begin to express how grateful we are for his help and friendship. Do not hesitate - choose Paloma Cruises! -Michael and Saskia

great cruise but better 2days 1night. Paloma cruise is a 4/5* floating hotel, the rooms are really nice, the staff really kind and friendly, the food is really good, i should give 5 star but doing 3days 2nights, the second day they take you to another boat a smaller one, a 2 stars boat that belong always to Paloma, many people were disappointed cause was also really sunny and there wasnt enough sorrow for everybody, the small boat has just one cabin if u wanna take shower or somebody feels bad,so if you gonna choose this cruise i suggest u to take the 2days 1night solution.

Awesome. Arrived on board with a warm friendly welcome from Harry. Lunch was served & served & served....plenty of choice and plenty of food. The fun then started...the team (mainly Harry, Mr Bean & Justin) kept us occupied with mini trips and party games. This was the highlight of the Vietnam holiday, warm friendly and funny team members along with amazing views. If this the calibre of Vietnamese people and their hospitality then Vietnam deserves another visit very soon!!! Well done team Paloma

Cruise of a lifetime!. We had a family suite which offers a private balcony. They were very professional, friendly, customers-oriented. The activities were properly arranged and quite jam-packed. A lot of memorable activities such as kayaking, tai chi, in which some of these are not offered by other cruise companies. I would definitely suggest this to friends and family.
Halong Bay Cruise. Fantastic Cruise that was well organised and staff were fabulous. Great food on board and heaps of fun activities. Bed was a little on the hard side though.

Excelent!. I stayed at paloma and everhthing Was excelent and exactly as agreed. The staff is great and the food and facilities are very good in relation with the price. The activities are well organized and fun.
A relaxing night in water. A good way to end the Hanoi trip - relaxed and well taken care off. Activities are planned to make it packed. But you could decide on not participating in some of them

Where's your princess?. We booked Paloma cruises quite a while before we went to Vietnam based on the reviews, and the two hosts (Mr Bean and Justin) didn't disappoint, they were friendly, funny and genuinely made the trip. The boat is great and our cabin comfortable and spacious! We did the 2D1N tour and think this is more than enough time, there were people who were on the 2 night trip which involves a lot of waiting between the activities, you do the same in the 1 night tour, it is just a packed schedule which is much more fun :) The food (especially the prawns) is great and service polite and so friendly. Would definitely recommend!

Fun trip but food was so-so. We stayed on the Paloma Cruise for one night and had a lovely time overall. The activities were well planned and everything ran to a very tight schedule. The food however, was slightly disappointing. It was fairly bland and our farewell lunch was cold. One good thing however was that I am Coeliac and they took my Gluten free diet very seriously, I appreciated that!With regards to the activities, the cookery class cannot really be called this - we made Spring Rolls but they had already prepared all the filling so really we just rolled the Spring Rolls. Also the beach we visited was disappointing, it was very small and over crowded! Kayaking and squid fishing was fun though and the fishing village was a nice little trip (despite the rain which could not be helped!)Overall, a nice trip with beautiful scenery but don't expect too much from the food.
Excellent. Fantastic cruise. Great boat, scrumptious food and lots of it. Our tour guide Mr Bean was awesome!!!

Missing Paloma and their crew.... We had the option of Indochina Sails or Paloma Cruises but we decided to go with Paloma since our friend highly recommended it. All I can say is, No Regrets! The crew was amazing!!! They were warm and friendly. Service was excellent and the rooms were very clean. The food was out of this world! They take your dietary requirements seriously. On our 2nd day on board, unfortunately it was raining so some of the activities had to be cut short but Justin did his best to entertain us. A special mention to Harry & Mr Bean as well for their wittiness and entertainment. Thank you Paloma for such a wonderful experience:)

beyond expectations!. After surfing through a lot of cruises along halong bay, my friends and I were litearally clueless on which cruise to choose from. Wewere not on a high budget so we ruled out all of those $500 cruise options and opted for midrange. There were stilla lot to choose from.. after spending few dahs on reviews and costs from travel agents, we came across paloma. Impress travels gave us at a price of $135 which seemed good for the reviews of paloma. We booked it although we knew we were not into the big shor cruises. But to our surprise, our expirience in paloma was beyond expectations. The crew was very helpful and friendly, especially the manager. There was a lot of food that kept coming and every single dish was very good. We had a vegetarian request already made, and it was very warm when the crew took extra care to make sure the veg food was as good as their usual listed menu. They had substituted veg options for every dish in the list including the soup and always made sure we liked the food.Absolutely no complains abt the food. We took the 1 night 2 day package so we found the activities were a bit rushy but afterall we went for a vacation and wouldn wanna get bored there. So we were fine with it. The rooms are not so big but they are cozy and comfortable and all u need for a night. Overall, our expirience with paloma was beyond expectations, and I would choose paloma again for a 2 night stay since I have already seen their standard of customer satisfaction.

Ha Long Bay Cruise. Beautiful cruise and amazing staff!!! We went in November and had the time of our lives. The tour we originally wanted was booked so this was our second choice. We are so glad that our first choice was completely booked. This cruise was perfect and Chan was amazing! Give that man a raise! He was so knowledgeable and friendly and made our trip so memorable. The food was plentiful and delicious. If anyone is thinking that this cruise is expensive, let me first tell you, it's not. You get five course meals of deliciously prepared food. You can get a chartered boat to a remote area to kayak and swim. We were lucky enough to have a nearly empty boat so we basically had a private boat take us to remote areas in Ha Long Bay with our own, amazing Chan. Words cannot describe how beautiful and amazing this Junk Boat is. And Chan was the icing on the cake.

Excellent Paloma Cruise Experience. We just returned from a 3 day 2 night cruise with these delightful people and thoroughly enjoyed it, the food and copious quantities of it, was amazing. We had one of the rear panoramic window suites which was great as you had a view from the side & also to the rear and it has a sitting room and sofa to relax on. Everything was clean and tidy and fairly well maintained for a 24/7 operating boat. The staff were exceptional and have customer service down pat, Harry, the cruise manager ran a smooth operation, with the help of all the staff like the funny Mr Bean with his guitar ( including multiple versions of Happy Birthday:) )and the knowledgable tour guide Justin! We also met a number of other friendly tourists from all places. Highly recommended!!

Great food and hospitality!. Glad we decided to do this - 2D1N Halong Bay cruise. Paloma is ranked a 4 star cruise and I found it to be very well worth the price compared to a 5 star. I'm not sure what could have been that different or that marginally better on a 5 star. We opted for the private transfer for $120 USD both ways. We didn't want to be crammed on a bus with 7 other people for a 4+ hour ride, despite the vans were pretty spacious. I thought the private transfer was a car, but it ended up to be our own private bus. Wifi on the bus - not strong but it's something. The food on Paloma was incredible. Truly authentic and everything plated - not a buffet like I expected (except at brekky). 2 lunches, 1 dinner and 1 breakfast - all delish! All drinks are extra $ except at breakfast. 2 complimentary water bottles in your room. The rooms are adequate as well. A little dark inside, but a working A/C, standing shower... the washroom is tiny but it is a cruise cabin. Queen bed was quite large actually. The activities that we chose to partcipate in were great. On the first day we visited the cave and did kayaking in the bay. It was an amazing realization that we were kayaking in Halong bay... the cave was a little busy as other boats were stopping off there as well. There was squid fishing at night and Tai Chi in the morning which we skipped to get some ZZs. The next day we went to a traditional fishing village which I thought was was really cool. It was so beautiful and serene, and we were being rowed in a wooden boat by 1 person. Amazing arm strength! Staff on the boat were really friendly. Mr.Bean, Harry, and the other server staff were really good. English was good and we could communicate well. The schedule is pretty packed. They announce where you have to be over the PA, and you pretty much have no time to dilly dally. The moment they announce, you need to show up. Overall - I would recommend Paloma. We had a good experience.

Excellent Ha Long Bay trip. We did the 2 night/3 day tour and had a fantastic time. The boat may not be the newest boat on the bay but it is comfortable, clean and well managed. The staff (like everywhere in Vietnam) are friendly, courteous, and ready to attend to your every need. They are well trained in hospitality and really know how to make you feel comfortable amongst other guests.The cruise is great value and was everything I expected it to be. The Paloma cruise visits the quieter northern areas of the bay so we didn't feel overwhelmed by masses of other tour boats. I would really recommend doing the 3 day tour as the second day allows you time to relax with a spot of kayaking, swimming and generally relaxing enjoying the sights and a few cold drink.

Luxury cruise with good staff. This is a luxury cruise with hospitable staff. The rooms and bathrooms are very clean.We had requested vegetarian food and they specially prepared for us... was very tastyActivities on the cruise were fantastic... kayaking and floating village ride

Far surpassed my wildest expectations.. The staff at Paloma Cruise far surpassed my wildest expectations. From the moment we got on the van from Hanoi, we were greeted with kindness. And not the kindness we, as Americans, expect. The type of genuine kindness you can only find in the Vietnamese people.The rooms were the perfect size for our three day/ two night cruise. Bathrooms were clean and equipped with the best shower head we've had since landing in this country.The food was absolutely unreal. The freshest fish, prawns and squid you'll ever have.Having never been on a cruise, I didn't quite know what to expect in terms of meals. Paloma Cruise would die before they let you go hungry. The quality of the meals is worth an entire essay on it's own, but I'll leave you with just one word: INCREDIBLE.I'd highly recommend doing two nights on this cruise, as one is simply not enough.Mr. Bean, the guide for our second day, was one of the most exceptionally positive and kind person I've ever had the privilege of meeting. We shared stories. He practiced his English by conversing with us for hours- teaching us about the Vietnamese culture.Without Mr. Bean (and Harry) the trip wouldn't have been the same.Harry, the cruise manager, was hilarious. Funny, light hearted and passionate about ensuring we as guests were taken care of.These people- this boat- it's hard to condense for a review on this site.You have to go. You have to experience it.5 out of 5 stars!

A wonderful time.. I've had one night on Paloma cruise and wasn't disappointed . The staff was very friendly with good sense of humour. Special thanks to a master chef for his outstanding quality of food. All in all it was a nice experience . Thanks very much to all staff.

Extremely positive experience. Paloma's customer experience was amazing. Ms Putri in booking went above and beyond to accommodate our tight schedule and help us get a last minute visa. Every aspect of the 2 day cruise was very well organized and very enjoyable. The staff truly loved their job and took pleasure in providing an A+ cruise experience. The food was plentiful and delicious. My wife and I highly recommend Paloma!

An unforgettable experience. We visited the paloma family for a 2 night 3 day tour and it was honestly the best tour i have ever been on. From the get go the experience was fantastic. "Harry" and "Mr Bean" (or both named haung) the two tour managers on the cruise are so warm, caring, funny and a delight to be around. They genuinely care about your experience that you have and nothing is a problem.Food is great and you are served more then you could possibly eat. We stayed in a suite room which is a little bit bigger, clean, comfortable and air con provided.The activities included are fantastic, kayaking through halong bay aroind the beautiful mountains to a private beach for lunch and swimming. And the day trip boat that you go aboard for the 2nd day is quite comfortable.To make the best out of this experience with Paloma, be willing to try everything, even though the kayaking is hard its enjoyable. Be happy and willing to mingle. We have met some great people on this trip.Thank you to the paloma family for a unforgettable experience, but mostly to harry and mr bean for making us feel lile "princesses" lol. You guys are awesome and really know whay genuine service is.

Great experience with Paloma Cruise. I did the two day, one night cruise of Halong Bay with Paloma Cruises and had a wonderful time. It is a lot to pack in to less than forty eight hours so it might make sense to stay for three days and two nights but I don't feel like I really missed anything. I had never been on a cruise before so I don't have anything to compare this to, but I found the staff to be very communicative, organized, and fun. The views from the ship are cruise and we also went to one of the islands and explored a cave. There was also kayaking available, a trip to a fishing village, and a cooking class. The food was tasty and plentiful. They went out of their way to accommodate people's dietary preferences. A great experience!

Wonderful cruise in Halong Bay.. Wonderful cruise in Halong Bay. Very beautiful place. Peaceful and quiet. Great place to forget about work, phone, city noise. Very nice room, great service and wonderful food...A LOT OF DELICIOUS FOOD. All the staff was great specially Justin our day trip guide and also the very funny Mr. Bean whom they made the trip a lot of fun. The places are great. Thank you Paloma Cruise for a great trip!
Paloma cruise. Excellent cruise Food was amazing, only criticism was that there was not enough seafood on the menu. Staff very friendly and helpful . A fun time all the way.
Great trip and the staff were excellent. We had a fantastic stay with Paloma cruise. Mr Bean was a great guide and I would definitely recommend the over night trip to Halong bay.
Excellent. Enjoyable trip overlooking magnificent Halong Bay. The accomodation, food and service is good. Nothing to complain at all

Stop Searching! This is it!. Our Paloma 2 night cruise of Halong Bay was the highlight of our trip! My two sisters & I enjoyed a stateroom that accommodated three people. A rare find. Our Excursion Guide Mr. Cao was knowledgeable, attentive, enthusiastic and fun! Mr. Bien the Cruise Director was professional, thorough and sincere with his immpeccable customer service skills. The food, accommodations, service and attention to detail made this an experience we'll never forget!

2 Night trip. Very enjoyable experience, staff tried their best to make it a great trip for everyone. We were happy that we had booked the 2 night trip as it would have felt rushed otherwise, with a full schedule. Time keeping is excellent, btw, if the schedule says 7:30 it means 7:30!

Great cruise with outstanding service. After researching quite a few cruises on Ha Long Bay we chose Paloma going by other reviews and we were not sorry. We were picked up by a van that provided free wi fi.Driven to Ha Long Bay 3.5 hours away to board our cruise where we were met by Mr Bean and Mr Harry and all the other staff at paloma who were outstanding. All meals and drinks were excellent, 7 courses for lunch and dinner and you were so full. Activities were also very good giving you a chance to kayak or enjoying swimming visiting a fishing village cave and pearle farm while being paddled by the locals. We had a wonderful time. You cannot go wrong with choosing this company from initial enquiry to final booking every detail was prompt and taken care of. Thank you for also looking after us on our anniversary.

1 night halong bay. Young, energetic and friendly staff; 1 night trip was a very tight schedule - no time really to sit on deck and relax but if you want to see & do everything (caves, fishing village (note that noone actually lives here now - the govt have rehoused them all on land for "environmental reasons") and kayaking, and are short on time this does the job. Good food and lovely room.
Great service. Cabins really clean,amazing food,helpful and friendly crew do of this cruise one unforgettable journey!!

AWESOME!. We had the greatest time on the cruise...starting from the perfect food which comes in several courses, to the nicest staff and the greatest tour guide through Ha Long Bay. One of the best experiences in my life to kayak through the peaceful Ha Long Bay. Rooms are clean and nice, big shower and warm water. Very nice cruiseship und very very organized. One of us was late for the pick up and they even managed to get a taxi meeting the pick up van on the way...If you go to Ha Long Bay this should be your first choice!!!

Beautiful bay, not a fan of the tight schedule. Halong Bay is a beautiful place and definitely a must see. We opted for a 2 day, 1 night cruise with Paloma.
