Our cruise was quite delayed and the first day felt incredibly rushed. We were very much looking forward to the kayaking portion which was cut to about 15-20 minutes total. The food was good but the 5 course meals took up a lot of time that I would have liked to have spent elsewhere. I also with my significant other on a romantic trip but we were seated with other people during meals... we would have preferred our own table or to sit outside of the dining room on the deck and enjoy each other's company. The evening party was nice on the deck as the sun was setting and the cabins are comfortable. My final grievance was that everyone else on the boat seemed to have received a Paloma Cruise gift bag with a scarf except my boyfriend and I. I asked the cruise director about it and he didn't really seem to understand what I was saying and never got an answer.Overall, Halong Bay is quite the site to be seen, but I don't think the cruise was the best fit for our travel style.

Private day cruise to Halong bay. I was very excited about this day and sadly was somewhat disappointed. We signed up for the day tour which was to include 6 hours at Halong bay. In actuality it was 4.5 hours at Halong bay as the driver/ guide stopped at a tourist / souvenir shop for 30 minutes on the way to and from Hanoi. We also stopped for an additional 30 minutes at a pearl factory. We were told we needed to stop "for the driver to eat". I find this very frustrating as he had all day to eat and certainly could have made the 3 hour trip without stopping for a meal as we did. It was clearly a stop built into the trip as all tour busses passing by stopped. I feel that this is a dishonest practice. Had I wanted to shop I would have signed up for a shopping tour and not any rather expensive 6 hour tour that was not fulfilled to my expectations. Also, although not at all the fault of this tour company, the bay was beautiful but had a large amount of trash floating around. On the positive side, our guide was wonderful. Quite fun and spoke great English. Would not recommend this tour.

In a word - Wonderful. Pick up in Hanoi was very efficient, we headed off for a comfortable yet long (4 Hours) drive to Halong Bay. We were met at the Bay by cheery staff and taken to the boat, given a quick briefing and shown our cabins. They were comfortable and clean.From there on it was very well organised, with hardly a dull moment, the bay is magnificent, the food onboard was excellent, the staff were always on hand and willing to please. We did a three day two night cruise, it was agreed that those who did only the 2 day one night cruise missed the best experience which comes on the second day of the three days. The 2 day 1 night people only did our first and last day. For the second day we cruised off and kayaked most of the day to places that only a kayak could reach. The scenery was a cross between Jurassic Park and King Kong. Fantastic. A special mention should go to Justin our guide. He was excellent, so polite and ready to assist at all times. It was truly a memorable experience.

Great staff. My wife and I went on the 2d/1n cruise (24 hours really) and whilst the trip was fairly full itinerary-wise like others have mentioned this meant there was always something to do in our short time on the boat. Ha Long Bay is well and truly on the beaten track as the thousands of other tourists and dozens of boats will attest to, so really the difference in experience will likely come down to the boat, staff and food.The boat, while not as luxurious as the web site lets on, was very comfortable and the cabins were of a good standard. The staff did everything they could to make the trip enjoyable and memorable. Mr. Bean is an absolute character from the very first minute you arrive at the office to the moment you leave, cracking cheesy jokes and having fun. The food was of a high standard and you will not go hungry. Plenty of courses, and the drinks were of a reasonable price.

2 night 3 days. Firstly; the food is amazing. Plenty of it and to a great standard. We did the 2 night tour which I would highly recommend. That extra day really is needed to enjoy Halong Bay at a relaxed pace. We had Justin bring us out kayaking around caves. Justin is definitely my favourite staff member- he is down to earth and genuine, really friendly and a great entertaining guide. The tours are full of activities like cooking demonstration, tai chi and kayaking. We had a room on floor1 - they are quite small but you don't spend enough time there for it to be a problem.

Paloma Cruise to HaLong Bay - A must see!!! Love it!. Ha Long Bay is a beautiful bay, this is a must see when in VN. The staff of the Paloma Cruise is the best. They are friendly and polite to all guesses. in our group, I got a surprise birthday party by the staff and gifts that none of the family members were planning for it. The tours around the bay such as the caves, beach, and the pearls farm are a plus for your cruise. Highly recommend will comeback again.

Beautiful Bay - a must to see. Beautiful Bay - a must to see The staff of Palama Cruise were lovely especially Mr. Bean. Although same jokes repeated the following night to people that joibed the cruise was a bit corny. Food was good and accommodation was ok.
Great ! . Lovely staff, beautiful boat and pretty good activities ! Food is good too. Only "bad point" would be : not enough bottle of water for free- which is no big deal .

Fun and activity packed . Me and my mother came on this cruise to see Halong Bay, from beginning to end you're treated with complete friendliness and kindness and the staff truly want to get to know you and make sure you really enjoy yourself. They stuff you with food! They provide so much food and if you have any food requirements they cater around you. Kayaking around Halong Bay was magnificent and to be able to do so with a guide who knows all the hotspots was priceless. The cocktails are very nice too! Mr. Bean was our host and he was so funny so full of life and had great English. We also had a host called Justin who was very dedicated to his guests enjoying themselves. Not only did we enjoy the cruise we made friends with the loveliest group of people whom we will never forget. Fab trip would love to do it all over again

Fantastic cruise. We traveled as a family of four with 8 year old twin boys.I cannot say enough how fantastic this trip was. We did two night cruise. We had a suite with all in one room and had our own little deck out front which gave us a little more room. The facilities were clean and lovely. Food was great and sooooo much! The staff were amazing, very attentive and nothing too much trouble. Thank you to all the staff and Mr Bean was brilliant along with Mr Justin and the rest of staff!
excellent. Super tour. Comfortable rooms. excellent food, very good staff, real money, clean, good excursions, not very big,

Great way to see Halong Bay . We enjoyed a great 2 day 1 night cruise on Paloma. The staff were friendly & made us very welcome, Mr Bean was the cruise director & managed to remember everyone's name & he was good at giving local information. All the staff work very hard to make it a comfortable trip. The rooms were nice, clean & comfortable & had everything you needed. The food on board was delicious and it was no trouble them providing Veggie options just make sure you tell them when you book. We visited a cave & beach & went kayaking which was a great way to see the bay. We also saw a floating village. All in all a good trip, with a nice number of guests on board and a cruise which visits the quieter areas of Halong bay. Very well organised & easy transfers too. Would recommend for friends, family's & couples has everything you need. Just be prepared for an itinerary & times you need to stick to! Which I guess is to be expected on a short trip.

5 stars tour to Ha Long Bay- extremely recommended!!. We really enjoyed Paloma tour to Ha Long Bay! The crew is amazing, always being super helpful and making sure that everyone was having a great time. The food is superb, extremely above our expectations and they kept on surprising us with the amazing wide offer of typical Vietnamese dishes. If you are a foodie, we recommend you to take this cruise with no doubt! The rooms are nicely decorated and all of them have a window, so you can wake up contemplating paradise from your window!

Good way to see Halong Bay. The staff on our Paloma cruise were very hard working and genuine and keen to make sure we enjoyed our time. The cabins were adequate. Quite small but adequately furnished and nothing was missing. The food was quite nice and plentiful. Unfortunately on our return to the cruise boat our tender ran into the boat very hard and all the passengers were thrown of the unattached bench seats and trapped by the seats and other passengers. There were a lot of minor injuries and severe bruising which the crew glossed over and did not seem to be concerned about at all which was very disapointing. Would I recommend Paloma? Yes. We got what we paid for.

A great way to see Ha Long Bay. Our hotel (Hanoi La Selva) booked this cruise and it was perfect. We had limited time in Vietnam and really wanted to squeeze in a visit to Ha Long Bay. The Paloma Cruise 1 night, 2 day cruise was a really great way to experience this incredible place. Bear in mind, this is a cruise and they have activities, so if that's not your thing you can skip or you might want to consider another way to see the area, but I didn't mind. They also feed you. A LOT. Vegetarian meals are an option, you just need to let them know when booking (and they check several times to confirm). The veggie meals were very tasty, too. Drinks are extra, but they have a little happy hour special and, honestly, I come from a place where cocktails are at least $10 a piece. This was much less. When we went the weather was a little cooler and foggy, it was still so beautiful, but I would bet it's like paradise when you catch a sunset on the water. My only slight qualm is that I would've loved to have seen more wildlife, but it's cruise and we had one night, so I realize not everything is possible. One more thing, the staff were incredible. Our tour guide (Harry is his western name) was HILARIOUS and so attentive to everyone on the ship. Just the nicest guy ever and really professional and just super fun to be around. All in all a terrific experience. (Quick note: rooms are comfortable and stylish and the rainfall shower was great!)

Fantastic 3 days. Everything about this cruise was amazing.The staff were so friendly, attentive and entertaining. They really got to know you individually and made the trip very personal. Would highly recommend the 3 day/2 night option as it's less rushed and the kayaking (with Justin) on the 2nd day was our highlight. He showed us lots of hidden caves and much quieter and relaxing areas of the bay that we had all to ourselves (except for the sighting of rare monkeys jumping around in the trees right above us!). We weren't expecting the 2nd day kayaking to be as good (we thought it would just be a quick paddle around one Island, but was so much better than that).The food on board was amazing and plentiful, with drinks not being overpriced.We were there at the same time as a family who were returning for their 3rd trip and we can see why!Would definitely recommend Paloma cruises, Harry, Mr. Bean and Justin made it a very memorable trip.

Great trip, well organised. We took a 2 night cruise, well organised, friendly staff, and well catered. Particularly enjoyed the kayak excursion, great way to get a close uperspective. Special mention for Justin, a real advocate for Paloma Cruises

Loved our stay on Paloma!. We stayed on Paloma on the 3 day / 2 night tour and I would definitely recommend it. The staff are super friendly and helpful from the moment you board the boat. Nothing is ever too much of a problem for them and they all take the time to get to know you and are on first name terms with everybody straight away. The food on the boat is amazing. The portions are huge and you are served 6 course dinners and lunches! Although Paloma are on the expensive side for Halong Bay you definitely get what you pay for and the food was incredible!Although the weather was slightly chilly during our stay we still enjoyed the activities like kayaking and hiking. We saw some amazing caves on the 2nd day so it is definitely worth doing the 2 night cruise as you would miss out on these breathtaking caves otherwise.The cabins are clean and tidy. They also have heating which was very welcome after being out in the cold all day!After spending hours reading reviews of cruises for Halong Bay I am certain that Paloma are definitely the cruise to choose!!
Every thing was good.... The crew was so kind. Program was good. Most of all the food and the cocktail was fantastic. Only the cabin was little oldish and poor.

Brilliant!. Had a really great time on this cruise. We have 2 sons, 3 and 6 years old, and we were completely welcomed. Food was great for them; evening cocktails were great for us! Would travel with this cruise again!

Never a dull moment. If you're expecting a relaxing lazy cruise, think again. It took me about a week to recover! Hiking through caves, going to the beach, kayaking, jumping off boats, cooking classes, squid fishing, sunset parties, visiting fishing villages, and eating eating eating. The first day was especially jam packed, we were given about 10 minutes to get ourselves sorted out between activities. I definitely recommend doing the three night, two day option if you can as the second day is a little more relaxing and gives you a real chance to see Ha Long Bay. It also means getting to spend more time with Mr Bean, an absolute star! Huang (or Harry) was also lovely, he was really good with kids on the boat. I enjoyed his jokes: especially the one about breakfast being served at 6:45am. Although that wasn't a joke. :( The highlight for us was seeing the 65kg fish on the second day: seriously the thing is bigger than my boyfriend's parents' pet labrador. The food on the cruise was all really good, I think there was only one thing I didn't like and that was on the very last day. My only disappointment was getting up at 6am for thai chi only to be stood up by my wee pal Mr Bean!

Incredible food, amazing service, high quality!. When I first read the review that someone thought they might die on the shuttle bus I was a little hesitant to book. I'm so glad I decided to take a chance and go forward with the booking. The shuttle ride there was uneventful, the return was a little more discerning but I had complete faith that our driver would get us there in one piece. Halong Bay is definitely a must see when visiting Vietnam. If you go, go with Paloma. Here's why: 1) THE FOOD2) the service 3) the itinerary4) did I mention the food?I was completely blown away by the food and I have been on various high end cruises. The chef here has them all beat hands down. If he opened a restaurant, I would eat there every night. WOW!! Every meal was incredible. The food alone is reason enough to go. Next, the service is amazing. You are picked up in the shuttle (with free wifi) on time. They pick up in the old quarter but they only pick up from a few different hotels per shuttle bus so it didn't take long at all. That was wonderful. Mr. Bean made the trip so fun and enjoyable. All the staff has such a wonderful and caring attitude, but Mr. Bean takes the extra step to make you feel like family. He even made us very special origami. The rooms were AWESOME! They deliver your luggage to your room just like a high end cruise. They made us feel like royalty. The rain shower was awesome and the bed was very comfortable. I did not find the bay overcrowded, I found it quite peaceful considering it is such a huge tourist destination. We booked on booking.com and got a great rate. They have a full itinerary but I never felt rushed or like it was too much. It was actually quite perfect. I read complaints about the cost of booze, the beer was double what you pay on shore. So instead of $1 a beer you're paying $2. Loosen the purse strings, it's $2 a beer! Where else can you find that on a cruise??The only complaint I have is the stop you make with the shuttle half way through the four hour trip to Halong Bay. The prices there are expensive. We grabbed chips, nuts and a couple of cans of beer. It was $20. Lesson here? Buy your snacks before you go. Overall an excellent experience that I highly recommend!

Wonderful Trip to remember . We did a 2/1-day trip. Everything was well organized, from hotel pick-up, transfer and ship events. The crew was helpful and always friendly. Mr. Bean was especially entertaining and an artist with his paper figures. The food was always good and plentyful with seafood and other options. The ship was big and and in good shape. Halong Bay is a must see for everyone. We enjoyed our cruise very much.

Incredible experience! . Paloma luxury cruise was just fabulous. Experiencing the beauty of the Hà long Bay on the cruise with great service, delicious food, Tai Chi and cooking classes, breathtaking views and modern world class cabins is a perfect romantic / family getaway. My parents have been around the world and cruised in Alaska, the Caribbean and South East Asia, but they found this one the most unique one so far which says something! Also, if you are a family, it's worth spending the extra bucks to go for the corner family room with the balcony with private sun chairs, worth every penny

cabin was terrible. .. They are very kind and the program was so good. But the cabin was so cold so we couldn't sleep. I wear too may shirts and jarkets in a bed. Terrible.. almost nightmare. Other thing were good.
Amazing!. Great staff and service, great itinerary and fantastic food. Such a lovely place to visit, lots to see and beautiful scenery. Thoroughly enjoyed.

Amazing! . We did the 3D/2N cruise with Paloma cruises in January 2016. Can honestly say it was one of the best experiences we've done! The weather in Halong Bay wasn't great, it rained most of the time we were there but this didn't stop us. The crew made sure we had just as good a time as if it had been brilliant sunshine. All the activities were tailored for us and the weather with things such as a spring roll cooking class, and a 'rainset' party as there was no sun! Lucky for us the rain stopped just as we went out kayaking and this was one of the highlights. Seeing the more secluded parts of Halong Bay through amazing caves and we even saw a family of monkeys on the way back. We definitely didn't go hungry on the cruise either. Every meal was incredible and there was so much food! Our room was great, and even when we found a small leak because of all the rain we got moved to a different room, an upgrade in fact to a suite! A special shout out needs to go to Mr Bean as well. All the crew on Paloma cruises were amazing but without Mr Bean we wouldn't have had nearly such an incredible time! He was always laughing and joking with us and the other passengers, doing everything he could to make sure we had the best time possible on the cruise. He was the highlight of our trip! Thank you to everyone on Paloma Cruises for a great cruise!

Paloma cruise to Halong Bay. Picked up from hotel in Hanoi and 4 hour trip to join boat in Halong Bay. Minibus very comfortable with good driver. 2 days on boat. Staff were excellent, food was exceptional. Good activities - leant to make spring rolls; trip to cave; trip to floating village and pearl farm. Cabin very warm and comfortable. Would recommend this company

Fantastic! . Was a fantastic experience , booked 1 night two days and this is the length of time I would recommend , as you are constantly either being fed great food ( yum) or doing some of the awesome activities like visiting the floating village or amazing cave. I wouldn't recommend any longer though as there are many other beautiful places to see in Vietnam. The staff we're all incredibly enthusiastic , and the English guides spoke some of the best I had heard in Vietnam , you are in for a treat if you get Harry as a guide he is funny and just a great host , you can't go wrong with this cruise! oh also the pick up from Hanoi was on time and as expected and as we weren't returning to Hanoi they called us a taxi from their office in Halong , just all round great

Wonderful Halong Bay Cruise with Paloma Cruise. We did the 2 day 1 night Halong Bay cruise with Paloma Cruise. We wanted a higher end experience so decided to try Paloma - and we were not disapointed! They picked us up from our Hanoi hotel to drive us out to Halong Bay to get on the boat. Our only complaint of the entire experience was the shuttle van - it is a small van and was very cramped and uncomfortable for the long ride. They said they had recently switched from using larger buses to make it easier for driving in Hanoi. You always take a tender out to the boat, which was quick and easy. Our luggage was transferred to our room as we enjoyed a welcome drink on board. The boat is very nice, clean, and comfortable. We booked one of the Paloma Suites which was well worth it. We had a large comfortable bed, wine/water/fruit platter, safe, clean bathroom, and separate sun room with comfortable couch and windows all around which was lovely to lounge in as we cruised. The first day we were served a delicious lunch (menu: Halong seafood soup, Kohlrabies salad with vermicelli noodles, steamed basa fish with fragrance leaf, sauteed pork rib, chicken skewer with peanut sauce, stirfried seasonal vegetables, steamed fragrant rice, caramel cream, and tea/coffee). Next we tendered to a floating village, where we got a paddle boat ride through the village and islands. The daytrip finished with a visit to a pearl store. We didn't purchase anything there, but it was interesting to see the pearl retrieval process. In the evening, we had cocktails on the top deck, followed by a spring roll making class (they turned out delicious!), then dinner (menu: beef and corn soup, banana blossom and chicken salad, king prawns on hot rock, wrapped Halong fish with spicy sauce, fried squid with garlic butter, sauteed mixed vegetables with chili bean, steamed fragrant rice, hot banana with vanilla ice cream, and tea/coffee) which was absolutely delicious! After dinner we tried out squid jigging which was really fun! You go out on the tender boat (attached to the Paloma ship) and jig for squid using lights and a fishing rod. The next morning we went to Hang Sung Sot (amazing cave) which was just that - amazing! It was a bit of a warm walk up into the entrance of the cave, but once you are in it is huge, cool temperature and just amazing to explore. Our trip finished off with lunch (I didn't get the menu, but part of it included stuffed pork, pudding, and coffee/tea). Finally, we were transferred from the boat back to the dock and shuttled back into Hanoi. We were leaving Hanoi right from our cruise, so rather than being brought into the city and having to take a taxi back to the airport, they stopped along the highway (literally) and hailed us a taxi to take us to the airport. This was a wonderful cruise on a well equipped boat, amazingly friendly and helpful staff who make the trip really enjoyable and they really tried to get to know us which was nice, and we got to see beautiful Halong Bay! We highly recommend Paloma Cruise!

Fabulous cruise. All the cruises seemed the same when researching online, but we had a friend who recommend this cruise so we went with this one. Did not regret it one bit.Had a lovely experience with the family of 5 on the two day and one night cruise. Staff were experienced, helpful and professional. Bean was our tour guide for the activities and he was very funny and entertaining. He certainly went above and beyond our expectations. Hoang was a fantastic manager and even upgraded one of our rooms upon arrival. We were stocked! Meals were absolutely divine and we certainly thank everyone there for making us feel so welcome.I was also impressed with their safety regulations. They made sure we always had life jackets when necessary. I noticed some other groups on other cruises did not have life jackets when we crossed paths. So this is a credit to Paloma cruise for ensuring our safety. Furthermore our cabins also had life jackets and torches to access in case of an emergency as well.We came during the cold raining season and Halong Bay was still mystical and magnificent. Although it was too cold to go swimming or kayaking it was still lovely to just take in the atmosphere. We will certainly be back during the warmer season so that we can take full advantage of the bay and will probably indulge in a 2 night 3 day package.Highly recommended.

Organized, Nice People who care about You !. The staff really care that everything is perfect for you. Mr Bean the director has a good sense of humor and is great at his job.  Loved whole thing ! One night was perfect length for us, food was good. The Paloma suite had incredible 180 degree view with like 8 windows wrapped around the corner off the boat. Many curtains in perfectly placed positions, I recommend the small upgrade.The ocean is not that cold even in January, I went swimming to peoples horror. Everybody thinks it freezing cold. Really it was refreshing and could swim around for 10 to 15 minutes. but I waited to long:)(Comfortable vehicle on drive, happy people, who love there work and are good at it:)We also did the motorbike tour and got another discount and that was a whole adventure of a lifetime on it's own. The drivers were very skilled and took care of us, even in the rain storm, hehe

Simply Stunning location and service.. We have just returned from a three day two night Paloma Cruise thru the beautiful Halong bay and were simply blown away by the spectacular scenery and raw beauty of this region. Paloma cruises were recommended to us and we can not fault their authentic service and level of enthusiasm. Our tour guides and crew, particularly Bean, Justin and our cruise coordinator Harry truly made the cruise an experience we thoroughly enjoyed. Excellent value for money and a highly recommended experience onboard a traditional vessel viewing one of the truly beautiful natural wonders of the world.

One Night Cruise - Perfect.. My husband and I did a one night cruise with Paloma over the holidays and I would definitely recommend the company. When I was researching companies, they all seemed the same and I was quite confused. So I took the recommendation of Paloma from a friend and we're glad we did. I guess Paloma is considered a "mid-range" cruise - but it seemed quite nice to us. The staff was amazing - over-the-top accommodating, very entertaining and just tons of fun. We had some delicious meals, kayaked on the bay and met really great people. It felt easy to meet people - in fact, we had the benefit of meeting a geologist at lunch the first day who told us all about the bay and archipelagos, that was great! And while the schedule was quite packed, it still felt really relaxing. Oh - and don't worry about seasickness. I was super worried as I get nauseous on the slightest movement. I was completely fine, the bay is very calm. Thanks, Paloma!*Tip: We actually splurged and took a private car (they offer it) from Hanoi to Halong Bay and for multiple people (we had two), it was very much worth it.

Amazing halong bay with paloma cruise. Halong bay with its approx 2000 limestone islands is really something out of this world and getting to spen 2 nights and 3 days on an amazing cruise boat is really awesome.we went with paloma cruise , fully inclusive. Staff were so friendly . Meals were amazing vietnamese , gourmet at its best. We went in a boat to the fishing villages, kayaking in the bay , swimming in the bay on a day boat and visiting a massive cave in the bay. Really not something you want to miss.

Fun and relaxing . Fun and relaxing way to spend day or two on a boat while visiting Ha Long Bay. Activities include, visiting fishing village, "amazing cave", spring roll making. Harry the cruse director was funny, witty but little hard to understand. We had a room with Windows and bathroom with shower. Little over cast with little drizzle but had wonderful time.

Great Trip to Halong Bay. The staff onboard were all very welcoming and made the trip fun and entertaining. We were on the 2 day 1 night trip which was very well planned and executed with lots to do and see without feeling rushed. Great way to see Halong Bay!

Exceeds expectations, memorable experience, three days of fun in Halong Bay. My family and I enjoyed cruising with Paloma Cruise (3D2N) on our trip to Halong Bay. We chose Paloma Cruise for its excellent reviews, and our experience on the cruise was the highlight of our stint at Halong Bay. The transfer from our hotel to Ha Long City was very punctual, and the drive from Hanoi to Halong Bay (about 4 hours) was smooth. Free wifi was available on the minibus ride, which was a major plus point. The minibus was very comfortable, with only 2 couples and our family in it - that's a total of 8 pax. Mineral water was given out. We stopped for half an hour at a huge store for toilet break + for us to get some snacks at the halfway point of our trip. Upon arriving at Ha Long Bay, the crew and Paloma staff took good care of us, and transferred our luggage to the cruise promptly. We were also ushered to the day trip to board the large cruise quickly. Crew was very polite and entertained us whilst waiting. Our family booked a Family Executive Suite. Room was rather spacious, even with an added extra bed. The balcony was a plus point - it was very wide and large, and gave us a private space to soak in the atmosphere of Halong Bay, Bai Tu Long Bay and Lan Ha Bay and the karst landscapes. We had a great time lying down on the beach chairs and admiring the sunset. I am an outdoors enthusiast, and enjoyed the array of activities at Paloma Cruise. On Day 1, shortly after we boarded the cruise and had lunch, we could choose as to whether we wanted to kayak around Bai Tu Long Bay, or take a bamboo boat to Vung Vieng Fishing Village. Everyone on my cruise chose the former. But if you're not too keen/unable to kayak, the bamboo boat to view the fishing village is recommended. Crew will make arrangements for both options. For the evening, there was a sunset party and a cooking demonstration. Great time to hang out on the deck and admire the sunset. The cooking demonstration was interesting - the crew taught us how to make Vietnamese spring rolls, which looks much harder than expected. Dinner time came shortly after, and you have the option of participating in squid fishing or chill in your room and/or in the cruise after that. On the whole, Day 1 was rather relaxed. Day 2 was more engaging for us. We took a day trip out to Lan Ha Bay and kayaked into the interior of some caves, which was beautiful. Would recommend all cruisers to kayak - these caves are only accessible via kayak, as the day trip is too big to enter these caves. Our friendly and experienced tour guide, Tom, took us to view beautiful caves, and he ensured everyone's safety. We had a BBQ lunch on a beach, following which we kayaked to Toi and Sang Cave and went exploring on foot into these two caves. We were the only ones there, so that was a plus point - you don't have to fight with other tourists to view these caves. And you get nice pictures! Haha! Evening activities for Day 2 were similar to those of Day 1, so it's your choice as to whether you want to join in or not. For me, I chose to relax on the deck to view the evening and night sky, which was an enjoyable and relaxing option. For Day 3, we took a day trip out to Sung Sot cave. Was very impressed by the cave, with its extensive limestone formations, stalagmites and stalactites. Choice of location (Sung Sot cave) was good, but the downside was that there were too many tourists and it was rather crowded. Following the visit, we headed back to the main cruise, packed, had our last lunch and bade farewell to the cruise and crew. If the array of activities on Paloma was great, the food served was excellent! Would say that the food was the highlight of the trip. We were served about 6-7 courses for lunch and dinner, with dishes like pumpkin soup (appetizer), wine prawns, grilled seabass, roasted chicken and desserts like apple crumble with ice cream. Seafood served was very fresh, and we were fed like kings. Wide variety of choices for breakfast too, though I would have preferred it if they served more Vietnamese food than the typical American breakfast options. Some Vietnamese spring rolls, xoi or egg coffee will be good. Enjoyed the BBQ lunch that was prepared on the beach on Day 2. That was something special, though it was rather chilly as the winds blew rather strongly at times.On crew performance and service - the crew on Paloma Cruise were friendly, efficient and rendered good customer service. Special shout to Harry, the cruise manager, for his management, coordination, advice and ability to engage cruisers. Tom, our tour guide, was also very friendly, experienced and funny, with his jokes about aspiring to be Tom Collins and Tom Cruise! The waiters and waitresses, bartenders and the rest of the crew, many of whom I did not know by name, were excellent as well. Everyone was happy to help and assist. On the whole, my family and I truly enjoyed our experience on Paloma Cruise, and we strongly recommend it to tourists visiting Halong Bay. It's value for money, and everything surpassed our expectations. Would recommend a 3D2N option to soak in the atmosphere at Halong Bay and Paloma Cruise. Thank you Paloma for the wonderful and memorable experience - you did great, and were the highlight of our short trip to Hanoi!
a wonderful experience. The staff of Paloma Cruise were delightful, friendly and helpful. The food was delicious and plentiful,shore excursions great ,all round a lovely two days
Paloma - Back in June 2016. Great escape to an unknown world. The history with regard to the caves was very interesting both the recent and the very long ago history, when dragons ruled the earth.

Great visit to Ha Long Bay (2 days, 1 night). We had a great time cruising with Paloma to Ha Long Bay. Tour started with a pick up from our hotel in a private van with only two other couples. The long drive ahead (3.5 hours) was broken up with a stop at a very touristy, expensive gift shop. Once we arrived in Ha Long, we were transferred to our boat. The two days were very organized with lots of things to do. We were greeted on board with a 7 course, delicious lunch. We then chose to take the boat ride through the fishing village which was beautiful and relaxing (but we heard the kayaking was an amazing experience too). We were then given the opportunity to swim for a bit. Even though it is December (winter) the water was very warm. After, happy hour on the boat with dancing, music, card games and cooking class before dinner (another 7 course meal). Last of the night was squid fishing off the back of the boat before a few more drinks and bed. In the morning after a buffet breakfast, we went to The Amazing Cave for a tour, followed by brunch and the start of our return trip. Food was delicious and there was a LOT of it. Staff were extremely friendly, knowledgeable (even giving recos for things to do back in Hanoi) and fun. Room was great and clean, especially for a one night tour. We definitely recommend this tour and the boat to others. (Especially after hearing from others who chose a different cruise and had very poor experiences)

quality time - 2 days. Overnight stay was amazing. Well organized. Good pick up from hotel , free wifi in the Van heading to Harbour. Great food, Nice services, Kayaking was real fun and surprise cave was the highlight.Cooking session and Tai Chi classes were really nice.Overall great crew, friendly guide &staff and certainly one of the best luxury cruises at an affordable rate. Certainly recommend this one!!!

2 days of fun. Did not know what to expect and was totally surprised at how awesome this cruise was. From the booking staff to the driver who picked us up and dropped us off in a comfortable air conditioned SUV we thank you for making our trip so enjoyable and memorable. Halong Bay is so peaceful and beautiful. word cannot describe it. Our boat was fantastic. We had a family room which was right up front and had deck for relaxing on and taking in the views. The rooms were adequate and what you would expect on a boat. Comfortable beds and a large shower. The food was great and they catered for all needs. Whether a fussy eater or had allergies you were not forgotten. Nothing was to much trouble and you never went hungry. The staff on board where fantastic and look after your every need. Very friendly and helpful. We enjoyed an afternoon of Kayaking and swimming and in the morning got to explore a cave. The evening on the top deck saw a spring roll making competition which was a lot of fun as well as learning a new skill and we also got to meet and greet other passengers in a very happy and relax surrounding. Thank you Paloma.

Great 2 night visit to Halong Bay. Staying on the Paloma ship as a great way to enjoy the beauty of Halong Bay. The transfer from Hanoi was easy and comfortable. The boat is really nice. Nice wooden features, classic styling, clean. We stayed in a family suite which had a private balcony on the front of the boat and was a big enough room for 3 adults to share comfortably. The staff are friendly and helpful. Food is great. Each meal is several courses, and if you have any allergies or special requirements they will make a different option for you. The schedule of activities is quite busy, it felt like there was always something going on. Visit a floating village, try a cooking class, kayak, swim, eat eat eat! We were very glad to stay 3 days/2 nights because we were able to see more of Halong Bay and get away from all the other boats, as well as have time to relax. If you only stay one night you will miss the best parts of the trip! Our guides on the day boat Chan and Justin were lots of fun! The only negatives are the cost of drinks, and the packed schedule of activities (it was great to have so much included, but didn't leave much time for enjoying the private balcony!)

Great cruise. The transfer to/from Hanoi was really good. Even had WiFi on the minibus. Boat and crew were nice too. Our deluxe room on the bottom floor was very clean and cozy. We had windows directly to the water. No walkway outside our windows which was nice.Food was good to great. A lot of food so no one will leave hungry. Breakfast was one of the best we had in Vietnam. Clear instructions about the schedule from the crew. We did about the same as what I suppose all tours do. Floating village and Surprising Cave. It was nice to see. Ha Long Bay is a special place, unfortunately we had cloudy and misty weather, but it was cozy in its own way. If you want to visit Ha Long Bay you will probably have a nice time onboard the Paloma.

Magnificent trip!. Luxurious and enjoyable time aboard the Paloma Halong Bay boat. We stayed for the 2 day 1 night cruise and absolutely loved it.Transfers - the included transfers to and from the Old Quarter in Hanoi took were in a nice minibus with air con and a safe driver. It took about 4 hours each way but with a rest stop half way through at a western style shop with clean toilets :)Boat - cabins were beautiful and luxurious. Hot rainfall showers and free toiletries. Comfy beds and ocean view. Excursions - all included the price, we went for a canoe ride around the floating villages and to a pearl farm. You can also do squid fishing at night. The next morning you go to the "amazing caves" and they really are amazing! Food - each Meal was comprised of several courses, which was great as the food was delicious and the activities make you hungry! They are able to cater for those with dietary requirements which is great. At each meal, a waiter delivered the food to the table and stated 'gluten free for you' when handing me a separate dish, which was very reassuring. I had to check a couple of times when it wasn't mentioned and most of the time it was actually suitable. The only things to watch out for if you're allergic/very sensitive are (a) the part of the dinner where the spring rolls are made for you at your table - there is cross contamination going on there! And (b) the breakfast buffet with all allergens everywhere and shared utensils and tongs - but that's a universal problem with buffets anywhere in the world. I got "glutened" sick from just eating the sliced fruit so lesson learned for me. Apart from that the allergen awareness is great on board.Staff - the staff are so polite, courteous and friendly. Tom Cruise is so funny and entertaining!

Perfection. Our trip on Paloma cruise was perfect!!! Our stay was 10/10.The cruise with paloma was one of our favourite nights here. The accommodation was clean and enough room , the food was absolutely amazing and the itinerary kept us busy and very happy with the wonderful experience !I think out of everything what made it a perfect stay was definitely the staff .There liveliness and friendliness made us feel happy and very welcome.They were all just really beautiful people and will be in our memories forever! Thankyou you so much Harry , katy and to the rest of the team from the moment we booked the cruise to the moment we left the boat we have received nothing less than perfection !We will be definitely be referring this cruise to others and coming back in the future!

Halong Bay is beautiful. This was a great trip, the minivan that picked us up had wifi! The boat was lovely, room was small but nice and clean (even had a hairdryer). Food was delicious and extensive, gourmet fresh meals and even catered for me being a vegetarian. Lots of activities to keep us entertained- kayaking, tai chi, visiting sung sot caves. The only thing that would have made it better is after the sunset drinks if there was some more lively entertainment like dancing or karaoke, especially as I went with a friend.

Definitely stay for 2 nights. If we had stayed for just one night the experience would have been very rushed and disappointing. Day 2 was thoroughly enjoyable and an amazing experience. We kayaked around much quieter parts in the Cat Ba nature reserve. This felt like the only point on the cruise to just enjoy the location. Our guide Chan was very interesting and as there were no other guests was a private tour! Day 1 and 3 felt quite rushed with very little time to enjoy the views. You also go the busy parts of ha long bay so constantly see other ships and particularly at the caves on departure day, hundreds of people. The food was excessive but tasty enough. You certainly will never get hungry with 8 courses at lunch and dinner!

It's the most memorable vacation my fiancée and I have had.. Paloma Cruises offered such a wonderful and unique experience. While booking a reservation, the sales manager has been truly helpful. When it came to the trip, the staff has been very courteous. I can't say anything more about the freshest foods served because they are simply delicious. Also, the rooms have that antique charm yet with modern amenities. Everything is well kept. The guests along with us had a wonderful time. It showed that the staff have worked well to provide a service worth telling.
Great Cruise. It was a nice cruise, being able to spend time on the water, meet new people, and to have good food and drink options. It was enjoyable.

3 Day Cruise - Amazinf. This was a top trip to a great location, the Boat, staff and trips were fantastic. This was one of the higher price range trips, and we choose a room with a bit more space which turned out to be amazing. The activities were well organized and timed to perfection. The schedule once on board the board seems a bit crazy in the mornings but you get some down time in the afternoons and evenings. The company just wants you to see the best and get the most out of your trip.On our trip there were lots of couples and groups of mixed ages, and one family which were well looked after by the staff and everyone else on board.

Great team, activities & accomodation. Bear in mind I'm writing this on behalf of me, a Brit visiting Asia for the first time, and my other half and her family who are from Hanoi. We did the two day cruise and loved it. Accomodation - wonderful family room, balcony on the bow, comfy bed, clean, good bathroom. Very nice place to stay (although the reality of you're only in it for 7 hours!). Food - really good. I love Vietnamese food and my other half's family rated it too (and they are used to the finer things, as well as coming from a very traditional background with home made north Vietnamese food). The Boat - beautiful, what's not to like?The staff - soooo attentive, sharing and generous. They always gave us their time, advice, information and made sure we enjoyed our time with them. The activities - lunch on the cruise out, boat tour of the floating villages, visit a pearl farm (amazing!), and then a sun down part on the top deck (see photos). Finally, before dinner, a cookery competition on the top where we had such a laugh making spring rolls (which we then ate!). At night, cocktails in the warm evening air. We even grabbed a swim off the back of the boat. The next morning a lovely breakfast and then into some amazing caves. Incredible, before a gentle cruise back with brunch. All in all, a must if you are in the North of Vietnam, it's less than a couple of hours from Hanoi. Do it! Great value. Thank you Paloma!

An unforgettable experience. We would highly recommend Paloma Cruises. We have just returned from a 2day/one night Halong bay tour. When we booked the tour we were concerned, from the reviews, that the one-night tour may not be enough and that it may not be worth it. While it would have been nice to be on there an extra day and get further out into the bay, the two day tour was still absolutely fantastic and the scenery like nothing we've seen before. The boat was beautiful, the staff very professional and welcoming and the food was of a high standard. The activities were well-planned and very enjoyable. We thoroughly enjoyed Chan, our tour guide. He was extremely knowledgable and proud of Halong Bay - and really went the extra mile with passion and enthusiasm. The whole crew worked hard so that we could relax and enjoy the beauty of the bay and the cruise. Thanks also to Tom Collins (great barman!!) and to Anh (we're not sure if we have spelt that right - he was a fantastic host!)

3 Day - 2 night cruise is a good way to see Halong Bay. This is definitely on the higher end of the boats available to travel down Halong Bay. The staff was attentive and the 8 course meals were of top quality. The 3 day/2 night tour included pick up/drop off from our hotel in Hanoi as well as a trip to the pearl farm (either by boat or kayak) on day 1, a canoeing excursion and BBQ'd meal on day 2 and a trip to the surprise cave on day 3.Overall the trip was very low key and relaxing.The only negative points for us was the lack of free water (small bottles can be purchased), and the slightly militant scheduling (e.g. numerous wake up calls at 7am demanding to turn up for a 7-8am breakfast). However, for anyone who wants to experience Halong Bay in a more upmarket setting this boat is ideal.

3 Day - 2 night cruise is a great way to see Halong Bay in all it's glory. Just returned from an excellent two nights, three days trip on the Paloma Cruise.This is a 4* cruise and meets all expectations. (We seen some of the lower cost options during the trip and were glad we paid the extra, the old adage "you get what you pay for holds true".The memory of the trip apart from the stunning scenery of Halong Bay is the friendly warmth of all the staff throughout the trip and the never ending quantities of food......The journey for us started with an early departure from our hotel and you need to prepare yourself for an arduous almost three hour journey in a minibus. (after thirty minutes the hustle and bustle of early morning traffic wears off and you just want to sleep as the journey is quite monotonous). Our minibus had WiFi which was quite a surprise. !Food throughout is of good quality and plenty of it....The cabins are very functional and practical, do not expect five star, they do however meet all your needs. Free water is supplied in the cabin each day.Many people just came for the one night and regretted it....... two nights is to be recommended, to relax and really see Halong Bay.The second days trip to a remote bay to go canoeing, (we were lucky enough to see the monkeys), canoeing through caves, swimming and to cap it all a private beach barbecue........ this day was the highlight of the trip. Our guide for the day was Tom "Cruise" who was first class and we cannot thank him enough for all his efforts to make the day special.The holiday really begins when you arrive at the departure harbour, the number of cruise ships is quite a surprise.... and the organised chaos adds to the trip.We had a family cabin as there were three of us, it was a forward cabin with it's own terrace which was very pleasant.The first day is quite hectic as your always on the move, with the first trip to a fisherman's floating village (they row you around the fishing village etc in bamboo boats, remember to take some money to leave a tip for the boatman that rows you). The into a pearl exhibition area which has a "huge" and unexpected shop with all types and budgets of pearls, take lots of cash or credit card if tempted to buy something.In summary a first class way to see Halong Bay and I would happily recommend the Paloma cruise for it's friendly staff. Special mention also to crew members Stella and Harry.

Paloma suite . Paid a little extra for the Paloma Suite and did the 3 day 2 night cruise. Awesome.the second day was fantastic with kayaking and swimming and a BBQ lunch on a beach. Hoping they will include some information on the environment in their programs in the future. Helpful staff and the food was plentiful, fresh and tasty. Was easy to say no to activities and relax in our room if we wanted more time to chill (would give the squid fishing a miss).

Great visit, great staff. We took the 2day/1night cruise through Halong Bay, and it was wonderful. The staff is very friendly, rooms are great, food is delicious, and activities will keep you from getting bored.

2Day/1N - Fabulous Service, Stunning Secluded Cruise. Whilst not the most luxurious or expensive cruise, it is so worth paying for a cruise of this level (4*) rather than opting for a more budget option. I was originally booked onto the V'Spirit Cruise due to our backpacking budget, thinking the surroundings would be enough but we saw the other boats, and I am so glad we payed just $20 more for this one! The difference is staggering! The condition of the boat, the service, the food, the side balconies and the top deck - everything makes the Paloma one of the best there is. People say that Halong Bay is busy and crowded. I know we were there at the beginning of High Season but what are they talking about? Go with Paloma, and they take you to the more remote parts, we kayaked through Vung Vieng Fishing Village and we had it to ourselves. We were around another boat for a while (Signature) but that was fine. Most of the time, we were alone in the beauty and it was perfect. (Apart from the cave on Day 2, that was quite busy)The facilities on board are fantastic, the food is incredible. It's 5* set menu restaurant stuff, just so different from every other meal we had on our backpacking trip! This was luxury, and a perfect way to end our travels in Vietnam. The activities are great and the staff handled us all with professionalism and superb attitude. I just kept thinking that if it was my job to deal with 20 tourists and keep them safe and following schedule, in the sea, I'd lose it. So the staff on Paloma have my utmost respect especially with people complaining that food had to be shared between a table, and they kept us to schedule with military precision. Who cares? I thought they did great.One minor criticism, we chose to go Kayaking and we had no idea where we were going or for how long. It was not made clear. We got lost from the group and were late back to the Pearl exhibition. I felt terrible for keeping people waiting and wished we'd have known a little more what we were meant to be doing. Obviously still a fantastic experience. Another thing - sort the wifi out! I want to post pictures to cause FB jealousy! Ha. Not crucially important but would've been nice to keep in touch.Thanks Paloma for a really great job. I don't envy you at all, but you remained professional, classy and in control. Oh and I won the cooking contest! So chuffed. I'd definitely 100% recommend this cruise to anyone looking to explore Halong Bay.

Fabulous Cruise. We went on our cruise to Halong Bay with Paloma Cruise .The cruise was an exceptional experience ; the staff were amazing always helpful and courteousThe food was first class and top quality All activities fitted in well with the timescale of the cruise Our tour included transport to and from our hotel in Hanoi;s old quarter.We highly recommend this cruise.

Couldn't recommend this more!. We had a night on this boat. Firstly, the staff couldn't do enough to make our stay enjoyable. They were friendly and fun, yet utterly professional and met our every need. Secondly, the food was outstanding. Of the highest standard and catered to our requirements perfectly. We have three young children and I am a vegetarian.With all things, experiences are what you make of them. We sat on the top deck in the evening, had a few drinks, met the other tourists and watched the fabulous sunset. Great evening.Lastly, the manager. who is happy to be called Harry, is just wonderful. He works extremely hard to make sure everyone is having an enjoyable time yet he's great fun to be with.Well worth it!!!

Undisturbed and away from the other cruises. After reading reviews online, I decided to splurge a little and go on a well-reputed cruise ship for Halong Bay and it was well worth the money. Unlike many friends who said Halong Bay is over-rated and overly-touristy, I had a very pleasant and relaxed stay in Halong Bay.Everytime we get on / off the cruise, we were greeted warmly by the staff who took extra care and paid extra attention to every single passenger. It was a small group (maybe only around 20 of us) and the entire service crew made sure all of us felt very much at home. The itinerary was great - on the first day we visited some of the smaller islands with the option to kayak or be in a smaller boat, and on the second day we visited one of the caves (but it was terribly crowded). Other than the cave, we pretty much stayed away from the other cruises so it was only us. We had a family suite and the room looks freshly refurbished. Very clean and new. I love the private deck we had. The food was also very delicious. We were fed to the fullest at every meal. On the whole, it was a very relaxing trip. As we kept away from the other cruises, we had undisrupted scenery of the beautiful Halong Bay. It is definitely one of those trips where you kick back and relax and just enjoy the scenery.

Could not fault this trip. The staff- Harry (cruise manager) was amazing. Great English, happy to help, always smiling and would go above and beyond if needed to ensure you enjoyed your trip. All other staff were extremely pleasant and service was fast and always served with a smile.The food- this came in abundance. There was so much yet all of it tasted very good. Vietnamese cuisine on board- and they catered well to my dietary requirements and I had no less than all other meat eaters. It was great foodThe boat- Very clean, great facilities and very comfortable. The deck was spacious and the sun came out for a while which was extremely pleasant. The activities were endless and all very enjoyable- there is a lot to see and do but this is a great way to explore the Bay and I would recommend this company and team to all.

Staff were so much fun and could not do enough to make our experience the best ever!. From the moment we met our tour host/manager "Mr Bean" and "Harry" (names they suggested we use for them as they were easier than their Vietnamese names), we knew we were in for a fabulous and fun time! They were extremely enthusiastic about their jobs and went to great lengths to make sure our stay was perfect. Although the sky was overcast for our entire trip the views in Halong Bay were still beautiful, tranquil and breathtaking. They day tours provided, kayaking and cave walk were very well organised and interesting. On the boat we were treated to great service by the staff, a fun cooking class before dinner, complete with a light-hearted competition to see who could make the best spring roll, and more food than we could possibly eat! It was a perfect overnight experience and we fitted so much into the time it was amazing. Big group tours are not our preference so we enjoyed the experience with only a handful of other couples sharing the boat. Perfect.

Great Overnight Cruise, Halong Bay. The only thing wrong with our cruise was that we regretted only booking one night. Would thoroughly recommend a 2 day cruise to enjoy the boat, the bay and the experience.Paloma Cruise was well organised. the staff were amazing, helpful, entertaining, couldn't do enough for us to make sure we were happy. Clean, comfortable, air-conditioned cabins. Excellent food and service.On the long drive from Hanoi (4 hrs) our hostess was very friendly and kept us entertained during the manic traffic, crazy drivers. Take a supply of bottled water on board as alcoholic drinks and water is charged for.Bean (our Cruise Director) was hilarious and really made our short stay on board lots of fun.We were very happy with Paloma and wished we had had more time to really enjoy a couple of days more in this stunning environment.

Halong Bay adventure. A nice cruise to see many of Halong Bay's islands. The food was perfect and the staff were friendly. The beds are comfortable. The cabin is neat and clean. Actually the whole boat is neat and clean. Safety is a priority with Paloma. We visited the floating village, the Pearl Farm, Amazing Cave and went swimming next to the beach. It was a bit of a rushed schedule though if you're looking for a relaxing cruise where you lay about. Wifi was present at times, but very dodgy! It was only available in dining room. The cooking class is pretty cool and like a family cooking school. Kate came second in her master cooking skills.A good tour for the price ($120US or $170Aud).

Perfect choice for Halong Bay. We recently did the 3 days 2 nights with Paloma & it proved to be an amazing experience. If you can afford it we would strongly recommend doing the 2 nights instead of the 1 night. Day 2 was the highlight- as all the "1 nighter's" were being taken back to the mainland we were whisked away further into the bays for kayaking/swimming in crystal clear water followed by a BBQ on a secluded beach. Everything about the boat was great, amazing staff, clean comfortable rooms and the food! oh the food!...not only was it amazing but apart from the buffet breakfast every other meal was 6 to 7 courses! Traveller tip: Most people get some sort of shuttle transfer to/from Hanoi to the bay. Be prepared, it's an approx 4hr drive (with a toilet break) on possibly the craziest road I've ever been on. It's a pretty wild ride & a long one at that so it's a good idea to pack some snacks and water.Another good tip is to take a large bottle or 2 of water for the boat, it was really hot on our trip and along with alcohol you have to pay for bottled water. There are literally hundreds of cruise operators at Halong so choosing is difficult. All we can say is that Paloma were professional, accommodating and fun from start to finish, highly recommend!

Gorgeous boat, phenomenal crew. Halong Bay is amazing however you cruise through it, but I really couldn't imagine a more beautiful or romantic boat to cruise around in, or more enjoyable company than the crew that showed us such a great time. The food was also incredible.One suggestion: the suite is worth the extra $30 or so/night. It has big windows on two sides of the suite, and couches that from which to enjoy the view, as well as a complimentary bottle of wine. Win win win!

Amazing experience!. We took the 3 days 2 nights cruise with Paloma Cruise and it was a breath taking experience. The cruise ship was comfortable and the cabins were nice ( we had the twin bed cabin). The food was brilliant (every meal was delicious!). The crew found out it was my birthday and prepared a pleasant birthday surprise for me - with a birthday cake, rose bouquet and a souvenir ceramic plate! Second day was the most memorable - we did kayaking for about 2 hours through small caves, then we made a stop at a secluded beach for swimming and a grilled BBQ lunch by the beach. I would like to say a big thank you to the crew - especially to Harry, Mr Bean and Tam - thank you for taking good care of us during the cruise. We will try to come back next time! <3 love Flo&Francis

Best time in Ha Long Bay. Amaizing crouise, friendly crew, well organized time, not so expensive to drink on board. Great food, great time on board. We took a transfer from Hanoi to Ha long bay organized by Paloma Crouise.They were on time. Its 3-4h drive from hanoi to Ha long Bay depend on traffic. Best choice in Ha Long Bay.

Awesome, incredible trip. Amazing experience. Everything was perfect about the stay. The staff, food, tours, cabins and everything else was great. Would recommend to anyone. Harry and Tom in particular are heaps of fun and add a lot to the experience. Do the 2 night one as well! 1 night isn't enough

Great way to see Halong Bay. We arrived on the Paloma cruise via Vietnam Cycle Tours after booking a cycle trip to Halong Bay. We spent 2 nights on the Paloma boat, it was magnificent. The craft is large, the rooms are excellent quality and the food never stops - and it is high quality! The service of Bin (our cruise director) was excellent. We also had great attention from Tom Collins (nickname) who took us kayaking, swimming and exploring, we then had a wonderful lunch on the beach. I highly recommend 2 nights to see Halong Bay, any more and it could become repititive but if you only do 1 night, you will be rushed and probably not get a real sense of the place

極度划算超值而且專業的下龍灣 TOUR/ It's really perfect cruise is Halong Bay. Hi Harry!! You are such a perfect guide!! We really appreciate that!! 這家我絕對推薦，我們三個人的房間非常的寬敞甚至可以擁有私人的陽台，讓我們待在房間都不想出去，行程不會過度繁忙，還會精確地告知接送飯店的時間，這一切都是完美至極，更不用說下龍灣的景色了，Absolutely Amazing!!!如果餐點在更好吃就好了

The best!! . We travel a lot with my daughter who is now 6. This cruise was one of the best experiences we have ever had on our many travels. We stayed on the Paloma cruise for 2 nights (this is a must, 1 night is not enough and everyone wishes they did 2 nights) We were glad we had the family room with the amazing balcony and the front of the boat. The room was perfect, clean, awesome shower, big, and was just amazing. The service was insane! Tom, you rock my world!! You entertain us, feed us to much, constantly making sure we had a drink in our hand and are so friendly. The second day was my favourite, jumping off the boat, swimming on the beach, bbq on The beach with a beer and a few hours in the totally adorable spa. They go beyond any expectation you have on this boat. Tom took our camera whilst we were on the kayak to take photos of our family for us. My daughter has allergies and they had that covered and needed no reminders. The food- to die for!! You will not be left hungry! You will be spoilt, relaxed and I can promise you, you won't be disappointed. Thank you for an awesome break for the busy cities Paloma. And as you say, "we will not forget beautiful memories" Kase, brad and Kam

Great staff, boat is a bit old. We paid extra to go on this "5 star" cruise according to our travel agency. I was a bit disappointed with the boat- very old, the rooms were not very clean. The bed was comfortable though. The staff was amazing and the food delicious (although they over serve you foods and the constant feeling full is not too enjoyable in my opinion. Also you feel obligated to at least try the dishes and you feel guilty leaving sooooo much of it on the table...). Again staff was good, itinerary was good and halong bay amazing. I do wonder if for less we could have gotten the same value with another cruise.

Great Cruise Company- Amaaazzing Halong Bay. My husband, father and myself went on a 2 night Halong bay cruise. This was thoroughly enjoyed and we would highly recommend the Paloma. As mentioned on many other posts there is sooo much food, each meal is a banquet !, the staff are great. The cabins are small (as you would expect) but comfortable. Just don’t take too much luggage. We stayed in a deluxe room. I understand the only real difference between this and a standard room is the floor level. The boat has 4 levels. A roof top deck/bar area. Level 3 is where the restaurant and bar area is , level 2 has the deluxe room and level 1 is at water level , this is where you board the boat at the rear and is directly above the engine rooms. Not sure if noise is an issue for level 1 but I can say level 2 had great views. It is well worth staying an extra night. The 2 nights just seem to add more value after a long 4hr drive from Halong . Your intiniery is pretty full on a 1 night cruise. What happens with the 2 night cruise is you transfer on a smaller day boat while the larger boat takes the 1 nighter’s back to shore and go exploring further out in the bay . There were only 4 of us on our particular day as it would seem most people only stay the one night. We did loads of swimming, kayaking though small caves in to amazing lagoons and cruised through some really beautiful locations. We were served a wonderful lunch on board (we choose his over a beach BBQ due to the wind at the time).

Amazing 1 night cruise with breaktaking views. I would highly recommend this cruise. I booked a 1 night cruise on the Paloma with 'Best Price Vietnam'. They had the best value for this cruise and also included all the attractions we wanted to see. We booked the suite room, which had it's own lounge area and included a 8 course meal. Please check out my pictures to understand why I would recommend this boat. The boat itself is amazing and the staff are very friendly. At night we also had a cooking class and did squid fishing which was interesting. The bus picked us up from the hotel and after a 2-3 hr ride with a stop over we reached the boat. A lovely welcome, time to rest and enjoy the views from the deck above. Next day we visited the cave, beach and floating village before heading back to Hanoi. Completely worth staying a night with breaktaking views.

Great cruise of a superb attraction. 1. Pick-up and drop-off was made interesting by stops and staff2. On-board staff was excellent and jovial3. Food tasty and in good amount, keeps coming!4. Activities done punctually and efficiently5. Rooms great.6. Excellent overall service.

3 day 2 night trip Halong Bay. I would highly recommend this trip to anyone wanting a relaxing and amazing time in Halong Bay! We booked our trip through 'BestpriceVN' and loved every minute of it. The staff were well organised and very happy and welcoming. The whole boat was very impressive, with chairs/sun lounges on the upper deck/bar area, the dining room and bar area on the middle deck to our rooms. Our room was a double room with a window out onto the bay. It was very clean and really did look like their photos on the website! We were fortunate to be the only guests which booked the 3day trip, so when everyone else left, we basically had a private tour on the second day until more guests arrived in the evening. It was amazing and we were very spoilt; kayaking around the bay followed by the guys cooking for us on a private beach, they even kayaked over a table and two chairs and set up lunch for us in the shade!! The food was really good and catered for vegetarians, there was so much, you really didn't go hungry! The only extra cost was drinks, which weren't excessively pricey. The only thing I was a little disappointed with was the 'cooking class' experience. This was basically just someone showing you how to roll a spring roll. This was the same on both nights. All in all, I had an amazing time and would highly recommend this trip to anyone :-)

The nature is a dream, the service could be improved . Overall, we had a nice and fun experience with Paloma, which we used for a 2 days 1 night experience in the stunning Halong Bay. However, there are things that definitely could be improved.The tour itself was very beautiful and the nature out there, especially at the sunset, is simply breath taking!We picked Paloma cruises among the tons of possibility and we booked it through an agency in Hanoi airport, which for 160 USD each upgraded us to a suite. The suite was very nice and beautifully decorated, with a little living room and two big windows, nice! Air con was a plus as well, very much needed. However, regarding the room, the bathroom was unfortunately too humid and we found two insects. Now, I am not sure this was due to poor cleaning, since the bathroom did not seem dirty, they might just have entered because we left the window opened for get fresh air, or they might be a consequence of the really super humid environment. Probably something should be done to get the air drier.Coming to the other services, the tour we took was awesome, we sailed across the endless islands, visited a pearl farm and an "amazing cave" which was amazing indeed! About the latter, I think that considering the so infighting huge rock formations something more should be said by the tour guide instead of just pointing to close to real life shapes of the rocks. Nothing too tedious but just a few details more would probably be appreciated by many visitors.The service was smooth and very friendly, you can see they really wanted to make people feel comfortable . Also in the shuttle to and from Hanoi, we had a good time and meet interesting people in the group! The shuttle was a bit small but overall ok, they also had a problem on the the way back but were very helpful in helping us get to hanoi in time since we had a flight to catch. Finally, the good itself was superb! Nice selection and very tasty!

Truly beautiful. We travelled as a family - 2 adults and 2 children, aged 5 & 8. We stayed in the fami,y suite which was perfect. Highly recommend this room, the sleeping arrangement, space and private balcony made it the ideal accomodation for us. The cruise itself was magic. Would definitely recommend the 2 night stay though. It's a solid 31/2 hour drive from Hanoi and the overnight stay just wasn't quite enough - really wish we'd booked the extra night. The food was exceptional and the service excellent. Definitely worth spending the money on this premium level cruise

Perfect getaway. I really enjoyed the food, an average of 6-7 course meal in the package! This cruise boat was one of the bigger ones in Halong Bay, so you get a nicer view from the top. The rooms were comfortable and romantic! Staff were really friendly!

Loved it!. Choosing Halong Bay cruise could be a tough exercise as there are so many options! We're glad we ended up doing 2 nights/3 days tour with Paloma Cruise. The service is really top notch and everything went smoothly! The cabins are clean and comfortable and the food is outstanding (although there's too much of it! :)If possible, go for the 2 nights option as the second day provides a great opportunity to explore more remote areas of Halong Bay. We did kayaking and swimming in the spectacular location, getting there by a smaller day boat. We also visited 2 different caves - truly amazing; fishing village and a pearl farm (this is hardly a highlight though).Some improvement suggestions: more activities would've been good! Also getting to a different location each night, or at least cruising around the sunset time would've been much better as all of the boats concentrate in one parking lot every single night. Nevertheless we'd highly recommend Paloma Cruise!

We have had an amazing time here and highly recommended ! . Halong bay was a wonderful place and it even better when you can have such a good service and good place to stay during the trip discover this hidden gem! At the beginning it was a bit difficult because the driver that pick up is could not speak any English either people at the company. But when we met the guide and the team that work in the cruise they are so nice / and kind ! And they speak English pretty well. So communicate was so much easier and much better !Food are good ! Program in the cruise are also very nice ! Cooking class and also visited a lot of places ! That I like the most.Room : only 15 sqm but all fit perfectly.

forgettable experience !!!. We choosed Paloma because of feedback in Tripadvisor and never regret that !It was 5 star cruise from beginning. Staff is just amazing. Mr Bean and Harry made this trip even more better. They talked with every customer as they were one big family There were fantastic 7 course lunch and dinner and it was very tasty and traditional Vietnamese food. As we were in Honeymoon, it was very very nice surprice, that stuff turned off lights, came in and sing to us :). Gave flowers and gift so thats what I can call personal service ! They really care of their customers so much and do their work from heart.Cruise program is also very good and interesting. Cabins are clean and very comfortable so no need to worry about that.Really can suggest Paloma cruises and thanks again Mr Bean, Harry and whole team, who made this trip unforgettable They really care of You !

Fantastic experience from beginning to end!. After scouring seemingly ENDLESS cruise companies for Halong Bay, we FINALLY decided to go with Paloma Cruises, and no regrets since!+++ FOOD +++Amazing menu for each meal. Great variety of food for people with all tastes. Especially loved the spring rolls (world's best! *wink*).+++ SERVICE +++The best staff. Our tour guide Tim was very knowledgeable about Vietnam, history, Hanoi, food, Halong Bay... I can go on... Turned the cruise into quite the educational experience for us.+++ ACTIVITIES +++Somehow, we lucked out and were the only group booked for a 3 day, 2 night tour, so on the 2nd day, Tim allowed us to choose what we wanted to do! We picked rock climbing, hiking, and kayaking, and he was like fairy godfather, granting our wishes! He even allowed us to jump off the boat (shh!). That's in addition to the cave tour and kayaking that is regularly scheduled. Great itinerary planning!+++ ROOM +++Very clean and comfortable, with breathtaking views.When I spoke to some friends about Halong Bay recommendations, they all told me they wish they spent more on a more luxurious experience, and now I know why. Would absolutely recommend the 3 day, 2 night tour for anyone. It's worth it!

A+++ cruise, awesome, must do!. We had an amazing time with Paloma cruises, fabulous staff, expect to see an amazing part of this world, yummy 7 course lunch and dinner. Please don't miss this amazing tour with Paloma

beautiful boat rooms and awesome food. efficient well run enterprise from pick up to Halong bay. The food and staff were extremely good and memorable - appreciate the staff and waiters and Harry who was the perfect cruise manager. The rooms are clean and well decorated with room safe. Drinks are chargeable but prices are reasonable.Our room has a blocked toilet which was quickly remedied. the leaking aircon unit was noted but not fully repaired. 3 points to note:1. we went there during the hot summer months. on the trip back by van, the driver refused to increase the aircon fan speed even though the back of the van was very hot and stuffy. It was a hot stuffy 4 hour trip back to hanoi.2. our aircon was purposely left switched on as we wanted a cool room to return to but on two occasions the staff had switched it off . we found out when we complained to Harry.3. The purpose of the visit is to see the beauty of the Bay. I felt the cruise should have continued on to view other areas of the Bay especially during the sunset times to enjoy the views and breeze - instead the cruise moved on from port to the fish farm and kayak area and then rested in a parking area during the sunset surrounded by many boats and cruises.

Family cruise. There are so many options when looking to cruise Halong Bay. We weren't disappointed when choosing Paloma Cruises. From the moment we were picked up from our accommodation in our Air Conditioned transport to the the moment we were dropped off this company and the Vietnamese people truly do their best to make the experience a good one. We only did the overnight stay but wished we had done two nights. You get to cruise, eat , drink and explore the best of Vietnam. The weather when we went was 40 degrees so some more swimming time would have been good.The host " Mr Bean" was very efficient but he needs some work on his comedy routine and singing!!

Brilliant! Highly recommend!. We spent a two day, one night trip. Transferred by a comfortable, air conditioned car from our hotel in Hanoi to and from the cruise which was stress free. Our cruise was well organised with plenty of activities to fill the day but did not feel rushed at all. Kayaking to visit a floating fishing village, swimming, squid fishing and a cave visit. I was very impressed with the accommodation for a boat. There is not much room to spare, but there's barely any need to be in your cabin other than for a shower and sleep. I doubt there are any rooms that don't provide a beautiful view whilst cruising through Halong Bay. The food was very nice, all new to me as it was Vietnamese and I enjoyed every dish. More impressively, each dish was adapted for my partner's wheat allergy so she never missed a course, never mind a meal. The staff were fantastic. I had lost my camera some where en route to the cruise and 'Harry' tracked it down for me and managed to get it returned to me once we were back ashore. The whole staff are incredibly friendly, professional and a joy to be around.

Awesome Experience!!!. we booked a 2 days/1 night cruise , 2 rooms for 2 families of four with a balcony.view was excellent.everything on the cruise was very well planned.I must say the staff of paloma played a great role in making our halong bay trip a memorable one.they were soo friendly n ever smiling .pick up n drop off was very comfortable.best thing was their super delicious vegetarian food....awesome vietnami dishes. v are a pure vegetarian indian family n were so worried about the food on cruise that we packed with us a whole big bag of dry indian snacks....but but v never had to open it for a single time....n carried it back to hanoi as it is :).A big thank you to all the lovely crew members n specially the chef for making our trip so awesome n memorable.definitely recommend to anyone n everyone.
