Very nice, but.... My new wife and I booked one of the largest cabins for the 2 night/3 day cruise, as part of our honeymoon. The cabin/suite consisted of a large bedroom with private, very nice, bath, and a sitting room. The air conditioner in the sitting room refused to power on when we arrived. Cruise Director "Harry" got it working, once I was able to make him understand the situation. I suspect it was a tripped circuit breaker that was at fault. It happened again, on the second day of the cruise, after a power outage that only lasted a few seconds. One of our bags was delivered to our cabin, then removed while we were at lunch. Again, Harry was able to rectify the problem, but these things prevent me from giving Paloma a 5 star rating. In truth, I doubt that any of these boats really deserve 5 stars, because none of them seem capable of keeping up with the maintenance needed. But, the food and service were 5 star. The excursions were standard. I don't believe they vary much from one boat to another, but they were enjoyable.

Wonderful Cruise!. Our trip to Halong Bay with Paloma Cruises was absolutely wonderful. We did the two night, 3 day cruise in early June. Everything was super easy from pick-up to drop off, and the staff on board are incredible. Our guide, Harry, who had just become manager, went above and beyond to make sure that every little detail of our trip was perfect. He and the whole staff were so welcoming, friendly, and fun to be around. We really enjoyed their company. The boat itself is beautiful as well- the rooms are very clean and nice, and more than I would expect from an average cruise ship. The food is delicious too, and there is so much of it! My boyfriend has a shellfish allergy, and for every course that had shrimp, they brought him a separate, personalized dish to replace it. The activities are so much fun- we liked kayaking best- and they keep you busy. We were a little worried that we would get board being on the boat so much, but that was not the case! Thanks to Paloma Cruises- don't hesitate to book with them!

Highlight of our teip. We had high expectations for our Halong Bay cruise and Paloma exceeded them a million times over. Transfer from Hanoi took approx 3.5-4 hours in an air conditioned van with wifi. We booked the family suite which is the only room type with an excellent balcony with sun lounges so I recommend you book this room! But all the other public deck areas were great too. The food is excellent and it is crazy how many courses they serve. The boat is beautiful and really well looked after. We did the 3 day/ 2 night which I would highly advise (if the weather is the right season) as those who stayed 1 night seemed a bit rushed for our liking. We were lucky to have all sunshine so the swimming and kayaking and day trips were all perfect. The staff are just next level - thanks to Mr Bean, Harry and Phuc for looking after us. Would recommend to anyone and everyone.

Pleasant cruise. Did the 2 day/1 night cruise. Transfer from Hanoi was just ok. The driver and host were cold so the rest of us melted in the back. Took 2 hours to rectify this. Totally different to our return transfer which was a lot more comfortable. We were welcomed by ground staff and Mr Bean (our tour guide) with smiles and warm welcome. The tender from Halong to the boat was easy and safe. Strong hands at the ready if there's a problem. Taken to the dining room for welcome drink, cold towel and key distribution. After a quick trip to cabins and to freshen up it was time for lunch.....a 7 course lunch! This started a major food fest for the next 24 hours delivered by the ever smiling Tian. The food was great but there was a lot of it. Each table would have left at least half the evening meal as there was just so much. All meals were great in quality and presentation. You get asked how the food is by three different people within 10 minutes of each other which is a bit overbearing but it's what they are asked to do so you have to accept that. My biggest reservation is it felt regimented at times with an expectation by the crew that you were to do everything that was planned - trip to the fishing village, cooking class, squid fishing and 'amazing cave' trip. Not everyone goes on a cruise to do everything planned by the company. Cabins were clean and comfortable. Not huge in size but ok for a night. The family suites have a balcony area which is great if you want to spend the money. A good time and it was great to finally get to Halong Bay.

Congratulations Paloma Cruise Halong Bay. I have booked this company for their motor bike tour in Hanoi and visit to Halong Bay.Good transfer to Halong Bay and back to Hanoi- the van looked new and air-con, driver was very safe and if you have been on the road to Halong Bay you will appreciate the need for good driving skills!Beautifully maintained boat, friendly and helpful staff, great rooms and sooo much good food.Family cabin very roomy with a great deck.Plenty of opportunities for activities- caves, kayaking, visit to the pearl farm or relax on the top deck and enjoy the stunning views with a few drinks or massage available.I have found this company to be very reliable- all arrangements where spot on, honest and very good value for money- I will be back.Thanks so much for making our holiday such fun.

Fabulous 3 day, two night cruise. Highly recommended!. I just went on this cruise with my 60yo mother who is not very mobile and a vegetarian. The staff were very accommodating and checked on us regularly to make sure everything was ok. If you need special meals I would not worry as they cater to everyone perfectly. The rooms were clean and cosy with strong air conditioning and a spacious bathroom with shower. The tours to the cave and day trip was enjoyable and the staff really look after you. Special mention to 'Tom Collins' who is exceptional. Although my mum couldn't visit the caves or go kayaking she still enjoyed spending time relaxing on the boat and was entertained by the staff.

Amazing experience!. Really nice cruise with really hard working staff. We loved our 3 days 2 nights experience. The kayaking places they brought us was beautiful. And the food on the cruise was really good and they serve A LOT of food !

A highlight of our holiday, AMAZING.. We were amazed to find that our tour had been changed to a private tour.The 4 of us that travelled cannot thank you and your company enough for this. The boat , the excursions while on board, the staff, the food, all the attention to detail could not have been better. The entire trip from hotel pick-up to hotel drop-off was absolutely fantastic and we thank you all once again and will be highly recommendingPaloma Cruises to everyone we know.

One of the highlights of our trip. The staff on board Paloma are the BEST! The food delicious, the rooms clean, modern and comfortable, and of course the views are simply gorgeous! We went on a 1 night 2 day cruise, which I think is just sufficient enough. We went to see a floating village and to a cave and we had a spring roll making class. We did Tai Chi at the crack of dawn and cocktail sundowners on the deck watching the most amazing sunset. Really was great! There was a bit of a mix up with the driver and which hotel we were dropped off at afterwards tho. I would definitely recommend this one out of the many cruise options out there.

A first class night away. We booked a cruise with Paloma Cruises through Best Price Vietnam, whilst at home in Australia. The booking process was first class and we were even able to pay the balance at their HEAD OFFICE Hanoi, to avoid credit card charges.The whole thing was professional from start to finish. We were picked up by Paloma Cruises from our hotel at the time stated, the van was comfortable and even had wifi for our journey to the port.Joining the boat went without a hitch, the cabin more than adequate with fresh fruit and a mini bar. The boat was of a very high standard with a crew to match. They were very friendly and helpful and went out of their way to please.The highlight was the food. It was wonderfully presented, it was plentiful, it was tasty and every course was explained to the diner. There was beer and wine available for purchase at a reasonable price.We were able to kayak, swim in the bay and visited the caves for a guided tour. I didn't hear any complaints nor did I have any.Even though Halong Bay was full of other boats on their various cruises at no time did it feel crowded or too touristy. The different companies obviously had different times to do the events and we at no time felt rushed or hustled. We really enjoyed an adventure we entered with some trepidation.

Recommend this cruise company. Highly impressed with the service and efforts of the company.. We thoroughly enjoyed our one night cruise in Halong Bay. The staff were excellent and the food fantastic. The bed was so comfortable. They went to great lengths to help when I lost a gold earring which they later found after I flew home and mailed it back to me. The service was very good. Nothing was too much trouble for the staff in making our stay an enjoyable one. Thank you to everyone at Paloma Cruises.

Disappointing. We were booked on a two night cruise in April of this year. The itinerary said that it moored at a different place on the second night, but it didn't and it was never intended that it was. Because the Paloma has people on for both one and two night cruises, it always moors at the same place with a squillion other tour boats. We were very disappointed in this.Having said that, we did get to go further into the bay on the second day and spend 2 lovely hours kayaking in complete peace and quiet. It was lovely. The weather wasn't great, so we had to have our barbeque lunch on the boat - but can't blame the operator for the weather! The lunch was terrific.The boat itself was OK. Cabins were nice, and plenty of hot water - but they were the hardest beds I have ever experienced. Beds are generally much firmer in Vietnam, and I quite like them, but this was like sleeping on a blank of wood! The staff tried to help by putting extra duvets under the sheets for the second night, which I guess helped a little.The food on the boat was consistently excellent. The staff were generally very good, if a little over the top at times.Overall, a worthwhile trip - but make sure you are getting what you think you are if you are going for 2 nights!

Fabulous cruise! . Did the one night cruise with Paloma and am sooooo glad I did. The service was excellent if not a little over the top at times. Our guide Johnny spoke excellent English and had a good laugh with us too.The food was of a very high standard and plenty of it. I don't eat seafood and the catered to me perfectly. The bedroom was lovely with functioning air conditioning and had excellent hot water with plenty of it. The surprise cave tour was certainly that it's huge! The fishing village tour was great too. Had lots of fun on the bamboo boat. The 4 hour drive there was actually quite interesting we saw all sorts of things along the way - got some great photos. I wouldn't hesitate in recommending these guys, I wavered and considered others but am very pleased I chose paloma in the end. You should too you won't regret it!

Paloma Private Family Cruise highly recommended. We booked a private 2 night 3 day cruise with Paloma Halong Bay Cruises for our family of 5 which includes three children of varying ages. The private cruise was ideal for a family as they can cater for special family interests and needs and offer flexibility if you have younger kids. You also do not have to worry so much about your kids annoying other guests (even if well behaved) who may not want kids around so parents can have a more relaxing time. While Halong Bay is a very busy place with numerous cruise companies and boats on offer we couldn't fault Paloma. The crew and personal guide treated us wonderfully. The food was fantastic although far too much - we counted 27 courses all up over three meals! Lunch and dinner was largely Vietnames and breakfast offered a good range of western and Vietnames dishes. We certainly were not hungry. The boat was very comfortable with two private cabins sleeping three in each if needed with ensuite bathrooms. The roof deck had sun and shade areas and there were games on board. The usual activities were on offer which were thoroughly enjoyed (kayaking, Amazing cave, lookouts, floating fishing/pearl villages and school, swimming, spring roll cooking class), but our kids also enjoyed fishing with the staff (and caught plenty) and a lesson in how to fold serviettes in impressive ways! We were not that keen to swim, however, as much of the water in the bay in which the cruise boats operate is polluted with oil/fuel leaks and rubbish (mostly from tourists - please take your rubbish with you and don't spoil this beautiful part of the world!). The kayaking was fantastic though. Thanks to all the staff that made this experience so special. Paloma highly recommended.

Worth the extra cost. Paloma cruises is a little more expensive than some other Ha Long Bay cruises but I think it was worth it. The bedrooms were a good size, had air conditioning, hot showers with good pressure, and lovely windows you could open to let the breeze in. The food was amazing and you never went hungry. Wifi is available on the boat and there are movies played in the common area. The pace of the cruise was also good. We had all ages and fitness levels on the cruise and you could choose to do things or hang out of the boat. I would say most people on the cruise were 35+ so if you are looking for young people to hang out with or party, I would suggest a different operator.It is nearly a 5hr trip to the boat from Hanoi so I found a 2 night stay was best as it allowed enough time to recover from the drive.

Private Cruise perfect for family with small children. We took the private cruise option and had the whole boat for just our family of 4. I did wonder if the kids would get bored (aged 9 & 6) but I couldn't have been more wrong, they had an absolute ball and this was undoubtedly the highlight of our trip to Vietnam for them. The crew were all round amazing, especially with the kids. The food was great quality and the number of dishes at each mealtime was astounding. Definitely no chance of going hungry! The cabins and bathrooms were also of a high standard. I would definitely recommend the private option if you have kids with you as it means you can have a bit more freedom in terms of itinerary and timing, which enables you to flex to your kids needs and also avoid the peak tourist times at the caves etc.

Incredible service, Immaculate boat, Beautiful scenery. Could not recommend more. Staff are amazing couldn't do more for you!! Always asking how you are and if they can do anything for you. Food is amazing, lots of it and a huge range so you get to try a heap of different dishes. Do yourself a favor and do 2 nights, its a 4 1/2 hr drive from Hanoi, so you don't want to be in a rush. Day two will take you further out where there are minimal tourists and you can enjoy the quiet and beautiful scenery. Couldn't recommend this boat more if I went back Id definitely go with them again! our waiter peeled our prawns for us at the table!!!!

Lovely time for our family and a highlight for the kids!. Staff, service, and food were a 5 - thank you to the lovely crew on the Paloma (Mr. Phuc especially). Paloma accommodated our family by placing us in two adjacent rooms, which were quite lovely and clean. We were happy to have chosen the 2-night as so beautiful and takes some time to get there and back from Hanoi. We enjoyed the long boats, kayaking, cooking class, and caves on the final day. My only reason for 4 is related to the full day between the two nights - the itinerary said we would have barbecue lunch on beach and guide said that due to tide, we would just eat on the smaller boat we were on with 7 of us. If really the tide it would be an issue frequently and I don't understand why would call out on the itinerary (which we made boat selection based-on). Maybe not worth it for our small group? Also wish better understanding of what we could 'bring' for that full day away from boat. Loved our little gift at end and overall wonderful!

Great service, great food.. This is the only cruise I've ever been on, so I can't really compare to anything else. If I compared it to a hotel room, it would be great. The staff on the boat were excellent. They were very friendly and really tried to make our time a great time on the boat. We were in a party with 5 adults and 5 very young kids. Often times the staff would come and try to help us with the kids, whether it was holding the baby or showing the toddlers stuff around the boat - just to give the adults some time to eat. Speaking of eating - the food was great, we did a one night cruise so we had 4 meals and they were all delicious. The only meal I didn't fully enjoy was the last one where they tried to make a westernized dish, which was very tasty - but I'm in Vietnam and would rather have Vietnamese food!The one night cruise took us to the floating village - which was neat, but nothing crazy. The next day we got to go to the caves, which I didn't think much of at first, until I got to the cave and got to see it. Wow, very cool.The check in and check out process was very efficient and easy. Overall, we had a great time on the cruise and the employees at Paloma were a bit part of making it so great.
Good. Friendly staff, good food, good facilities in the room.Good tour guide as well!Enjoyed Ha Long Bay 2times with this cruise and the quality is good, too!

Great time. Had a great group for our 3 day/2 night cruise.Johnny was our guide and he was fun to be around. Spent an afternoon kayaking with him and had a great time. Paloma is nice because you see more of the bay than other companies. When we were kayaking, we were the only ones and when other boats did come, there were only a handful. Nice, comfortable rooms and food was delicious, almost too much! There could be more activities to do on board but I'm sure that when the weather is nice, it is more fun. We had overcast, cool weather the whole time but we still had a good time.

3day/2night Paloma Cruise. very nice cruise, food really good. staff very friendly and helpful.However, 2nd day, we were transferred to smaller boat, there were only 6 of us as the rest of the guests had only been doing the 1 night cruise and the big boat had taken the other guests back to drop them off and to pick up new guests!! We had set off about 8.30 a.m. to sail to new location so we could kayak which was good. We had finished by 12 midday,had lunch on boat, because we could not go on beach for bbq or swim because of mist which was understandable, but unfortunately there was nothing else in place for us to do except sit and talk for approx. 3 hrs . We could not go back before 3.30pm as the big boat had not returned with new guests. There was nothing to do until drinks before dinner. Next day we visited amazing cave, which was crowded and far too rushed aseveryone had to be back tohave early lunch. We think a little more thought should be given into the itinerary for 2night/3 day guests if the weather is not good. We felt the 24hr trip would have given us better value for money. We know the companycannot control the weather but they can control the itinerary if the weather is not favourable. We think people should b aware that there are changovers of guests all the time and the groups of people are fragmented and you will not be with the same complete group of people you came on board with. Luckily, our little group of six got on very well - just as well if you are left to talk for 3 to four hours!!.

Truly lovely cruise on a spectacularly beautiful bay. We chose Paloma after reviewing a variety of options. This particular company/boat was supposed to be just a level or two below the absolute luxe top-of-the-line. We were more than pleased with our choice. The boat was beautiful and the service extremely capable and friendly. The food was generous and quite good--each meal seemed to have four or five courses.My only critique would be that they scheduled a few too MANY activities for guests (spring roll culinary lesson, cave tour, squid fishing), and since the boat was not completely full, we did not feel comfortable begging off. But it would have been nice to have more time to just relax on the deck and take in the amazing setting, as one really only has about a day on the bay, between getting to the boat in the afternoon, then having to leave by late morning the next day. I myself was fighting off a cold so I did skip the activities in favor of relaxation, and was very glad I had that excuse! All in all, a wonderful experience, and I would love to go back for longer next time. Halong Bay is hyped so much, a visitor to Vietnam may wonder if it is worth it. It absolutely is!Full disclosure: We were lucky with the weather, mild and partly cloudy with beautiful light, as our companions had done it once before when it was cold and damp, and it was apparently not quite so wonderful then. So that may be a bit of an issue, but, if the forecast seems at all decent, don't miss it!

Great Cruise. We picked the 3 day / 2 night Paloma Cruise after some research on trip advisor and weren't disappointed. Everything was included in the price (kayaking, cave, etc), food was brilliant and plentiful, staff were very friendly and helpful, and the 3 days ran very smoothly. Highly recommended!

Great little cruise. This was a great 24 hours aboard a lovely vessel. The crew in particular did everything to make your stay a happy one. The food was very acceptable and well presented. The trips from the boat were also very good. However, it was not warm enough to go for a swim, but otherwise did everything else recommended. The coach journey is possibly the only draw back getting to Halong Bay, but not as bad as we had envisaged.

Paloma - great mid-luxury-level cruise with good service. Excellent: food/drink, organization, quality of excursions/sights were absolutely beautifulGood: tour guides, rooms, atmosphere, serviceAverage: We would've liked a few more excursions, some of the excursions on the itinerary were less exciting that advertised, and there were never any announcements during the cruise about good times to take photos, when we were passing by certain landmarks, etc. English level of staff could have been better. The itinerary changed a lot (tai chi master on vacation, low tide prevents us from going to certain areas, failure to indicate that the sailing path is actually the same on both days

Serene, great food, wonderful staff. Relaxing! Our family suite with a semi private deck was awesome. Loved the itinerary and food. We did 2 nights, 3 days with our two kids and my parents. Tim met us in Hanoi and travelled with us to Halong Bay. He gave an excellent overview of the city and answered our questions not just on the road trip but during our entire stay. The staff was so friendly and always remembered our kids' names. We did the bamboo boat through the fishing villages but kayaked the following day to the beach. My son and husband had fun jumping from the boat and swimming in the bay (a little too cold for me). We also did squid fishing each night that was enjoyable. Overall, Halong bay was our favorite part of the Vietnam vacation.

Perfectly Executed. Firstly, travelers to Hanoi need to understand that a trip to Halong Bay is a four hour car ride along bumpy roads and there is nothing to see during the trip. The car ride is not through beautiful country side so many people may not want to do a Halong Bay excursion. If you choose to do so, consider doing a 3 Day, 2 Night trip to make the car ride worth it.However, if you decide to take the plunge, then Paloma cruise is a great option. You can find the detailed itinerary on their website and the team executed perfectly against the itinerary - if you like the activities on the agenda you will enjoy the trip. The boat is well maintained and the cabins are clean. The staff is fantastic, especially Mr. Phuc (spelling?) the waiter - he works very hard to make sure that you have a great experience.The boat had a drink special - buy 2 get one free. The kayaking, happy hour, cooking class, thai chi, and cave tour were all fun activities. In the evenings you can also do squidd fishing off the back of the boat. Overall we had a great trip and would recommend this tour company.

Great fun. Shame about the weather! . Booked a 2 day one night tour. The lunch we had as soon as we got on was fantastic, so many courses, really fed us well. Went to the caves and also a boat ride around the fishing village/ pearl farm. Weather was pretty poor, which was a downer. Oh and the next morning myself,and my friend both threw up and felt really run down. Didn't have lunch that day, and had to spend another night in Ha Long Bay, as we were really ill. We are not sure what it was, as everyone else had the same food and were fine. Apart from that, had a fantastic time. The crew were brilliant, so friendly and helpful! Thanks guys!

Great experience. Great staff.. Booked the 3 day 2 night and wouldn't want to do anything less. After a bit of a frantic bus ride from Hanoi to Ha Long the bay looked beautiful (even in the winter.) The boat was really nice and beautifully made. Cabins were small but comfy with private bathrooms. Crew were amazing. Very friendly and always after a good chat. The tours around the Bay were fun (kayaking, and cave visit.) food was tasty and lots of it and cocktails were cheap and delicious.

Beautiful cruise of Halong Bay. I booked the 2 day/1night Paloma Cruise in Halong Bay together with my girlfriend. The hotel pick-up worked well and we arrived on time to board the cruise. The rooms on the ship were very nice and I was positively surprised. Comfortable bed, locker, private bathroom, AC etc. The offered food was for the most part very good and very filling (several courses for lunch and dinner). I also liked the staff, which was motivated and enthusiastic to make the cruise a good experience for everyone. The cocktail party with free sangria and fruits at sunset was a wonderful experience too. Very beautiful views of the bay and all the islands. The activities were great too and I particularly enjoyed the kayaking/boatride with a local around the floating fisher village. The cave the next day was also impressive, but it was very crowded due to the many tourists. For the future, if possible it could be nice to visit another cave or see another part of Halong Bay that is less touristy. I would definitely recommend this tour when you visit Halong Bay.

Fantastic experience with friendly crew and delicious food. Pickup at our hotel went smoothly and was on time despite being in the busy Old Quarter of Hanoi. Our tour guide Tim was very easygoing and spoke good English. The crew on board the Paloma were equally friendly and hospitable. Our itinerary went ahead as planned, and weather was fantastic. Kayaking was one of the highlights, as well as the cooking class. All in all, a great experience.

Amazing crew. Spent Christmas here, wasn't sure how it was going to be like. The hours flew by, despite the rainy weather.The cheerfulness of the crew, together with their enthusiasm made this 2D1N cruise an memorable journey.
Great Cruise, excellent food and service. Went on this cruise in late December. Fantastic place. Cruise was clean, food was great, large variety for breakfast. Staff are very helpful and friendly.

Pleasantly Suprised The Experiance was More Than we Expected. This cruise was our second excursion that we went on while in Hanoi.We booked this cruise from our research online, and were very pleased with the shuttle bus to and from our hotel to the boat. Once on the boat I was pleased that they could actually provide correct fitting life vests for our three children , plus the toddler from another family. We chose the 1 night cruise and booked two rooms one with twins and one with double plus single adjacent to each other perfect for our family of 5 as we took one bag with us. The quality of the cabins was higher than many hotels we have stayed in and we were pleased to have softer beds! The staff were cheerful , helpful and fun. Food was perfectly presented , and we all enjoyed the spring roll workshop. The best organized experience we have had in Vietnam so far!

Beautiful Halong Bay . Thoroughly enjoyed cruising with Paloma. Staff were fantastic. Activities well organised with little down time to relax and enjoy the beautiful scenery if only staying on board one night. Recommend two nights to really appreciate Halong Bay. Cabins very comfy ... didn't want to leave.

Great choice for Halong bay. Fantastic food. This was our highlight in Vietnam. The boat was great. Plenty to do. Staff seemed happy and the food was amazing. Had a beautiful time with friends at Christmas on this boat. Thanks

New years eve 2014. We spent one night 2days cruisre, it was an amazing feeling the views of halong bay . The cruise was one of the medium size cruises and was good they were attentive to evry one's needs. Room was nice and cottage feel and had an amazing view. The itinerary on the cruise was well organised fishing village boat ride or kayaking more fun to kayak . Sundowner on the deck . Next day the tai chi exercises and cave tour. Nye was special fiod was good and the entertainment young boys sang sing and we danced . Cruise team very attentive and friendly.

Pick Paloma Cruises. The boat was smaller and offered a more intimate setting than some of the larger ships. The food was wonderful and plentiful. The staff were all friendly and made the trip enjoyable. The planned excursions were fun to the caves and the fishing village. The only thing I would have done differently is stayed one extra day.

Lovely cruise and breathtaking scenery. We were recommended Paloma by a friend who said that by paying a little more for an overnight cruise would pay off because of the food quality. She was right. The service was exceptional (although there weren't many of us on board) and the boat was comfortable and clean. Food was great and we made our own spring rolls too which were delicious. Tai Chi on the top deck in the morning was a lovely way to get into day ahead and the sights were incredible. I could sit and watch the scenery all day and not get bored, whilst the caves and floating villages are fascinating. Take a kayak if you can - the water's warm (even in winter).

Two nights a must, very good staff. The cruise is quite good. Great food, adequate rooms and a great guide called Danny. Their staff works hard to make you comfortable and their service has a lot of heart in it. Definitely recommend them.

Good time to relax. We, a group of 14 of family members have a 2 days 1 night tour on this cruise. After the long journey of about 4 hours from Hanoi to Halong Bay, Paloma Cruise is a cruise which can let you have a great time to relax and enjoy the beautiful scenery. The cruise members are very nice and friendly, they always carry a smiling face and make everyone happy during your stayed with them. You can join the activities they arranged such as the cooking class, kayaking, fishing and especially the Tai Chi class in the early morning with the fresh air and nice scenery arounds you.The cabin is spacious and well maintained. Overall, we really enjoyed our stayed on this cruise and thank you to the cruise members who had made our holidays with great memories.

Great boat, itinerary and staff. We booked a two night cruise directly with Paloma. Having the extra night is well worth is as the trip out to Ha Long from Hanoi is about 3-4 hours. We knew the weather was going to be a bit hit or miss so we booked a suite so would have a living areas to chill out in if the weather was bad. Well worth the extra and I would recommend it even if the weather was good as the view from the panoramic window is spectacular. The food on the boat was excellent and authentic, you never went hungry. The highlight of the trip has to be our tour guide Danny, he was funny and informative, answering all the unusual questions we could think of about life in Vietnam! I liked that the boat was small as you got to know everyone, some other boats we saw were floating mega hotels not befitting of the environment. The booking team were also good, helping to arrange transport back to the airport directly after the leaving the boat.

Go for two nights. We traveled to Ha Long Bay from Hanoi, 4 hours each way in the tour shuttle, and were glad we had booked a two-night cruise. The trip would have felt too short otherwise, and we wouldn't have seen enough of the bay. We also spent time in Bai Tu Long Bay, which was less crowded than Ha Long, which was great. Our tour guide, who picked us up in Hanoi and stayed with us throughout the cruise, was friendly and helpful, as was all of the staff on the boat. The boat was cozy and clean, and we had some of the best nights' sleep of our trip on the boat. The food started out great and became just okay by the end, but there was more than enough to eat. The kayaking on Day 1 and 2 was the highlight -- because we booked two nights, we had the entire middle day to kayak and hang out on a beach. The tours of the pearl farms and Surprise Cave we could have done without, but as far as we could tell, they're something all tours do, not specific to Paloma. Ha Long Bay was beautiful and worth the trip from Hanoi. Alcohol isn't included in the tour; the beer and cocktails were decent, the house wine was pretty bad. I'd recommend Paloma to anyone looking for a cruise of Ha Long Bay.

Must go for 2 nights. ProsThe boat was not luxurious but it was comfortable.The sunset cruise was the highlight - all guests up on the top deck having sangria and cruising through the bay as the sun went down. Magical!Docking in the bay for the night with all the other boats, I thought, was stunning - all the lovely white boats all lit up against the Halong bay backdrop was like being in Sydney harbour at New Year's Eve!Kayaking and swimming was fantastic on our second day - definitely worth doing the two night tour. One night would not have been long enough.ConsThere was not always hot water available in the shower.Every minute of the cruise was planned and allocated for an activity - it would have been nice to have some more time to sit on the deck and watch the bay, read etc. Rooms were not made up after the first night - not a huge issue but worth noting.The cave visit was very disappointing - there were hundreds of other tourists there and it was like being in line at Disneyland. We were stuck at the same dining table every night and we were always sitting with other guests. We aren't antisocial but it would have been good to have a two person table. We tried to move but were told we weren't allowed to! Very silly. All in all, we had an enjoyable time but I wouldn't go again. I would spend the extra couple of hundred dollars and go on one of the more upmarket boats.

Well worth the trip. Would recommend this as a trip for couples.I had went on the cruise alone, as part of solo trip in Vietnam. Ambience, service, quality of the amenities were really good. The staff were always ready to cater to your requests and ensure that you are having a pleasant experience.For the 2D1N trip, we get to go kayaking on the first day afternoon. Sunny and cool weather with beautiful scenery. Can't ask for more. Other activities include the visit to the cave and a pearl farm. They travelled to Bai Tu Long Bay first, which is less crowded but with scenery comparable to Halong Bay.

Can't bear to leave. We travelled in a group of 6, with elderly and children. Booked a 3d2n cruise on paloma family private cruise. The vessel is small and modest compared to the huge ones in halong bay, but the interior is actually ok. Convenience of not having to transfer to smaller boat when moving to the caves and fishing villages, since the vessel is smaller and can dock directly at these attractions.The 2 rooms come with a double and 1 single bed each. A dining area cum living area. Best part was the top level. We can laze on the seats upstairs, enjoying the cool wind and soaking in the beauty of halong bay. Itz all ours, no need to fight for the seats or best spots for phototaking. Magnificent!Activities were the standard ones among all cruises-kayaking, visit to caves and fishing village, squid fishing etc. I must specially commend the staff on the vessel. They were wonderful and accomodating, always ready to serve our every need. Especially the friendly and meticulous bartender, my kids love him so much. The captain was a very nice man, and was willing to go the extra miles to get tix for us for additional sight seeing upon our request. Really couldnt find fault with the crew..they were a wonderful team!

3D2N - A must!. With so many tour operators on Halong Bay it's near impossible to decide who to go with - if you choose Paloma I promise you will not be dissapointed! Paloma is one of the few operators that (on the 3D2N trip) visits Bai Tu Long bay which is just a beautiful has Halong bay but with out the crowds. More than once we had the bay to ourselves. The service on board is spectacular, all of the staff are lovely and the food is delicious and plentiful. Whilst the boat is showing some signs of general wear and tear, the overall appearance of the ship is fabulous. Our guide Danny was fantastic - his English was flawless, he was so informative and happy to answer any questions we had about Vietnamese culture. He was such a friendly guy who was funny and genuine - I highly recommend this tour company!

Recommended Cruise. We enjoyed our 3d2n on the Paloma. The room(deluxe) is very clean and nicely arranged. The tour guide speaks good english, and is very knowledgable and entertaining. Kayaking is free. All meals are provided on the boat, the food is good but not extraordinary. We were expecting more seafood. The portions are shared with other people on the table. All meals are provided by drinks is chargeable. We made friends on the cruise, everyone get to know each other. It was nice! They even organise a sunset party with free alcoholic drinks. Shame we did not see any sunset.We saw a few other boats in halong bay and paloma looks like one of the highly maintained ones.

Beautiful tour in paradise. We did the 3-day, 2-night tour of halong bay. The cruise was brilliant. The staff and tour guides were great - so friendly and very knowledgable. They really made the trip. The facilities were very good - clean. And the food was phenomenal - absolutely brilliant. I highly recommend.

Memorable cruise. First I would like to thank Huyen Putri who helped me in booking the cruise and also provided us On-Arrival Visa approval letters. I recommend to book directly with Paloma Cruise from their website or through their support team for better rates.I have booked cruise for 2 days 1 night and got a chance to upgrade to Family Suite. The suite given to us is on front side of second deck with private balcony. The suite is amazing, we can have a perfect view of Halong bay.The Paloma staff are very humble and helpful. They have wonderful chefs who cooked delicious food through out the journey. The staff accommodated vegetarian meal request for my wife without any hassles. It is always better to update them in advance about any special meal requests.Altogether it was a excellent trip to Halong bay. Thanks Paloma team for making our trip most memorable.

Wonderful 2 day cruise. This was an absolutely wonderful trip. The staff was so friendly and helpful and the food was delicious. The activities were wonderful. Kayaking, swimming, day at the beach. Room was impeccable. My friend and I had a great trip.

A very pleasant experience!. After a very long search and feeling a bit unsure we should really go for something as touristy as Halong Bay, we decided to give it a try and opted for Paloma! It was a great choice and we were not disappointed. The first day, while cruising around Bay Tu Long, there were just a few other boats around and it felt very special to be there! The cooking class was short but fun, the crew and general atmosphere very welcoming, facilities excellent, food very good and the tai chi class at dawn very enjoyable and relaxing. I enjoyed the second day a bit less, as Halong Bay was way too crowded and after we visited the caves we were sailing very slowly and close to the coastline, so we didn't get to enjoy the scenery that much. All in all, though, it was a great experience and yes, it is touristy for some parts, but, if you still decide to do it, Paloma could be a perfect compromise!

Upmarket Halong tour with great guide!. We did a 2 day, 1 night tour with Paloma and were very pleased with the trip. Positives: clean, comfortable boat with good facilities and nice food, varied itinerary, excellent tour guide with good knowledge of the area, funny and good English language skills. Nice mix of people on the tour. On the downside, the bus from Hanoi could have been more comfortable, felt cramped and was hot (however the bus back was fine), can be fish/seafood heavy on the menu, although where preferences were stated these were accommodated. Overall, we would highly recommend the tour, as would others we spoke to and it seems to be one of the best available.

Great Cruise . The Paloma owners have made great efforts to maintain the prestige and image of an upmarket cruise operator. They depart from a quiet pier and you won't see the madness of the congregation of numerous tourist boats to Ha Long Bay as they depart from another pier. The choice of location gives Paloma the air of exclusivity. On board, food is superb. Service crew is very efficient. Activities are well planned but not exhaustive. At the end of the cruise, I felt that whatever premium price I paid was well worth it.
Beautifull. The ha long bay scenery is very beautiful. It's a very nice place to relaxing. The place is clean. The tour guide is very expeiences. Lie anh Tuan is the best tour guide i ever met.

Lovely but Food Disappointing. The scenery, caves and floating village were wonderful. The vegetarian food was very average. We felt a bit like cattle, and we didn't get to kayak, which was really disappointing.

We made the right choice with Paloma!. So many cruises to choose from, it was overwhelming to me. Finally decided on Paloma, as they could accommodate our no-seafood no-shellfish family, and they had a room for my three teenagers. Sounded perfect!The boat is big enough for 40+ people, but small enough that we made some really great friends. We had so much fun with our new friends, so many laughs and fun times, it was really something. Put 40 people on a boat for three days with no wi-fi, and real conversations take place! The rooms were terrific. My daughter ended up rooming with my hubby and I, refusing to dorm up with her brothers. Teenagers, huh! So it ended up being a bit cramped for the three of us, in hindsight I should of just paid for a third room. It worked out fine though, we really only went to the room to sleep, there were so many other things to do. The meals were fantastic, and the staff very accommodating and true to their word, they made beef or chicken substitutes for my family. It was delicious! We brought extra snacks with us, as my teen boys are always hungry, and wow! we never needed them, they ate so much at meal time! The cokes, bottled waters, and beers were extra, but were so reasonably priced! Thanks for that!!The activités were so much fun, we enjoyed kayaking around the pearl farm (although our kayak smelled like something had died in it .. it was really awful, but ended up being really funny as my hubby and I had fits of giggles while we were trying to paddle). The cooking class ended up being a contest, and was so much fun with our hilarious new friends from England, I nearly had to change my clothes afterwards. We were a pretty rambunctious group, and the staff just rolled with it, they were never phased by us. Not even when we were squid fishing and chanting "whiskey whiskey whiskey". On day two, at a private bay with our own beach, we found ourselves jumping off the top deck of the boat into the crystal clear water! We really had a great time, made memories that will last forever, and met some new friends who will be lifetime friends. Thanks Paloma for such a great cruise!!

Fantastic time thank you. This was one of the highlights of our holiday, the whole experience was very special. We did the 2 nights 3 days cruise and thoroughly enjoyed every minute if it. The crew on the boat are fantastic and go out if their way to make sure that you have a great and memorable time. The food was delicious, our rooms were comfortable and what we expected on a boat like this. We will be back next year and look forward to sharing this experience with our friends. A big THANK YOU to all if you for ensuring we had a lovely time with you.

Nice boat... great staff... great food!. Booked a 2 night/3 day cruise on the Paloma in October 2014. The whole experience was fantastic. The staff in the restaurant and our tour guide Tim were extremely friendly and helpful. The food was fantastic and there was loads of it. The ship itself is really comfy, loadsa places on top deck to chill and take in the beautiful surrondings of Halong Bay with an amazing cocktail. I would definetly book this cruise again. Only downside was we were told there would be wifi and there was not!

Amazing views and quality service. We did the 2 nights three days with Palmoa Cruise. We booked the cruise at the airport as we had nothing organised for Ha Long Bay but wanted to do a cruise. We were picked up at our airport by Tim. On the way to the boat Tim informed us of many aspects of Vietnam. We introduced ourselves on the bus which broke the ice for all of us to chat. We stoped once on the way to the bus for a break as the journey to the boat is 3 and half hours. When we got to the quay we were transferred by tender boat to the bigger boat. We were given our room keys. The room was a nice size. We got the deluxe room. The boat is big with 3 floors and a sun deck on the roof. We had lunch and then we on route for the floating village. This was really interesting. We opted for the bamboo raft instead of the kayak. We were transferred back to the boat for a sunset party and dinner. We ended up having drinks with a couple we had met on the bus. The next day we were lucky as we were the only 2 on the 2 night trip so basically had a private tour the next day around a beautiful beach and kayaked around amazing caves. The food on the boats was amazing. Nearly too much. We were so full. Make sure to let them know if you don't eat a certain food group. They cater for everything. The 2nd night we took it easy and other passengers joined. The 3rd day we were brought to amazing caves 130 steps up from the sea. It was back to the ship again for check out and transfer back to Hanoi. The service on the ship was brilliant. Phuc and Hong were lovely waiters and very friendly. Tim our tour guide was very friendly and knowledgeable. He made plenty of time to talk to us and made sure we were well looked after. We had a problem with the air con the 2nd night but we were quickly transferred to another room for the night and let to leave our bags in the other room. Turns out we were transferred to a suite which was a bigger room and had a balcony. The only thing i would say is that it would have being nice to have our room made up on the 1st morning but I guess it shows the security and privacy of no one in your room. We were told there was wifi at the airport but there isn't any on the boat but it was nice not to have a phone for 3 days

Nice cruise and good service!. Excellent cruise with great service and a lot of fun! Kayaking at the fishing village, swimming in the bay, sunset party and beautiful landcape! The only problem was that Myslef and other people got sick for food poisoning .

Didn't want to leave. My wife and i did the overnight trip on 3 and 4 October. We absolutely loved it and didn't want to get off. We both wished we had done more nights and taken more time to spend on beautiful Halong bay.The boat.....was great. Clean, tidy and comfortable. We were on the second floor and the cabin was great. Aircon was good and the bed was comfortable.The food...what can we say apart from wow. Delicious and plenty of it..almost too much.The staff....perfect in every way. Attentive and friendly.Halong bay....wow. what a beautiful place. Vietnam has a real treasure here and we hope it stays the way it is. The floating villages, the caves and the beach.Paloma cruises you are the best....keep up the great work.Wayne and DebNew Zealand.

I wish I could live on this boat. I originally was booked in for a overnight cruise of Ha Long Bay with another boat, but due to neccessary repairs I was transferred over to the Paloma at no extra cost. All I can say is that I wish I could of stayed forever on the boat.I had a free updgrade to the luxury cabin & the staff, especially Loi were amazing. Five stars all the way. This will be one of the most beautiful memories of my life, cruising a beautiful region of the world on a magnificent boat and wonderful staff.How they managed to produce the food in such a small kitchen was an eye to behold. The silence of Ha Long Bay, not being interrupted by phones and televisions and the crowds made me appreciate the time alone and helped me to refocus on the things that are important.

Recommend 3 days, 2 nights!. The cruise very well organized, the staff were very friendly on board. The guide we had was really knowledgable about wild life and very friendly and funa.The rooms were clean, comfortable and charming. The food portions are huge but every dish is really tasty! They do a really good job accommodating dietary requests. The crew made everybody feel comfortable by allowing us to eat together the first night. However as we were staying longer we were at a separate table the second night when the new 1 night group came which was a bit of a shame. The one issue we had was ourBus ride back to Hanoi. There was a mix up on the address so we were dropped off at our previous hotel, the driver refused to take us to the correct address and drove off...a let down to an otherwise enjoyable trip.

An Amazing experience, thanks to the friendly crew. We took a 2 night Paloma cruise in June, myself, my wife and our 14 year old daughter. We were supposed to go on a larger ship, but the day before the travel agent informed us the ship we were to take needed repairs, so Paloma cruises switched us to their family boat at no charge. We were not sure what to expect, but we were BLOWN AWAY by the cruise. The ship had 2 bedrooms, one for us and one for our daughter- so we had a private ship with 6 lovely crew members attending to us. The cruise was AMAZING - the best food we had in Vietnam... all cooked in a tiny kitchen at the back of the boat. Every meal the dishes just kept on coming... there was no way we could eat all the food. Our bar tender, TAM was one of the nicest people we met in Vietnam. He taught us how to care a rose petal from a carrot and was always smiling and laughing with us. All the crew members were excellent and we felt so at home on the ship... so much so that we were sorry to leave. The ship was excellent all around. I highly recommend this company!

Excellent Way to Experience Halong Bay. Good arrangement & coordination from Ms. Huyen so we have smooth transfer from Hanoi to Halong Bay. We took 3D2N tour so we have sufficient time to enjoy this paradise. Especially the kayaking on second day, scenery is spectacular and environment is so peaceful as the place is not crowded. Food and Room condition is excellent. Crew members are passionate with their job and deliver their best service. Thanks Paloma for giving us a memorable trip!!

2 nights 5 friends happy days on Paloma. We did the 2 night cruise with some added extras, thanks to Ms Huyen Putri, who made booking a breeze! Arriving in Hai Phong the day before the cruise we had a private transfer to a hotel before the cruise and transport to the harbour on the day of the cruise, all on time in comfortable mini vans. All the cruises appear to follow the same format, you are actually on the boat for around 48hrs. Day one cruise is sailing around the bay, off to either kayak or bamboo boat, sunset drinks, dinner and settling in to your cabins.Day two we attended the day trip to the beach, kayaking, swimming and BBQ lunch, then freetime approx 2hrs, sunset drinks and dinner. Day three we went to the cave, cruised back to the harbour, had an early lunch and then disembarked, for transfer to Hanoi. The positivities were the bay it's beautiful...Locals and tourists are doing a great job trying to clean it (We did a rubbish collection on the beach, as did the other tourists on the day we were there)The staff on Paloma: David and Linc were especially nice, funny and friendly. Waitstaff spoke great English and were attentive. The rooms are nice and maintained to a pretty good standard, not 100% but it must be hard when the turnover is high and your on a boat! The food was tasty and plentiful, my only comment is that the rice should be brought out at the start of the meal so you can enjoy it with the meats and vegetables. Things I believe they can work on are: that we did not have rain or wind on the day trip, and they still canceled the beach BBQ......Every morning was a very early start, could be room to sleep a little later. The whole cruise seemed a little rushed, maybe let people eat breakfast till 8am as per the itinerary instead of packing it away at 7:45am. More free swimming time after the day trip we were told we could not swim till 4:30 leaving only 45min free swim time each day! Open the top deck bar at night, so we can stay up a little latter in the night and enjoy the views. I would recommend Paloma, the standard was high, people friendly, food and drinks nice (every 3rd drink free) Thanks for a memorable trip

Halong has great potential.. My wife and I are in our mid to late 30's and have travelled quite extensively around the world utilizing hostel type accommodation right through to 5 star.I didn't have massive expectations for the cruise as it was an over nighter with a bit of an itinery packed in. The drive from Hanoi is about 3 hours or so in an air conditioned van that was fairly comfortable and there was a rest stop along the way which is the usual tourist trap filled with over priced trinkets and food, but the toilet facilities were good.On arrival we sat for about 20 minutes before boarding the tender boat to the Paloma. Everyone was made to wear life jackets which is good but I don't know if they would do any good in an emergency situation, similar to the motor bike helmets which are more for aesthetics rather than serving a purpose.The cruise to the first stop "Floating Fishing Village" was nice. But I would have to agree with other reviews in that the water is full of rubbish and there are oil slicks every where from all the boats (I also contributed to this by taking the tour).I would suggest taking a kayak rather than going on the bamboo boat as you have more control of what you see as the boats just paddle through a ya reasonable pace and don't really go near the caves etc so the photo opportunities are limited. It is nice to paddle around as well and do some exercise, but you are best wearing clothes that can get a little wet.On returning to the boat we had a swim which I reluctant to do at first because of the pollution, but I was glad I went in because it was refreshing. For those that are not confident swimmers I would suggest a flotation device because of the current. I thought the experience would have been better if Paloma provided some floating lounges just to lie back and relax.The meals were good, and the company provided meals suited to dietary requirements which was nice.The inboard entertainment was lacking which I think needs to be looked at. I can appreciate that some people just want to sit and read a book but others like myself would like to socialise, have a couple of drinks and maybe listen to some music or play a game of pool. The top deck is perfect for that but is under utilized. However we bumped into a couple of groups of people that made the evening fun.The Amazing Cave was nice but very touristy and as other people have commented, people are ushered through like sheep. The best part of that morning was walking out the other end and looking at all the seafood caught by the locals (I suppose if you have seen one cave you have seen them all.Our Paloma suite was nice, clean and roomy. Don't be fooled by having a room safe as it is not secured to anything and could easily be picked up and taken away and then oped as it is secured by a small pad lock.I think the suites need a spa bath in the viewing room rather than the two couches and coffee table but that is just my point of view.I would have to say it was mostly enjoyable but it is not something I would do again and I definately don't think the boat, service or facilities were worth the money.I suppose western expectations are different to eastern ones.I was very disappointed with the room dedicated to relaxing as once you are kicked out of your room there are two couches to sit on in the dining area which is in the air conditioning. The only other option. Is sitting on the hard wooden chairs in the dining room or the chairs on the upper deck in the rain or the humid undercover area. I was basically kicked off the couches during the last day as I was trying to relax because some other tourists decided that they wanted to eat I there instead of the dinning room and the staff made me feel unwelcome.I think the Paloma definately needs an upgrade as the upper deck has quite a bit of give in the floor boards. The wall tile in our shower was broken and a large section was just resting above head height.I would have liked to just relax rather than doing some of the activities but the staff seemed quite militant about times and what the guests should be doing.The end price for 2 half hour massages, a dozen beers and sine fruit shakes was just under 1.8 million dong which is pretty expensive for the country but is to be expected in a touristy area.I strongly believe that the tour companies and officials for Halong need to clean up the water ways restore what is potentially a very beautiful part of the world. I am sure the money we paid could go towards an extra staff member to row around the bay and collect the floating rubbish. If every boat that visited did this the bay would be clean in no time as there are hundreds of boats visiting every day.

Very well looked after, but prepare for your trip to be diminished by other tourists. First things first, Halong Bay is a beautiful place.Second things second, over the last 20 years, it's developed into something of a tourist trap. Which is a big shame because (like Angkor Watt) the sheer numbers of visitors detract pretty significantly from what makes Halong Bay special in the first place. I thought this would be one of the absolute highlights of a 4 week trip around Indochina. And to be honest I was a little underwhelmed.Despite some of the attempts to differentiate one cruise company from another, from what I could tell, there isn't much to separate them. They all follow pretty much the same fixed routes and itinerary. All you're really paying for is a better standard of boat, staff and food.We chose to push the boat out (excuse the pun) by selecting Paloma Cruise. It's towards the premium end - and for this we were housed on a beautiful vessel, were served by some very attentive staff and were given great quantities of very tasty food. However, you didn't have to look very hard to realise that you're just part of the relentless conveyor belt that will ultimately spoil Halong Bay - which made me feel slightly guilty for being part of the problem. Paloma is beginning to get a bit tatty around the edges. It's now four or five years old now, and is in need of a little TLC. The varnish is beginning to flake off in places, and the soap dish was hanging off the wall in one of our rooms. All perhaps signs that the punishing and relentless schedule are all taking their toll. At points I felt the pre-eminence of the unrelenting schedule became too dominant - with the ship needing to be in certain places at certain times of the day - with the upshot being that we felt quite rushed to finish one part of the itinerary and get on with the next. On the upside, our main chaperone, Tim was very attentive and informative. He spoke excellent English and offered some great insights into life in Vietnam and Halong Bay.And a big shout to Phuc, one of the waiters on board the Paloma. He was, without doubt the friendliest and smiliest person we met in the whole 4 weeks we spent in Indochina. He was extremely helpful and attentive. The world needs more people like Phuc!Some of the activities were great. The canoeing was fun, as was the beach visit and the trip to the floating markets and seeing where they fished for pearls and cultured them. But I was pretty under-whelmed with some of the other activities. I was really looking forward to the squid fishing and the cookery class. But both turned out to be 'froth' rather than anything more substantive. The cookery class lasted all of 10 minutes and amounted to nothing more than putting the pre-prepared ingredients onto a sheet of rice paper, and rolling it into a spring roll. And the squid fishing was just a lucky dip, dangling a length of bamboo with a line lashed to it over the side of the boat and hoping for the best. Within a quarter of an hour everyone had given up; and no-one bothered to take it up on the second night. And the amazingness of the Amazing Cave visit was totally compromised by the fact that it was a total tourist trap with a constant procession of tour groups. I'd rather not have bothered.Watch out for the cost of drinks on the boat. I'd expect a bit of a mark-up, but we were paying pretty much double and in some cases three times what you'd pay for the same drinks in Hanoi. You will get a small bottle of complementary water every day, but given the heat and humidity, this isn't sufficient - so you'll end up forking out extra for paid water. Surely unlimited complimentary water isn't too much to ask for guys, when we're paying premium prices for the cruise. Perhaps this could be paid for by cutting back on the amount of food which was served. It was all very tasty, but each meal consisted of 9 to 11 courses and we always left at least a third of our food because we couldn't fit it in! Other guests were the same. And our first night was spoiled by a rude and ghastly (Brazilian?) family, with nanny in tow, and absolutely no sense of decorum or the fact that they were sharing a space and experience with a group of other people. OK - I know Paloma have no control over who comes on their boat (in fact, the captain dealt with them very well, with courtesy and grace). But it was a reminder of how much your enjoyment of trips like this is at the mercy of other guests.

The only way to see Halong Bay. Courteous, clean, thorough and attentive are just a few words I would use to describe the 5 member crew aboard our private junk boat in Halong Bay. 1 tour guide, the Captain, a cook, and 2 mates were so friendly and pleasant during our tour. The scenery and beauty of Halong Bay is there for all to see and is self evident but a private tour is most definitely worth the few extra dollars to accentuate the experience. The food was excellently prepared, artistic, and most delicious. I agree with other reviews that it was almost too much. But that is never a problem. Perhaps abort the departure lunch at 10:45 AM after a FULL breakfast at 7:30 AM. Paloma cruise is professional throughout and I highly recommend them.

Paloma Cruise. We did the group, 2 days 1 night tour in November 2013. We were picked up by minivan, on time from our Hanoi hotel and it took around 3.5 hours to get to Halong. At the port we handed our luggage over and boarded small boats to be taken to the Paloma. The crew were smiling and waving ready to greet us. We were given refreshments and a short talk about the boat and general information. Our luggage was taken to our cabin for us. Couldn't fault the boat at all. Food was great (lots of it) service was good and the boat was clean, in good condition and really nicely decorated. It felt pretty special to be honest. The activities give you a good opportunity to chat to other people on the boat. Id say kayaking around the floating village was the highlight. Those that would rather sit back and relax had the choice to board a bamboo boat instead. Our group was actually the only other people at the village, aside from the villagers themselves. Id say the amazing cave was pretty dull, but I'm not that into rock formations, some might like it. We did have a guide who was with us throughout the 2 day tour. I struggle to remember his name but he was friendly, knowledgeable and spoke very good English. Didn't get up early enough for the Tai Chi, wish I had, would have been nice on the deck in the morning! All in all, we had a great time, ticked all the boxes for us!

Good Cruise. Recently did an overnight cruise with Paloma, we were unsure when we booked about 6 months ago but they came through pretty well. Boat was nice, food was excellent, really surprised us with the quality, after 6 days in Hoi An they had a tough judge. We had a problem with our suite but Loi handled it well and had us moved. It's a 3+ hr trip from Hanoi to Halong, get a private transfer if you can, worth the extra money (a big thumbs up to Brian our driver.)

Fantastic Cruise. Great boat, great food (all food allergies were catered for), great service. Like many people say the are is a bit polluted and at times crowded, Paloma did their best to avoid this. All in all, it was hard to fault.

A treat with a private boat. We were Not up for a cruise with tourists so took the private option. We had our our own boat with 2 beautiful cabins, sleeping 6 people in total. 5 staff who could not do enough to help us without being stuck to us. Very friendly and made us feel really at home!! Ling our host was brilliant! We were very free to do whatever we felt like, kayaking where we wanted, when we wanted avoiding all the crowds. With 2 children, definitely the best!, I am not mentioning the food who was outstanding! We had so much to eat !, king prawns on different recipes and perfect presentations! he girls learnt to fold napkins! and taught knitting tricks to the batman.... Awesome family atmosphere. Exclusive feeling which made you ignore litter and other boats more easily. Definitely worth the extra penny!!, would not do it any other way!! Bravo to the crew awesome team!! 3 days is the way to go. 1 night not enough,
Great cruise. 3d/2n cruise definetly worth it. Amazing tour in remote places of the bay. Plenty of good food. Worth the time and money.

Great, but don't do everything on the itinerary!. Paloma Cruise is an attractive option because on the first day, they venture to Bai Tu Long Bay, a far less touristy portion of the bay. It was such a treat to not see any other cruise ships all afternoon until sunset. We particularly enjoyed kayaking and swimming in the bay. Our cruise was around half full, and they graciously upgraded everyone they could. The guests were mostly couples or families.With only 2 days/1 night on the ship, I recommend not doing everything on the packed itinerary. While they do tell you that everything is optional, it certainly doesn't feel that way. I would skip : the cooking demonstration, the squid fishing, the cave visit the next day. There's very little relaxation time, which is counter intuitive. Force yourself to say no!The ship is in good shape and we were more than satisfied with the rooms. They almost served too much food! The service of the staff is fine, though we felt that some of the workers didn't want to be there. Regardless, we were happy with our experience and only wished we were on the water longer!

Good...but room for improvement. Went for a 2 day/1 night cruise option with Paloma as they were reasonably priced and based on a recommendation from a friend. I had to call them the day before the tour to confirm the booking and to confirm that they were going to pick us up and to confirm the time. I had thought that they might have done that by email?It takes a few hours to get out to the boat but they are great at getting you out and boarded as quickly as possible. We had a welcome drink on board and then sat down for an introduction. I found this a bit forced and felt like we were being fed some propaganda as to why Paloma was so good, but hey, its a cut throat industry and they want to make sure we have the best time.We were fed lunch immediately following the into introduction - It was a 7 course set meal which never seemed to end. All of the food was included but we had to purchase all drinks including water.(I thought that some complimentary water might have been nice however everything had to be purchased and we were a captive audience with no other option).The rooms on board were nice and had air con which was great. We went for the basic room, and thought they were fine. you don't end up spending any time in your room anyways, so we didn't see the point in spending more.We were told that we could do as we want but it felt like this was not the case and that everything was very regimented. More free time would've been nice just to take in the beauty of it all. I understand the difficulty in getting us to see everything. I also think that there could have been more information provided and more explaining of the history. It was brief when we got to the floating village and very noisy making it difficult.We had a good time and met some very nice people so overall it was a good trip. I just think that there is some room for improvement, They are a bit forced in the way they script everything and you almost feel forced to smile or they think you're not enjoying yourself.

Wonderful scenery and great food. We went on the 2 day 1 night cruise with Paloma. It is about a 4 hour drive to Ha Long Bay with a couple of touristy souvenir stops along the way but we were lucky enough to have the shuttle to ourselves on the way there. Once we finally got on the boat the facilities were good and the food was plentiful and excellent. The activities are fairly typical - visiting a floating village and the Sung Sot cave, but we did enjoy these. The staff were very friendly and helpful, especially David, and overall we enjoyed the trip, although it is a long way to go for less than 24 hours on the bay.

Great cruise, long journey. My family recently did the two day/one night cruise aboard the Paloma. We managed to get a triple room for us and our 15 year old son which was great as not many companies offer this. This room is right up the front with it's own sun lounges and balcony so very nice. The rooms, food and staff were all excellent however we found it very regimented in terms of time for activities and not much leisure time. The road journey is about 4 hours each way.with obligatory stops at the usual tourist traps for snacks and souvenirs. My only other criticism is the fact that you leave very early for the return journey when you could probably have more time on the cruise. You then sit around at the holding area (on land) waiting for transport to return to Hanoi for over an hour which is quite boring as there is nothing to do there.

Glad I did it but would not do it again. We did a two day/one night cruise on the Paloma starting in Hanoi. The bay itself is spectacular and is truly one of the natural wonders of the world so I am glad I was able to see it. The 2 days is hardly actually very short so if you have time it is best to do 2 nights and 3 days. In total you are only on the boat for about 22 hours and spend 8 hours driving in a cramped bus. The tour starts with a 4 hour drive in a fairly cramped mini van. The road is poor and they stop at a tourist trap style privately owned rest stop where there is a mind boggling array of handicrafts for sale at laughably high prices. They also stop along the way at pearl sales center where you can see how pearls are made and also gasp at the prices of the products for sale. You then arrive at the Paloma office and are efficiently boarded onto a tender then onto the ship itself. Once underway an excellent lunch is served as you cruise between the islands. In the afternoon you are able to kayak or take a small boat through floating village and also to swim in the bay. This is followed by a sunset party on the top deck and another wonderful meal. There are also various post dinner activities. In the morning you are served breakfast between 7 and 8 am and there is a tour to a nearby cave. The cave itself was large and interesting but the experience was entirely sullied by the number of other tourists packed into the area. I would not recommend this experience. Following the cave tour there is then a mad rush to get you out of your cabin and lunch is served at 10.30 so they can get ready for the next group of passengers. The ride back to Hanoi was cramped despite the fact two minivans came in that morning, they crammed all 10 of us into one van and also put a sick crew member in the front of the van. I would recommend you arrange your own transport to and from the boat. The bay is very well preserved but that means that boats can only moor in certain places so in the evening you are surrounded by a lot of other boats, giving the setting a slightly cramped feeling. All in all the Paloma staff were excellent and I am glad I got to see the bay. I would not repeat the experience again however.

Magic cruise! Definitely worth paying a bit more for Paloma. I did the two day, one night cruise and wish I'd had time to do the three day two night! The cruise was beautiful, the cabins are fantastic, meals delicious and staff were helpful. Highly recommended!

3 Day Trip A Must - Great value for money. We'd put Halong Bay on the Vietnam "must do" list for any traveller to this country.And if you are coming to Halong Bay - definitely consider the value for money 3 day Paloma Cruise (we booked through Darien Culbert who was excellent).We booked the "honeymoon" suite at the end of the boat with its own balcony as we had never been on a "cruise" and were worried whether we'd enjoy the experience.It delivered beyond our expectation (although we were not able to do the BBQ on the beach as the local 'inspector' for some reason would not permit our group to do so).The highlight was the middle day with the kayaking through the karats into hidden little bays away from all the other tourists.Food was plentiful and great. And we enjoyed the company of others on the boat more than we'd expected and randomly saw our shipmates in various other destinations as we toured the country - one of those crazy "Closing Doors" wonders of the world.Well worth investing in is the room with a verandah....lovely to have your own bit of outdoors and Paloma makes this affordable versus some of the much much more expensive trips.We paid $360 AUD per person and felt this was really great value for money.

Lovely cruise. Booked through Halong Bay Legends who, despite my concern as there isn't much about them online, were excellent. The cruise was much more upper class than the cheaper one I have done previously. I really enjoyed getting dropped off in the Paloma cruise terminal - they have their own port so you aren't with all of the other tourists like on the cheap boats. The rooms are lovely with aircon and lovely showers. The food was excellent and there was so much of it. Unfortunately though the whole cruise felt really hurried and there was little time to actually enjoy the boat, and it isn't any different with 3 day cruises as you are on a day boat all of the 2nd day anyway. Staff were so pushy about everyone joining the activities but with only 2 loungers on the top deck there is nowhere to relax on the boat except for uncomfortable chairs on the top deck. I didn't like how the tour guide said we had to tip the wooden boat people at the fishing village - he recommended a high price of 100,000VND (hourly rate in Vietnam is a fraction of that for many people), Paloma should consider paying these people sufficiently so that guests aren't expected to fork out more money. A tour guide for another boat waiting behind us told his customers to choose the wooden boats because they are completely free but you have to pay for the kayaks?!

Nice and relaxing cruise. There were three of us on the cruise, we've stayed for one night. Price was reasonable. We were surprised to realize that all drinks, not only alcoholic, were chargeable and not cheap. I suggest that you will buy drinks before you get on board. Other than that, cruise was great, food was fantastic and plentiful. Activities included squid fishing at night, cooking lesson, kayaking to a stunning floating fishing village and visiting an impressive cave. All activities were fun and there were many photo opportunities. .. to sum it up: very good - buy all your drinks before you go on board...

Stay for two nights!!. When planning our two week trip to Vietnam, I was told by several people to stay for two nights in Halong Bay!! I am SOOOO glad I took their advice. We used a tour agency who set our cruise up in Halong Bay so I did not do any research but Im sure happy with what they chose. Be prepared for a long drive from Hanoi on a bumpy road with other travelers in the van. There is no way around the long travel and roads but it will be worth it when you get there. That is why I suggest staying two nights as you will NOT want to take the long journey back the very next day! So while on the drive you will stop at a souvenir shop & restroom. DONT buy anything!! Its all OVER PRICED and you can get the same things in Hanoi!! Especially if you are interested in the silk, embroidered pictures! They are beautiful but we bought ours for HALF the price in Hanoi (SAME picture). Once you get to the bay, the process runs quickly and you will soon be welcomed aboard by a helpful & friendly staff. Once on board, they will explain the itinerary and times for everything. The manager & tour guides are great at making sure you know the plans. Lunch will be served while your bags go to your room. We had two rooms (one for my husband & I and one for our two children). The rooms were lovely and had everything you will need. Yes, they are small but the boat is not that big. You will hardly be in your room so that is not a concern. Our room had a balcony and it was quite roomy and nice to open the windows and doors to enjoy the morning views. I suggest you splurge for the balcony if you like to sit outside for a cigarette, glass of wine in the evening or coffee in the morning. IF you are unable to do that--no worries--the views from the sundeck are even more gorgeous. The boat is small so its no big deal to go up a few decks to the top.
