We were very surprised how cool the weather was!! If traveling there during one of their 4 seasons, then check the weather as we needed jackets! The weather was actually pleasurable but not completely sunny. But the guides said we actually got the better weather as the weeks and days before it was raining and overcast. So be mindful of the time of year you go and what the weather will be like. We traveled the last week in March and I believe it warms up in April. The activities are nice and you will have lots of opportunities to take great pictures and visit all around the bay. When you go to the floating, fishing village, I would choose to go on a rice boat and have a rower as this will enable you to just relax and take pictures and take in the sights at sunset. You can kayak if you choose but you will have another day to do that if you stay two nights. We also enjoyed the hike, kayaking, squid fishing, and the tour of the caves. You will be active which my kids love but when staying the 2 1/2 days, you will have time to relax too!! Its a perfect mix! The food is very good and they try so hard to make it beautiful and the staff is wonderful. We always had too much food and sometimes the repeat of the same things but we were all satisfied. Two of us do not eat seafood so they were always accommodating. They do have a sundeck party in the evenings but it was never a "party" but I think that just depends on the group and mix of people you have. Also the weather was a bit chilly up top. They offer free Sangria and that was really good. Prices for drinks were very reasonable. We did try the "spa services". This was the only thing I was disappointed about. The room is just a cabin and its not set up to have any spa ambiance like music, low lighting, candles, etc. I could totally overlook that if the services were better. Do NOT get the facial. Its not a facial!! Just rubbing lotion & oil on your face over and over. And the products are just cheap over the counter stuff (like Ponds). I did get a massage and that was better but you could wait and get those things done better & cheaper in the city. Overall--Halong Bay is a must do and we were extremely pleased with this cruise line!! So if you are researching then search no more and book the 2 1/2 day package and you wont regret it--otherwise after one night you will be telling yourself, "I wish we would have stayed longer!"

First Rate. We stayed one night on a Paloma cruise ship on Halong Bay. This company was excellent to deal with from start to finish. They answered all questions before we got there promptly, clearly and honestly and all our arrangements worked out perfectly. The actual experience once they picked us up was excellent. It was first class all the way. They take very good care of you. We enjoyed our guide and the scheduled activities. The boat itself was lovely, clean and elegant. The meals were several courses and quite good, although at times I did wish they did not take so long. Our daughter left her wallet in her room and when we called later that day from the Haiphong airport they got right on it. Before we left our next destination, Hoi An, we received it via special mail service. A huge thank-you for making sure that happened. Big kudos

Had a great time. There seem to be 100's of tours cruising halong bay of various different qualities and themes and it's hard to choose but I doubt anyone would be disappointed with this one. It was a very mixed group on our cruise of families and older and younger couples. As part of a younger couple I felt like they probably got a good balance of things to do so you didn't feel like it was all weighted towards any particular group. Also they seemed to time excursions well when what we were seeing was fairly quiet. I loved the kayaking and open water swimming most but everything was good. It's a full schedule but you don't feel bossed or shepherded about just entertained. There is LOADS of food given to you during the cruise all included in the price and all delicious. There's a bar on the boat and a nice terrace. Drinks are reasonably priced (and strong!)Tour guide seemed a lovely guy and very knowledgable. Cabin was comfy and it was just really cool to spend the night on it in the bay definitely worth doing.When your considering what cruise to take I think if your going from hanoi like us something that really makes this company worth picking is the transport you go in. It's a long (4 hour) drive to halong bay on a very undeveloped bumpy road. These guys take you in new comfy minibus with air con. We saw lots of other much less appealing buses heading the same way which would have been a lot less fun and at least two broken down at the side of the road which would ruin your trip! For what you get this was not expensive.

Great Choice. I really struggled with which boat cruise to go on in Halong Bay. I also struggled with the decision if it was worth the 4 hour drive each way. I can say that it was definitely worth the drive and I was really happy I went. I was also happy that I chose Paloma. (After days of research I had narrowed it down to Bhaya and Paloma). Our guide and the crew were amazing. Very helpful and provided top-notch service. The food was really good, the boat was clean and well maintained. We (I was traveling with a friend) enjoyed all of the activities (kayaking, floating village, pearl farm, spring roll making, squid fishing, tai chi, suprising cave, etc..). We also lucked out with a great group of passengers on the boat. If I had to come up with something to complain about, it would be that the beds are quite hard. Otherwise, everything else was great. I highly recommend the Paloma, after angonizing over the decision, I was really happy with my choice.
